animal.description:
Birthdate: 4/15/2015

Breed: One of a kind

Our handsome boy Messi matches his soccer namesake in grace and footwork! His super-stardom knows no bounds! Messi just needs the right coach to help him reach his full potential. He is a top notch fetch player! Messi is around 4 years old but set his sights on a pool, stream or river and he goes into full puppy mode with excitement, splish splashing about in the water. After a bit of exercise, he enjoys lounging about in the sun or snuggling with his buddies. Messi also likes spending time with his dog teammates as well! 

*Messi is on a training plan and requires more than one visit with our Behavior team. If you are interested in meeting Messi, please contact us at adoptions@pawscrossedny.org for more information!*

Before you can adopt sweet Messi, please complete an adoption application on our website at pawscrossedny.org! Once your application is approved, you will receive a link to schedule an appointment online. If you have any questions about Messi, please email us at adoptions@pawscrossedny.org for more information. Please understand we cannot hold any pet. All adoptions are done on a first come, first adopt basis for approved applicants.

The Shelter software system requires that we choose a predominant breed or breed mix for our dogs. Visual breed identification in dogs is unreliable so for most of our dogs we are only guessing at predominant breed or breed mix. We encourage you to select your new companion by considering each dog's individual personality and pet qualities instead of relying on a breed label that is only a guess.

animal.description:
Available in the Midwest and New England regions - Meet RALPH!

Ralph!  Our big boy Ralph has a few similarities to the movie Wreck-it Ralph’s main character. Both Ralph’s want to be a hero and fulfill their dream. Our Ralph’s dream is to have a home of his own with an active family who will love him. Ralph is going to save you from a life of boredom.  

Ralph is approximately 3 years old. He is a stunningly gorgeous, smart, strong, active, high energy dog, who needs a firm handler and an adopter committed to training. Ralph loves people! Ralph is a very nice dog and has all the potential to be a well-behaved dog. He just needs to learn all the rules and have an owner who is consistent with the rules. Ralph already knows sits on command and takes treats nicely. Ralph is very dominant, so he needs to be the only dog in the home or go to a home with a very submissive dog. Having a dominant dog is controllable and manageable and a qualified trainer will teach you all the tricks and techniques. Do not confuse dominance with aggression. Ralph just believes what is his, is his and what is yours is his. He does not like to share anything with his dog buddies. Because of his dominant nature, Ralph needs to go to a home with older children.

On the plus side, Ralph loves to play and would make a great walking, jogging or hiking partner. He enjoys his toys and loves play time outside. He does play hard but he also settles down nicely.  

Ralph will chase cats, squirrels, and other small animals. Ralph will need a fenced-in yard, no electric fence for this guy. Ralph is current on vaccinations and is on monthly preventives. He will be microchipped before adoption. Ralph keeps his kennel clean, but continued house training will be needed.  

Please do not overlook this gem. He is a little rough around the edges, but with the right owner and training, you will have a great dog and lifelong companion.

If you are interested in adopting, please complete an application at www.luckylabrescue.com

animal.description:
** MEDICAL SPECIAL NEEDS **
Merry Christmas from Kelly! Kelly was asking Santa here for a home for Christmas. Do you think you can help her out? Kelly is guessed to be 5 years old and has already spent 3 Christmases at Satchel's. She has so many volunteer fans who don't understand why she is still at the shelter because she is so loving. It could be that her body is unable to keep her kidney values stable without some help from subcutaneous fluids. We don't really know why but with her twice a week flulid supplements, her values remain stable. Our vet doesn't believe this will, in any way, shorten her life or cause her any pain as long as she continues to get her fluids. She patiently stands for the 15 minutes it takes to give them to her. So should this really be why she has to live out her life at a shelter? Please consider opening up your heart and home to Kelly and give yourself an amazing Christmas present in 2020. A present that should go on giving for many, many years.
Kelly weighs approximately 55 lbs and is guessed to be 5years old. For an appointment to meet her, please email adoptions@satchelslastresort.org or call 941-924-5070.

animal.description:
MEET VEYA!!!!! How this sweet soul ended up homeless is a mystery. She continues to amaze us with her calm, happy, and goofy demeanor!

Miss Veya has decided in her golden girls that she would like to be the only four legger in the home, it's her time to shine! She likes to relax, go on walks, play, snuggle in the bed, ride in the car, watch you eat or cook, and she is easily directed when you want her to go outside, into a kennel or car, etc.

Veya will warm your heart and your feet! (She loves to sleep on your feet when you are sitting down.) Veya is very food-motivated and only wants to please her human! Thanks to brisk walks, Veya has shed some unwanted pounds and is full of energy!

Veya has never had an accident in the house, never destroyed anything and has never showed any type of aggression toward kids/adults.

Veya had surgery and had one of her hips removed to remove a total hip replacement later on down the road. Due to this, she needs a home with no stairs and will need ongoing medication. ($20 cost each month).

If you would like to meet this dog, please visit our website for our adoption application, www.underdogaz.com or email

animal.description: 6 y/o pointer/pittie, male, green eyes, very protectiveI am Grayson and I've been in rescue quite some time. I am a sweet boy. My perfect home would be an experienced female owner versus a first time owner. I would really like a fenced yard to run and play in and also someone who takes me for walks or on some adventures. I adore trails and stuff but am not a huge fan of swimming. If you can help me I know I can be a very good boy and will become your best friend too. Grayson is a beautiful pittie/pointer, male with green eyes. He will melt your heart. He has been at Castoff way too long. Grayson would make a fabulous companion for any woman. He loves the ladies. He is the type of dog that shows total loyalty and protection. Grayson needs a fenced hard so he can run. He loves attention, loves to run and play but is not great with other animals. In his past he has been abused and thankfully he came to Castoff. This is why we are looking for a female that would love a great watchdog and a forever companion. He is totally vetted, and walks well on a leash. He would need to be a only pet and he is way ready to find his person. 2/1/21 2:28 PM

animal.description:
Sammi (Samet) came to us from Thailand where she lived at en elephant sanctuary until being flown here in late 2016. She's been fostering with the same Underdogs foster ever since and they think she's just a sweet, sweet doll! When she first arrived in the U.S., she would hide under the couch or bed all day and only come out at night, but she's improved about 1000%. She really likes familiar situations, places, dogs, and people. (For instance, she LOVES her dog friends.) Walks and car rides are still a bit spooky, but she makes strides every day. She loves cuddling in bed at night, and does NOT like being crated. In short, Sammi is a sweet, gentle, timid lovebug who is searching for her very patient and understanding forever home.

Underdogs Rescue has partnered up with the Elephant Nature Park in Chiang Mai, Thailand to help save some of the 400+ dogs they have living on the sanctuary. While most of these dogs have come to the park following natural disasters or from situations some of us couldn't even fathom, these dogs are full of heart and ready to begin a new life in the US with a family to love them!! More information about ENP can be found on their website here: http://www.elephantnaturepark.org/ Help us help them by fostering or adopting one or more of these sweet babies looking for a new life!

Sammi is spayed, up-to-date on basic vaccinations and microchipped. Our Underdogs adult dog adoption fee is $300, which includes spay/neuter, microchip, and up-to-date vaccinations. 

If you're interested in adopting Sammi, please fill out an adoption application here: https://underdogsrescue.org/adopt-form/

Underdogs is a small volunteer-based animal rescue and we unfortunately do not have the resources to respond to phone and email inquires about our adoptable animals at this time. If you're interested in learning more or setting up a meeting with one of our animals, please complete an adoption application first. It may take up to two weeks for application review and one of our coordinators will reach out to you as soon as we are through the intitial review process. We appreciate your patience and understanding! Thank you!

animal.description: Shenandoah is an 11 year old gal who needs some love. This lady enjoys her daily walks, tries to play ball (she used to love it in her younger years, but she has slowed down quite a bit in recent months) and is not shy about letting you know she is going to be the only animal in your life (cats, birds, lizards, dogs, tasty little rodents, etc. are declared an invasive species and she will dispatch them at her earliest convenience) but she LOVES people and is quite affectionate. She may only have a few years to offer you her love, but those years are the best years she has to offer. She is not a good candidate for dog parks. Shenandoah weighs between 50-60 pounds. She qualifies for Silver Paws program, matching senior dogs to seniors. Adoption fee is paid by the Paws for Love Foundation. Wouldn't you like to be the one who shows her how wonderful life in a home would be for her last few years?

Eve is an adorabull 3 year old blue Pit Bull girl. She is social and friendly with other dogs in the home and loves people. Eve loves to swim. She is a beautiful pit bull girl who is crate and house trained. Eve is 70 pounds.

 

If you're interested in adopting (or fostering!) one of our Don't Bully Us Rescue puppies or dogs please go www.dontbullyusrescue.org and fill out an online application. You can also go to our website www.dontbullyus.com for adoption, volunteer and foster applications. If you know the name of the pup, add it to your application. If you don't know the name of the puppy, just add a brief description of it! After approving your application, we will contact you for a meet and greet!

We have dogs ranging from newborn puppies to senior dogs in our rescue all looking for their forever homes. You can check out our latest pictures of our adoptable pups and dogs on our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/dontbullyusrescue . Also on our Facebook Page check out our Event section, this will tell you were we will be for our next adoption event. We usually have adoption events every weekend, giving you the chance to meet some of our wonderful adoptable pups in person. Thank you for taking the time to check us out, we look forward to receiving your application!

Please note: Due to restrictions and bans on bully breeds, we are unable to adopt out to renters and active Military personnel but we are working on changing perspectives and discriminatory Breed Specific Legislation for these wonderful dogs!

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Monkey has scars all over her body, had a broken leg that we surgically repaired, and is sight impaired in one eye. Despite the horrific treatment this sweet girl has previously endured, you will be hard pressed to find a sweeter dog. Monkey was born around 5/17/15 and our best guess and is she a bully/lab mix. She does great with adults, kids, and with other dogs who are not jumping on her (especially coming from her side with her impaired eye). She is too interested in cats, so we think she would do best in a feline free home. She loves attention and is quick to reward you with a smile, a hug, and maybe even a kiss. If you are looking for a special furbaby that may not win a beauty pageant, come meet Monkey and watch her win your heart. Monkey is in an Amazing Foster home and her family will tell you that this cutie is a real Doll! Amazing Grace Bully Rescue is a foster based rescue in the Pensacola, Florida area. We do not have an actual facility and our fosters are spread all over the local area. If you would like to meet any of our pups, the first step is to complete our online application and we will contact you as soon as we can.

Our adoption fee for Monkey is completely sponsored to an approved home. Monkey is already spayed, current on shots and rabies, and microchipped.

If you would like to adopt this Amazing dog, please fill out our online adoption application at www.amazinggracebullyrescue.org

If you have any questions, feel free to call/text us at (850) 723-2037. 2/1/21 10:04 PM

animal.description:
Needs • Children 14+.

Luke is a caramel colored, 3 year old 50 lb Labrador/American Foxhound mix, with a cute freckled snout and the most expressive eyes. A loving boy, he adores his people and wiggles his whole body excitedly in greeting. This boy’s favorite place is wherever you are   so he prefers to sleep in the room with you, whether that be in a doggie bed or - if you happen to like to share - your bed.  Hikes are one of his favorite things, but he’s equally happy having a snooze or playing in the house or yard.  

Intelligent and eager to please, Luke LOVES learning. He already knows sit, stay, paw, high-five, wave, roll over and even knows how to wind through legs, spin and jump! He enjoys playing with his canine foster sibling but would be just as happy as a solo dog. Luke is uncertain around children, so would need an adult home or a home with older children.

Luke is a smart, loyal, and loving guy who is hoping to finally settle in a forever home!


Thank you so much for your interest in adopting a dog from A New Chance Animal Rescue (https://anewchancear.org). We are a 501c3, tax deductible organization. ANCAR is a foster-based rescue, and we adopt within a 90 mile radius of Bedford Hills, NY.  You will find the adoption application here: (https://anewchancear.org/adopt/adoption-application/).  All fields on the application must be completed.
Please read about the adoption process (https://anewchancear.org/adopt/adoption-process/) so you'll know what to expect when you submit.   

Our dogs are in foster care and we do NOT have a shelter or boarding facility. AN APPLICATION MUST BE COMPLETED IN FULL AND APPROVED BEFORE A DOG CAN BE MET. This is a firm policy. Our busy volunteers are not able to respond to questions about the dog or dog meeting requests in the absence of an application.  We know these dogs very well because they are in foster care. Please read the profiles of the dog(s) you are interested in prior to submitting an application.  If there are specific requirements stated (ie: Fenced Yard or Canine Friend Required) these are included because they are vital to the happiness, health, safety and adoption success of that dog. 

We are only able to save as many dogs as we have foster homes (https://anewchancear.org/foster/faqs/) and resources for. We provide medical care including vaccinations, testing, deworming, spaying/neutering and microchipping before transporting our dogs. We provide all supplies, preventatives and any follow up vet care necessary while they are in foster care. These costs are high and the number of lives we can save is entirely dependent upon donations from people like you.  We do not receive funding from private foundations or government sources. If you can find room in your heart to help us, with any amount, we are truly grateful (https://anewchancear.org/help/donate/). We are a 501c3 organization, so all donations are tax-deductible. It is only through the kindness of supporters like you that we are 'changing lives...one tail at a time' by providing our dogs with 'A New Chance.' (https://anewchancear.org) 

Thanks so much.

animal.description:
PLEASE PROVIDE PHONE NUMBER WITH INQUIRY

About a week before Irma Came to Palm Beach County this girl was found in the woods in laxahatchee near a friend's property terrified of everything had been used as a mom dumped and trying to fend for herself for 2 months she worked on trying to gain her trust and finally just before the middle of November she got her into her yard. On Nov 7th 2017 I want to go meet this girl after my personal dog had passed away and I felt such an immediate connection with her that I took her with me into my rescue she was terrified and she disn't have a clue what was going on. It took a few days for her to settle in and after she went through her stray hold because there was originally a microchip that was found in her from overseas..We attempted to backtrace up microchip to no Avail and when her stray hold was up she came home. She will not pee or poop inside the house however she can be destructive unless she is given more 1 on 1 time then she is an angel. She is a Velcro dog that is playful and loving. So sweet and obsessed with licking hands. 

She is heartworm positive and her slow treatment is included.

If you are intereted please provide a phone nmber with your inquiry. Inquiries without phone numbers will not be entertained for adoption.  This request is due to poor email transcription with pefinder and emails not going to sender boxes ..or spam not checked.  Thank you for understanding and coopration.

animal.description:
Jace is a handsome, brindle, Shepherd / Bully-Breed mix.  He is approximately 3 years old and weighs around 55 pounds.  He has a moderate energy level and is crate-trained and housebroken.  He is good with older kids and some dogs and we are continuing to work on his interactions with other dogs.  He is not good with cats.    
 
For more information or to request an adoption application, please email us at adoption.mtgsr@gmail.com

ADOPTION: 
Training (for both the dog AND the family) increases the probability of a successful adoption. We feel strongly that training is an essential part of responsible dog ownership and we now require training for every dog placed through the MTGSR program. The cost of adoption is $500 which includes the $250 adoption fee and a training fee of $250 due at the time of adoption.

For the adoption fee, the dog will be spayed/neutered, current on all vaccinations, current on heartworm/flea-tick preventatives and microchipped.

The training fee will include a plan tailored to that specific dog and that dog's needs (obedience training, behavior modification, etc.) and typically includes three private training sessions.

PLEASE NOTE: Our philosophy is “Rescue locally, place locally” which means we primarily pull dogs from shelters in the Nashville area AND we prefer to place our dogs in homes within a one-hour drive of Nashville. If you are outside of the Nashville area, please consider adopting a homeless dog in your local community.

animal.description:
KALLIE REQURIES MEDICATED BATHS AND MUST REMAIN ON RAW FOOD. 

Kallie is a paralyzed little 6-7 month old Pit puppy.  She is incontinent but can eliminate on her own. 

She is a joy, a very happy little girl who seems to like the company of other dogs. If you have other dogs a meet and greet is mandatory.

What you will need to know and be able to do with Kallie.
1. Be able to lift her, she will probably grow to be about 45-50 pounds.
2. Keep her clean, and her environment clean
3. She has a cart
4. Not be bothered by having to clean up urine and feces multiple times per day.


She has been seen by an orthopedic and neurology specialist. Kallie will never walk again. Her rear legs are constricted and close to her body. there are stretching exercises which are done 2 times per day to keep them from becoming more constrictive.

If you do not balk at the above. I would love to hear from you. She is so very deserving of a home of her own.
animal.name: Kalie (Paralyzed)

animal.description:
Heartland generally serves Indiana, Kentucky and the Cincinnati areas. However we cannot cover every area.  We do work with our sister and brother rescues in other areas as well. Please consider your local Sheltie rescue before applying outside your area. 

We will NOT ship our available dogs.  A home visit by a volunteer is required before an application can be approved.  ********************************************************************************************
Joey is a super handsome fellow, just under a year old.

He was supposed to be a Sheltie but kept growing and growing...   Then a DNA test showed he is a Collie.

He just grew too large for his family.   They loved him to pieces but he knocks the little one down wagging his tail.  They wanted a small dog for their family and Joey is certainly not small.

Joey does fine with other confident dogs but can be a bully if there are shy.  He will not be placed in a home with a shy or reserved companion dog.  

He is a good traveler and great with children.

Adoption fee is  $350 and an obedience class is required.
APPLY to adopt at www.sheltierescue.org

animal.description:
This little guy is Billy! He was rescued from a local shelter. Unable to go into their adoptions program because of fear of his pen/crate. He was covered with fleas and has a flea allergy so he was missing a lot of hair. His collar was embedded into his neck so he has a scar around his neck. He is does well in his crate and and his fur is full. He is crate trained and doing well on housetraining. His estimated date of birth is 08/08/2011. He is good with other dogs his size.
For further information please email the address in the box to the right. Anyone interested in our dogs/cats will be required to fill out an adoption application. We do not adopt to anyone living out of the Dallas/Fort Worth area. All our dogs/cats will be spayed/neutered, heart worm tested (dogs), FeLV/FIV tested (cats), microchipped; and current on vaccinations.

We do not adopt on a first-come first-served basis. We review all applications received to ensure that the animal and the applicant are a good match based on our personal experiences with the animal. These animals live in our homes with us so we are familiar with their habits and behaviors.

To fill out an application online or to find out more information about our adoption process, just go to www.friscohumanesociety.com and click on the 'Adoption Application' link.

Dog/Puppy Adoption Fee- $165 Cat/Kitten Adoption Fee - $135

**All adoption fees are subject to applicable Texas sales taxes.**

Some of our adoptable cats can be seen at the Frisco Petsmart Adopt-A-Pet cat center Friday-Sunday. Adoption counselors are available, by appointment only, to conduct meet-and-greets and on-site adoptions. Please complete an online adoption application and someone will be in contact with you.

At this time, our next Meet and Greet Dog events are by appointment only. Please complete an online adoption application and someone will be in contact with you.

The Frisco Petsmart is located at 3333 Preston Rd, Frisco, TX 75034 in the Stonebriar Centre near Ulta and DSW.

animal.description:
Posted 12/2/17, and pictures taken on 9/1/17.  Dahlia was transferred to me on 8/31/17 from the Rebel Ranch Rescue after the founder, Amy Allen, was murdered on 8/21/17.  Dahlia was one of 4 dogs still there that other rescue groups chose not to take.  She was scared and tried to chew the leash the first attempt to get her out of her dog pen, so a second leash was used as a muzzle.  She was also hiding in a hole under her dog house.  She had a male dog in the dog pen with her named Artie, who seemed to be attached to her.

After being in a dog pen for about one week.  I decided to start letting Dahlia and Artie out to run, and they would chase each other around and then run back into the dog pen when done.  Dahlia also LOVES to get in water.  After another week of this, I decided to leave the gate open all the time.  They eventually moved to another section of our property.  Dahlia started climbing our 4 foot perimeter fence and running around the wooded area, but Artie has stayed on our property and made friends with the other dogs here, so he is not as attached to Dahlia as I first thought.  Dahlia got to where she came up to me to get pet, so it was easy to catch her when she was outside our property.  I put her in a small secure kennel at first with some can food, so she knew that going in that kennel meant can food when I needed to catch her again.  I now have her in a secure 6 foot tall dog pen.  She first found a way out through the chain link on top by getting on top of a dog house, but the chain link is now secure to the railing.  She needs a lot of space to run with a tall secure fence, and a source of water to get into.  It would be nice if she could get a job to do, since she is very trainable, and it might help keep her at a home.

Dahlia was already spayed when transferred, and heartworm negative on 9/1/17.
D.O.B.:     ? August 2013
Weight:     47.6 - 9/1/17

$25 adoption fee.
animal.name: AA-Dahlia

animal.description:
Posted 12/2/17, and pictures taken on 9/1/17.  Artie was transferred to me on 8/31/17 from the Rebel Ranch Rescue after the founder, Amy Allen, was murdered on 8/21/17.  Artie was one of 4 dogs still there that other rescue groups chose not to take.  He was scared and tried to chew the leash the first attempt to get him out of his dog pen, so a second leash was used as a muzzle.  He seemed to be very attached to his companion Dahlia who shared his dog pen, so was happy to be in a crate next to her for the drive back to our property.

After being in a dog pen for about one week.  I decided to start letting Artie and Dahlia out to run, and they would chase each other around and then run back into the dog pen when done.  After another week of this, I decided to leave the gate open all the time.  They eventually moved to another section of our property.  Dahlia started climbing our 4 foot perimeter fence, but Artie has stayed on our property and made friends with the other dogs here, so he is not as attached to Dahlia as I first thought.  He is still skittish of people, but loves treats and can food, which has made him feel comfortable enough to come up to me on occasion to let me pet him.  At first I had to throw treats to him, but now he will take them from my hand, and especially will come for a spoon of can food.  He needs a home that will be patient with him, other dogs to play with, and a large fenced area.  He likes to get on top of dogs houses and other things to lay down on, and knows where the treats are, so will get into the bags if not sealed up.  I was told that Amy called him Smarty Artie.  He also has an underbite, which may indicate he is part Boxer.

Artie was already neutered when transferred, and heartworm negative on 9/1/17.
D.O.B.:     ? 2014
Weight:     45.4 - 9/1/17

$25 adoption fee.

animal.description:
Posted on 12/2/17, and pictures updated on 6/19/20.  Asia was part of the Rebel Ranch Rescue, and she was transferred to me when the founder of the Rebel Ranch Rescue, Amy Allen, was murdered on 8/21/17.  Amy had just gotten Asia from the Smith County Animal Shelter on 8/11/17.

Asia is playful and high energy, so she will need a home that will help her work that energy off, and she will need a fenced yard; no apartment.  Asia tries to climb in my lap, always jumping on me, always right by me wanting attention to get pet, and LOVES to chase after water from a water hose.  Asia actually settles down while she is being pet, but should not be around smaller children due to her high energy.  She is in an outside fenced area, so it is unknown if she is house or crate trained, and is good on a leash.  Asia has a huge heart shaped patch on the Right side of her body.

animal.description: I LOVE THIS GIRL!!!! Meet Rosie...spayed, micro chipped, current on vaccinations, on flea and heart worm preventatives. Rosie is 60 pounds and will be a year old in April. She is going to be a BIG girl! We are working on keeping all 4 feet on the floor and basic commands. Rosie loves the other dogs and loves people. She needs to build confidence but that can be done in the day to day activities.East TN Pit Bull Rescue adopts out to companion homes only. Adoptions require an application that is verified, a meeting that includes ALL members of the household, a home visit, and a trial period. We do not place our dogs in homes with unaltered pets or homes that have pets but do not have a vet. All of our dogs are placed as inside pets, spayed/neutered, micro chipped, vaccinations current, and HW- or treated within the last 6 months for heart worms by our vet. Adoption fees start at $150 for adults and $200 for pups. If you are interested in offering this pet a responsible and loving home, please fill out the on-line application at www.etnpitbullrescue.org. East TN Pit Bull Rescue is a Tennessee Non-profit corporation with 501(c)(3) status. Your donations to sponsor pets are tax deductible. If you would like to sponsor this pet, please go to www.paypal.com and make a donation to donations@etnpitbullrescue.org OR contact Butler's Animal Clinic at 865-531-7311 to make a donation on the East TN Pit Bull Rescue Account. Please be sure to add the pets name in the comments section. Your donations are greatly needed and appreciated.

animal.description:
Some facts about Layla.

Her vital stats:
- She's truly the perfect size for most homes. She's small enough that you can easily pick her up - 33 lbs. (and she doesn't mind being picked up when you need to do it), but has a "big dog" personality (not yappy or nervous at all).

Basic Information:
- house-trained
- crate-trained (but doesn't NEED to be in a crate - she's perfectly safe when left loose in the house)
- peppy when she's outside, but calm inside the house
- snuggly - loves to sit on your lap
- playful - giver her a good toy and she's happy for a long time (heck, she's even happy to chase her tail if she's got no toys around)
- adorable - her little tongue is too big for her mouth, so about an inch of the tip often hangs out; extremely cute
- would love to get on the furniture, but doesn't mind when you say no (i.e., she listens to you)
- food-driven, so she's good at training, but not so food-driven that she tries to get the food off your plate (see above she listens well)
- only barks when she hears the doorbell or noises outside (in other words, not a nervous dog that barks at everything)
- independent - she is not needy in the least; at the same time, she's loving and excited to see you/be with you when you come home

Layla will do well with a house without children and will need a compatibility test with another dog. She gets along well with some and not so well with others.

If you are interested in adopting Layla, please visit www.pawsitiveimpactncdogrescue.com/adopt.

PINC's adoption fee covers shots through the date of adoption (all puppies receive 2 vaccinations before adoption), surgery (spay or neuter), microchip and microchip registration.

Once your dog is in your home, they will adjust and relax and could become more playful or show more personality traits as they begin to open up. Once adopted, please allow your dog time to decompress and relax in a stable home environment.

animal.description:
Heartworm Prevention is given on the 14th of each month

UPDATE:

Thor is progressing, but it's a slow work in progress. He's not marking as much, and he's very slowly learning to stand down when he's overwhelmed by the urge to protect. He's definitely not the dog for your average family, but in a home with no or few other animals (no alphas) he could be someone's best buddy forever. He does have a very sweet and cuddly side, and we're continuing to work to let that shine through. If you've ever wanted to rescue an animal purely for the sake of the animal, and are willing to work to save this boy, then he would love you for it for the rest of his days.

Thor's come a long way since being pulled off the streets of San Antonio. He's had a heart workup to make sure he's OK for anesthesia (neuter), and he's put on a little bit of weight so he's not just skin and bones.
This boy's had a rough life, and he still has some aggression issues with my pig, but he's learned to accept and interact with other dogs and people. He still requires careful observation, but he really has come so far!
We're still working on marking, although he's improving. Whomever adopts him needs to understand he requires some patience and understanding. If you can offer him those, then you'll have a dog who loves and adores you!
2/2/21 6:06 PM

EMAIL : HUSKYHAVENOFLA@HOTMAIL..COM FOR INFO 
---------------------------------------------------------
GNERL INFO re all dogs listed:
For more info contact our email add stated just above
WE are hard to reach by phone due to our work load
We make appoint to meet AFTER receiving and completing the application process NOT before.
We do NOT adopt outside of CA except for Reno, NV
There is helpful info on our website: huskyhavenofla.org- BUT it is outdated with some info We do not have funds to complete a new website
The adopt fee stated is VERY old: Our current adopt fee for adults is bet $245 and $285
Everything is done: all vaccines/spay o r neuter/microchip/evaluation. If vet intervention was needed, this info will be provided as well
PLUS 30 dys FREE vet insurance and access to continue vet insurance at VERY low cost
Most dogs have videos and "clicking" on the video link ( the little film icon) is helpful to learn more..

PLS DO NOT submit an application if you are NOT ready to adopt within the next 2 wks.

If any of the following LIST applies to you pls EMAIL first BEFORE applying so we can give you addl info:

If you have a sml dog weighing less than 35 lbs
If you have a cat or cats
If your current fencing is NOT min 6 foot all the way around including the gates
(Some of the dogs are ok with 5 foot but NOTHING less)
If you have an inground swimming pool NOT safely fenced off
If the location you are residing at is your parents home
If you are a renter, we REQUIRE WRITTEN landlord approval
PLS make sure you have asked if there are restrictions re the breed or size or weight for your complex.

animal.description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Gracie, a Plott Hound, and her brother Angelo were left outside a Georgia shelter in horrible condition. Born in early 2017, Gracie was extremely emaciated when she came into rescue: at only 16 pounds, she was only half of what her body weight should have been and in addition, she had an ulcerated eye, demodex mange, anemia, parasites, was dehydrated, and her two rear paws were swollen and infected with puncture wounds there and on her neck. Gracie has made a full recovery and is searching hard for her forever home. We just don't understand why she is still in foster and has not been adopted yet! This young girl needs a home with another confident dog as she is submissive and timid. When first being introduced into your home, she may be scared and timid, but given her previous 'life' its no wonder! Her home should not have cats, and should be one where there is a fairly established routine. She absolutely thrives in a home where expectations do not change. Gracie is house trained, potty trained, leash trained and crate trained and in fact will seek out her crate when she feels nervous. If you have a loving home that fits this description and would like to adopt Gracie and give her a chance, please apply here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org

animal.description:
Daphne was picked up as a stray along with Camille and Bonnie (both in our rescue) and taken to the South LA Shelter

She is a special needs senior.

Daphne has skin issues which are treated with meds, but also has alopecia.   The fur may never grow back on her face (we think she is adorable!)  She also has a club foot that does not cause her any problems.

Daphne takes her meds without complaining and is doing fabulous in her foster home.   But there are a lot of dogs there and we think she'd be happier in a less "congested" atmosphere.

She is available for our Seniors for Seniors discount.  To apply for Daphne, please go to http://dawgsquad.org/adoption-application/

animal.description:
Bonnie was picked up as a stray along with Camille and Daphne (also in our rescue) and wound up at the South LA Shelter.

She is very special needs.

Bonnie has double cherry eye which has caused her tear ducts to stop functioning.   She has a fungul infection on her skin, is prone to seizures (cause unknown and they have stopped) and she has a Grade 4 heart murmur.

She is on tons of meds and she doesn't complain about taking any of them

Can we tell you how much longer she will live?   Nope, but we couldn't guarantee that with ANY dog.   We do know that since she's been out of the shelter her seizures have stopped, her skin has improved and she looks and acts 100% better than she did when we first got her out of the shelter.

She's a nice dog.   She needed a break to thrive and she got one in her new foster home.  But there are a lot of dogs there and she'd REALLY thrive in a home with less dogs.   

Bonnie is eligible for our Seniors for Seniors discount.

To apply, please go to http://dawgsquad.org/adoption-application/

animal.description: Hi everyone! I'm Nola and I'm a 9-year-old female Shiba Inu (mix?) who came to SIRA as a stray. I may be little at 20lbs, but I have a big personality! My foster parents say that I am a very loving girl and have brought so much joy to my foster home. My favorite things are to welcome my humans when they come home, cuddle on the bed, get good pets, go on walks, and to to go outside to search for chipmunks in the yard. My least favorite things are to be crated and the sound of wheels that zip by me (bicycles, cars, etc). I am a good girl when I'm left at home uncrated all day while my foster parents are at work (no accidents, no chewing). The minute my foster parents get home, I rush to the door to give them tons of kisses and tell them how much I missed them! I love people and give lots of attention to my human friends. It might take me a little while to feel safe and secure in a new home. You see, I get anxious in a new environment and will bark a lot to let you know that I'm feeling unsure, especially if you step out of the room or leave home without me. So it will be important for my new family to be patient and plan for ways to help me to adjust during the transition (if you live in a home where barking won't disturb your neighbors, that's good too!). I get along great with my foster Shiba sister. However, I don't get along well with dogs that I don't know. Because of this, my foster parents think that I might do best in a home with no other dogs. I might learn to enjoy living with other even-tempered similarly sized dog(s), but my new humans would need to commit to a slow, gradual integration process. I have not lived with cats before, but because of my strong prey drive (yeah, I really like to chase those chipmunks!) a home without cats or other small pets would be best. I really like being outside and love to go for walks in my secure harness. Like most Shibas, I need to stay on-leash at all times when outside or be supervised in a very securely fenced backyard to prevent me from getting loose. My foster family says that I'm a generally healthy girl, with a few things that need monitoring. My left eye was removed in June of 2018 due to glaucoma. It doesn’t slow me down at all and I still have some vision out of my right eye, even though that one has a cataract and is at risk of developing glaucoma too. I get eye drops every day to help maintain healthy eye pressure. Like many older girls, I have a few other issues to be aware of, which mostly don’t bother me: occasional back pain, a slight heart murmur, airway sensitivity, and luxating patella (loose knee caps) in both knees. My foster parents say I'm a tough cookie (and also a sweetheart)! If you'd like to be my forever family and you live in the midwest, visit www.savingshibas.com/adopt for more information and to download an application to become an approved SIRA adopter. I am being fostered in Wisconsin.

home_environment_attributes.other_animals: Nola gets along with the other resident dog in her foster home, but has a high prey drive, so cats and smaller pets are not a good match. She may take time to warm up to other dogs, so a slow, gradual introduction is best.

animal.description:
Joe Paxton is a sensitive sweet 7 year old pit bull/lab/hound cross. He has lived a life of hunting boar in the mountains of Kauai and then found himself at the county animal shelter as a stray. He tested heartworm positive at the shelter and we were made aware that they do not treat animals for heartworm. We were happy to take in Joe and start his treatment asap! 
Joe gets along with all of the other dogs in the household, big and small. He loves to play, is house trained and crate trained. He is shy in new situations and does much better if he has a confident dog with him. He loves to cuddle.
Joe is available in both Hawaii and Portland, OR.  Should he receive interest in the Portland area, we can bring him to Oregon.

animal.description:
Get ready for the greatest love of your life!!!
Please learn more about us and our available pets at Robin Hood Animal Rescue.In Toad's words:

"There I was roaming around the gas station when this truck pulled up and before I knew it I had walked over to the man with a slip lead and then I was sitting on a lady's lap and she was petting my head.

I am one BIG BOY with a heart as big.

I can have a bit of a Chihuahua attitude. And I don't like it when other dogs are by my food, but I am, generally speaking, a good boy who wants a family to love and to play with.

But again, I probably WOULD DO BETTER being the only dog. I can be a butt head at times. That is why I am a special needs.

I probably need a family with bigger kids because I forget my strength sometimes. :)

Oh! The last photo shows how sweet I look when I am sleeping. I love cuddling up with a blanket, and even a towel.

I can be so adorable when I am not being a butt head."

As with all our foster dog children, Toad has been altered, microchipped and has had his shots.
Please call or text Bob at (623) 680-1170 for more information on this big, gentle-hearted brute.
January 2021: THE USUAL ADOPTION FEE FOR DOGS/PUPPIES VARIES GIVEN AGE, BREED, ETC.. All have been spay/neutered, vaccinated and microchipped. Our base fee for for ADULT DOGS will start at $150.OUR ADOPTION FEE FOR MANY OF OUR ADULT CATS WILL START AT $100.00. All have been spay/neutered, FIV/leukemia tested, vaccinated and microchipped.
OUR ADOPTION FEE FOR MANY OF OUR KITTENS WILL START AT $150.
If you find one who has taken your heart, please text or call us at (623) 680-1170. *We will adopt out of state.*

Donations can be made via PayPal by clicking on the above button or through our website: www.RobinHoodAnimalRescue.org
Or if like, donations can be made via GoFundMe by clicking on the link on our website (bottom of page): www.RobinHoodAnimalRescue.org
If you would like to make a donation via check please make your check payable to: Robin Hood Animal Rescue and please text or call Bob at (623) 680-1170 for the address.Donations are used for medical, supplies, food and other operating expenses. Everyone here at Robin Hood Animal Rescue (two and four legged/furry and not as furry) thank you in advance.

animal.description:
Age: 6 yo Years

Weight: 54 lbs

Location: RI

This dog is available for adoption to all New England residents, and

has been spayed/neutered, is up to date on shots, on heartworm preventative and is microchipped.

Hello Friends, my name is Goldy!
I am a fabulous blend of boxer and shepherd, well that's what the humans say at least. I consider myself rather intelligent, curious and goofy. Let's just say I know the basic doggie commands like the back of my paw, as long as treats are provided! Whether it's Netflix and treats, a hike on your favorite trails or a trip to the beach, I'm your girl!

Like any other pup, I have some preferences I would like you to know about. Though I play well with other dogs, I would love to be the center of attention at home, sorry doggie friends! I look at cats and think, no, thank you, move along please or the prey drive kicks in. Though smaller humans are cute, I am not my best possible self around them. Therefore, no kids in the house is a requirement for my adoption! Actually, I'm all about the adult only lifestyle. This party is 21+ please.

Did you say RULES? If so, that is right up my alley! I like knowing what to expect and having a plan. While I can definitely rally for spontaneous adventures (or cuddle times) with my person, I excel in predictable environments. For example, I would prefer to avoid surprises when rounding a corner, unexpected house guests or deliveries, sharing my food or toys at home with other dogs. I have A TON of training under my belt, and have a redirection cue for these types of situations. While it will take some work, I have confidence that I can get you up to speed on those skills with some effort and time and some help from a professional trainer.

You know what I bet you would love to hear, a house-trained AND crate-trained dog AND leash-trained dog. Oh hey, that's me! That's right folks, not only am I good looking, but I am smart, too! Speaking of savvy and intelligent, I LOVE puzzle games. While the humans enjoy Scrabble, I enjoy something called a Wobbler (Wonderful Obstacle Building Blob Leaving Endless Rewards) or at least that's what I think it stands for.

So, what do you think? I know I'm asking for a lot in my new home, but I also love a lot and in the right match, I promise I am not high maintaince! Won't you give me a chance to fill that empty space in your heart and make it Goldyen? If so, apply for me today!

Goldy's Backstory: While we don't know all the details of her history, when Goldy came into our partner rescue in January 2017, she was skin and bones. She likely was not exposed to many positive things, so she is still learning about, and becoming comfortable with, the active human environment. She continues to make great progress learning that her first reaction to new things should not be concern (bark/lunging). She needs a confident, dog-savvy person who is committed to continuing to work with her on this and manage her environment. With the right handler, she could likely be trained to be an exceptional working dog.

Adoption Fee: $585

To apply for this dog, fill out an adoption application on our website:

www.sosarl.org/aa/

**Additional info you should know - For most of our dogs, we are guessing at predominant breed or breed mix. We get to know each of our dogs as an individual and do our best to describe and place them based on personality not breed label. Some dogs may not yet be in New England, nor ready for immediate adoption. There may be additional vetting, quarantine, waiting periods and/or fees depending upon your state of residence. If you have questions or concerns on any of this, you can discuss this with your Adoption Counselor.

animal.description:
Horace is a 9 year old Male Poodle on the larger end of measurements from the local shelter and a super sweet boy. He loves to cuddle with his human and would be best as the only dog. He is crate trained and working on potty training but does have a doggie door. 

If you think you would be interested, please complete our no obligation application and we can start the process at www.luv4k9s.org. Select Available Dogs then scroll down to application, complete and submit. 

A physical secure fence attached to the residence is a requirement to adopt a dog from our rescue. Invisible fence doesn't meet this requirement. No exceptions.

Our adoption area is primarily OHIO. We will consider KENTUCKY, AND INDIANA AND CERTAIN AREAS OF MICHIGAN, WEST VIRGINIA, AND PENNSYLVANIA if it’s the best fit for the dog.

WE DO NOT SHIP NOR ARRANGE TRANSPORTS.

THE APPLICATION MUST BE COMPLETED AND SUBMITTED BEFORE WE CAN START THE PROCESS. 

IT CAN TAKE AT LEAST 2 WEEKS TO PROCESS AN APPLICATION SOMETIMES LONGER DEPENDING ON VOLUNTEER AVAILABILITY AND NUMBER OF APPLICATIONS RECEIVED SO PLEASE BE PATIENT. 

NOTE TO EMAILERS FROM PETFINDER: WE DO NOT RESPOND TO EMAIL INQUIRIES WITHOUT AN APPLICATION. WE REGRET WE CANNOT RESPOND TO EVERY EMAIL, BUT UNLESS YOU FILL OUT AN APPLICATION, WE DO NOT KNOW YOU EXIST. 

All known information about an individual dog is provided in its listing. We do our best to provide accurate information, but adopters must understand that each home is different, and the dog may behave differently in a new home. Dogs are creatures of their environment and you help make the dog what it will be. 
Homes considering adopting a puppy must be prepared for:
1.) Flexible schedules for potty training. Puppies can only hold it for one hour per month of age (ex. a 4 month old puppy can only go 4 hours without a potty break) 
2.) Crate training until the puppy is at least one year old, to prevent chewing on inappropriate things when you can't supervise.
3.) Socialization: The more positive and varying experiences as a puppy the better, both in and out of your home.
4.) Puppy behavior and life stages are equivalent to a human toddler. It takes at least a full year to have a calmer, well-adjusted dog. Patience is required and when your dog's behavior is a positive experience for you and those around you, your patience will be rewarded tenfold, for years to come.
Please do not consider adopting a puppy if you have not thoroughly thought through the pros and cons of having one. So many people end up returning them after 3-5 months because they didn't realize the amount of work involved in raising a puppy. Patience, appropriate toys, socialization, and obedience training are all musts. All are time consuming and can be expensive. All Dogs Require supervision with children and obedience training. Adopters that want to have good dogs must be prepared to put the time and effort into training a dog. Any dog requires work and effort, but a well-trained, well socialized dog is more than worth the effort put in to get them there. 

Our adoption fee includes spay/neuter, routine shots, rabies, worming, microchipped, heartworm testing and they are on monthly preventative. Visit our website www.luv4k9s.org for more information and to complete an application.

animal.description:
Meet this beautiful little girl, Olive. She absolutely adores being around people. She will sit in your lap and roll around. Olive loves to be pet and rubbed behind the ears. She will give you kisses while you pet her. Her soft fur feels like cashmere and her markings are adorable. What a beauty!

Olive is around 2 years old.  The first part of her little life is somewhat of a mystery. She was discovered after being abandoned in a cardboard box, together with another pup. A good Samaritan brought her to the Anti Cruelty Society where volunteers contacted IEBR. Olive has now been in her temporary foster home for one week and this is where she has responded so well to love and adoration. 

Olive is very mobile, she walks and runs around and loves to explore the garden rolling around in the grass and chasing leaves. Olive can climb up two steps and navigate furniture, toys or any obstacle in front of her. She will run into your arms if you call her name! She does have the tendency to have her back legs collapse when she is standing idle, hinting at some mobility functional shortfalls.

Olive loves squeaky toys. She knows how to bite them repeatedly to make the sound continue non-stop. She quickly drops one toy to run to the next. Rope toys are a must for this chewing bulldog pup. She loves to chew so when she comes for your shoes (and your feet!) you have to distract her with a toy. She drops to her blankets and bed when she is tired, napping regularly and settling well through the night. 

Olive eats three small meals a day of puppy food. We add a bit of Organic pumpkin to keep her stools regular. She gobbles all her food quickly and carries the dish around when she is finished. 

Olive has Spina Bifida and is incontinent she does wear diapers.  

Update 7/8/19
Olive is now a very happy and energetic 2y/o. She does have spina bifida and has issues with some dragging of her back right leg especially as she gets tired. She wears diapers and has quite the wardrobe of covers and outfits. She loves everyone and has no idea of personal space. She loves playing outside and snuggling on the couch. She is a toy hoarder but does it so cutely it’s impossible for anyone to get upset. Her favorite thing is to play a rousing game of “bite my nose” especially after I have been at work she gets on the couch and it’s just so much fun for her to try to give you a “kiss” right in the nose!!! She loves it and gets so excited.
She has very little maintenance. Her wrinkles are small and stay clear. Her back foot has to be protected. She only plays in the yard and on soft surfaces. She loves toys and other dogs and cats are fine.

Olive is truly a love muffin that is going to make some lucky family very happy. 
If you are interested in Olive, please visit our website:  www.ilenglishbulldogrescue.org, and read through our adoption criteria to see if you meet our requirements.  If you do, please fill out an application to adopt.
Olive’s adoption fee is:   $650.00
Visit us on Facebook:  Visit us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/IllinoisEnglishBulldogRescue

animal.description:
Scooter came to FARM over a year ago in need of a forever home. He is an 10 year old, 6 pound neutered male Chihuhua. Scooter is looking for a Chihuahua savvy home. He can be a very sweet boy who will smother his favorite people with kisses, but he also has a very stubborn side. He needs an adopter who understand this stubborn behavior and will give him his space when he is feeling grouchy.  He is reported to be housebroken and crate trained. He has done well with other dogs his own size in his foster home. 

**Only very experienced and patient dog people should apply - he has significant behavior issues that you cannot "love away". You will need to respect his boundaries and be okay working around his terms.**

If you wish to be considered for this animal, please download an application at http://fallstonanimalrescue.org/adopt/ or email fallstonrescue@aol.com to request one. It can take up to 2 weeks to process an application; we suggest following up by email on the status if you have not received a reply within 3-5 days. We are an all-volunteer based rescue and we ask for your patience if we are slow to respond. 

Please understand that we fit the dog with the home we feel is best suited and will accept multiple applications on one dog. We have strict requirements for families with children under 10 since many of our dogs are grumpy and may not do well with children. Some dogs will have fence requirements, while others may not.

A pet is a lifetime commitment and it is our duty to do our very best to place them correctly the first time around. We do not take the adoption process lightly. Thank you for choosing to adopt not shop!

animal.description:
PLEASE READ THIS PROFILE AND THE REQUESTED CRITERIA BEFORE CALLING OR SUBMITTING AN APPLICATION. THANKS FOR YOUR ATTENTION AND CONSIDERATION

MEET BEAU!  This little 11-lb, 4-year-old, white Maltipoo mix (our best guess) came to us from the Palmdale shelter.  The family who surrendered him to the shelter reported that his parents were brother and sister. :(

Poor Beau was not blessed with good health.  He is hypothyroid (managed with daily pills) and has elevated liver enzymes (also managed with medication).  We believe that his inbreeding also resulted in a neurological condition called episodic ataxia.  This condition manifests itself in Beau as seizure-like episodes where his legs stiffen and he can't walk.  These episodes each last about 30-60 minutes and seem to occur most often when he is excited or stressed.  Over the months we've had him, Beau's episodes have become less frequent, and about 90% of the time he behaves like a normal, happy boy!  We are hopeful that he will lead a long, relatively-healthy life.

Beau is extremely human-oriented and needs to find a home where someone is around most of the time.  He is a velcro dog who will follow you from room to room.  He loves to play with toys (especially those that squeak!) and gnaw on bones.  He is mostly potty-pad trained, but does occasionally have accidents inside.  Access to a yard may help with his house training.  He could also use some training to curb his reactions to other dogs on-leash. 

Beau is a total doll who's looking for a family that can embrace his medical needs and love him the way we do.  Do you have room in your home and heart for this special boy?

UPDATE (October 2020): We've had Beau on holistic medication (carefully monitored by a holistic vet) for several months, and he now rarely has episodes at all!  His adopter should be willing to adopt this regimen so he can continue to thrive.

Our website is updated daily. Please do not apply for this dog unless your home fits the specified criteria. All of our dogs are spayed/neutered, microchipped, groomed, vet checked, dewormed, deflea'd and come with a leash, collar and ID If you are interested in adopting this dog from Lhasa Happy Homes, please complete the adoption application via the link below: 

Adoption (Online) Application: https://lhasahappyhomes.org/adoptions/adoption-application/

 We will contact you once it has been reviewed. 

During the COVID-19 quarantine, Lhasa Happy Homes will NOT be holding weekly adoption events. We will set up individual meet & greets with APPROVED applicants once they have submitted a video tour of their home.

You can check our Events Calendar at http://www.lhasahappyhomes.org/HLM_Custom_Calendar.aspx.  

Thanks for thinking rescue and adoption…and for considering saving a life. It will be the best gift you ever give yourself or your family.

animal.description:
Remy is a handsome boy who is loves to play.  He is good on a leash and harness and loves to run!  He loves to play fetch and tug with his rope toy.  He is treat motivated and some of his favorites are chicken nuggets, and frozen dog food in a Kong toy.

Remy really need to be the dog king of his castle.  He does not do well with other animals and we recommend against small children due to his strength.  His adult owner should have lots of dog experience, preferably with a strong dog with a strong personality like Remy.  For the right person, he is the best friend you could ever want.

He loves to have his very own dog bed and prefers to get affection when he wants it, rather than having it forced upon him.  

He knows basic commands and he is crate trained and house broken.

To learn more contact us at adoption@ihadro.org or apply today at www.ihadro.org!  Thank you for your interest.

** Please read the bio in its entirety before emailing with questions or submitting an application**

As we are an all volunteer rescue with limited time to respond to emails, if you email us with questions that have already been answered in the bio, we won't be able to respond. We are being inundated with emails at the moment. Thank you for your understanding!

Autumn has a gorgeous coat that looks and feels like velvet. She's very sweet and lovable, is playful, has lots of energy and loves everyone!

She likes other dogs but tends to play very rough and it can easily escalate without direct supervision, so she would do best in a home where she could be lavished with all of the attention. She is very eager to please and is treat motivated.

Minimum Donation: $200 (All PawPrints dogs are HW Tested, on monthly HW prevention, up to date on vaccines, spayed and microchipped.

Weight: 55 lbs

Dogs: Yes, but would be best as an only pet

Cats: No

Kids: No small children due to Autumns rambunctious style of play

While viewing our available dogs, please understand that:

If you have a fence, it must be a physical fence
We do check personal and veterinary references. All current pets must be up to date on Rabies, spayed or neutered and on heartworm prevention (dogs).
Adopters MUST live within a 2 hour radius of Florence Ky. (sorry, no exceptions)
Meet and greets are arranged with an approved application which can be found online at pawprintsnky.com
When you send messages/emails through adoption sites, our website, etc they all go to the same inbox. Sending multiple emails/messages to us actually delays our response to you.

animal.description: Holy moly I love this boy! Maynard came in with a wound on his back. It has come a long way but is not quite healed. We are working on it! We went to the vet this week and this boy was a rock star! He was saying hi to every one coming in. He was well mannered ...well except for the part where he kept trying to sit in my lap! This boy isnt quite ready for adoption but a foster to adopt would certainly be welcome!East TN Pit Bull Rescue adopts out to companion homes only. Adoptions require an application that is verified, a meeting that includes ALL members of the household, a home visit, and a trial period. We do not place our dogs in homes with unaltered pets or homes that have pets but do not have a vet. All of our dogs are placed as inside pets, spayed/neutered, micro chipped, vaccinations current, and HW- or treated within the last 6 months for heart worms by our vet. Adoption fees start at $150 for adults and $200 for pups. If you are interested in offering this pet a responsible and loving home, please fill out the on-line application at www.etnpitbullrescue.org. animal.description:
FOUND !!!! Picked up as a stray by Lebanon TN Animal Control and scanned for a MICRO CHIP on July3rd, 2019. Picked up and brought home on July 5th, 2019.

My post on 7/06/19
Well...for 3 days I have been trying to decide what I wanted to say about this. First 2 days, I was afraid it was not true. You see...5 years ago, I got a call about Max and his MICRO CHIP. I said can't be Max because he is DEAD! That is what his piece of shit adopter and family had told me! Paula Langford said brindle and BIGGEST HEAD I EVER SAW! I laughed, I cried, and then I got angry. How is he still alive? Better yet, how did he get to SC? That is when it hit me...WHERE IS G? We made arrangements to get Max back here and I started trying to get hold of Lindy Dunlap Bingham Terrell Kostek ???? (Not sure what the latest name is). When she returned my call finally...she wanted to tell me about her cancer that she was dying from. I just wanted to know where G was. She told me she didn't know Max wasn't dead and didn't know what happened to G. She said he was stolen. She said he was at her mother's. She told me he got loose and ran away. Her mother told me he got ran over. So for 5 years, I have cried, been sick to my stomach, become totally neurotic about how I place dogs, and developed a total distrust of people and my gut where people are concerned. So...Wednesday I turned my phone off while I went to the doctor. I then forgot to turn it back on until a friend showed up to get his dog and said he tried to call! When I turned it back on...I thought it was blowing up! I got Alyn Butterfield Dunn 's message first...call me about Gus! Then Mallory Bertrand message says ... call me or I am gonna blow your phone up. It is about G! I call Alyn and some strange chick answers the phone to tell me they have found G in Lebanon and she gave me an AC officer's phone #. Even after he confirmed the MICRO CHIP number...even after he went to the petfinder page for Gus and confirmed by the pictures that it was G...I just couldn't believe it. They told me they were closed on the 4th so I couldn't pick him up until Friday. Told me I had to bring proof that he belonged to me. So...those of you that really know me...well I don't do mornings...but I was up and letting some dogs out at 6:30 am. I was in Lebanon before AC officer got there. I still was numb and just could not believe it...5 years this month we had been looking for G...5 years he had been my profile picture. I said I would not change it until he was found. I have thought several times over the years that I needed to use that space for something else. Surely if he was going to be found, it would have happened before now. They told me he was slow moving and not very excited about any thing...the only thing the video blow is gonna show you...is excitement! I said his name...he looked at me...and then he was anything but slow! I am still crying...laughing...then crying somemore. I also have worries. I have no idea if he has had any shots, any hw preventatives, or any vetting. I am scared to death to see HW test. I really need some help with the funds but we will figure that out. Sometimes he will be across the yard and look up and see me. He wiggles and then runs to me. I am so happy and so relieved to find him alive. But people keep saying at least I got closure...well that is the part that kept me from posting about this...because I don't have closure. What happened to G? How did he get picked up stray in Lebanon? Having him here should be enough...but it isn't. I want every individual that lied, or knew something and didn't tell it, covered for her, told me you were helping but you were really trying to get me to back off...I want each and every one of you to be visited by Karma. I want you to be looking over your shoulder and wondering WHEN you will have that knock at the door...when I will figure out exactly what happened to this dog...especially if this boy pops heart worm positive. Thank you so much to those that have shared his posts, drove to homes in SC, Monroe County, Smith County, Sevier County and Wilson County to make sure he is not there. You will never know what that means to me. Now the question of the day...when can you see him? Once he has had his shots brought current and gets a clean bill of health...I will set something up. SECOND QUESTION seems to be whether I will keep him or rehome him. My belly hurts even thinking of handing him to someone else so we will have to wait on answering that. Welcome home G and thank you Jesus for keeping him safe! MICRO CHIP YOUR DOGS...

(7/21/16) still no G... Lindy...the lying BITCH still tells all kinds of things about what happened. Who knows...I just know KARMA really needs to visit her on G's behalf. Here we are (11/12/2015) ...TWO years later and still no word on G...I think about him every day. Every time I am handing a dog over...I wonder...are these people really who they seem? Are they really gonna take care of this dog? My belly hurts, I am nauseous, my hands shake, and my heart hurts. If you know about G AKA Gus, please contact us. We need to see he is safe... Gus...I know you are out there. I pray that you are safe and loved...that you have a good and decent family that has no clue that we are looking for you...no clue that we are afraid for your safety...no clue that we are hurting because we miss you and do not know where you are. We love you and think about you daily. I continue to post this...on the pages of pet people, the pages of Lindy Dunlap Terrell Kostek and all of her family and friends, the pages for missing pets, the pages about needing justice, ...well I just keep posting your pictures...someone is gonna recognize you! As of May 21, 2015... Gus is still missing. We drove to Carthage, TN and spoke with Mike and Jama Dunlap - Lindy's parents. They fell all over themselves to be helpful. Said the dog had never been to their house and that they had no idea what happened to him. They said I should speak with Lindy's neighbors. The neighbors said there had never been a blue pit bull at Lindy's house. That would mean Gus never made it home that day! What happened to our boy?!!!??? We have been told every tale under the sun...and still Gus is missing. She won't tell us what she did with G...MAYBE she will tell you! SO...if you know or meet Mike or Jama Dunlap ( Carthage, TN Area) or Lindy Dunlap Bingham Terrell Kostek (living in Sevier County area and last known to be working at the Hatfield & Mc Coy's Dinner Theater in Pigeon Forge, TN) - why don't you tell them that East TN Pit Bull Rescue is still looking for this baby. Then why don't you ask them what happened to this dog!

As of September 14, 2014.... We have heard nothing of G's whereabouts. Lindy's MOTHER said the dog was 'stolen' just a few weeks after Lindy got him. That means he has been missing just over a YEAR! Still have been unable to locate husband Kevin Terrell to see if he has a clue what happened to him. We are not interested in yanking Gus from a loving home. We just want him safe. If you know ANYTHING about what happened to this dog, please contact us...here, email - etnpitbullrescue@gmail.com or call 8652022520... UPDATE!!!!!!!!! Just spoke with Lindy on the phone. She says G was stolen from her yard by a guy in a white F150 pick up just a few weeks back. The address there was 663 Lebanon HWY Carthage, TN 37030-2948. ( http://www.facebook.com/l.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Fusplaces.com%2Fothers%2Fcarthage-tn%2Funion-heights-elementary-school&h=eAQFL8xY8) She swears that she was told Max was dead ...Don't know what to believe BUT PLEASE....If you have contacts in the Carthage area....Share Gus! If you know rescue groups or folks at the shelters...PLEASE share! PLEASE look at these pictures and then SHARE them with everyone you know.! Gus was adopted by Lindy Terrell. She had previously adopted Max and he always looked great and happy. So I felt G would be safe and in a good home. I could not have been more wrong! Around the first week of June...they told me Max had GRIEVED himself to death when their grandfather died. At that time Max was living at 1924 Shiloh Church Rd in Seymour. Well on Wednesday...I received a phone call that STUNNED ME! The lady on the other end of the phone said...I believe I have your dog...Well in 7 yrs of doing this...I am thinking that could be any one of about 400...I said which dog/?...Max... Well we may have 4 Gracies and a couple of duplicated other names BUT there has only been ONE Max! I said NO WAY! HE DIED THIS PAST MAY!!!!! She says BIG brindle pit with largest head she has ever seen...Then she says...he has special mark...I said YES!!!! The white mark on the back of his neck under his collar! ... So Paula and I bond...I cry/I laugh/I cry...She sends pictures...SO we are so happy about Max and Sylvia Rainey Simpson is bringing him back to Knoxville when she returns from Greeneville, SC . AND THEN IT HITS ME....Where s GUS? They check the folks that had Max...Not there but lead me to family of Lindy Terrell...I said I have called and text her with no answer at this number 8656796966. East TN Pit Bull Rescue wants G back and SAFE! I will drive anywhere I have to to get him. No questions asked. Additionally...The family says she has no business adopting animals because she cannot keep a place to live. I know she adopted a small beagle mix from the McMinn County Humane Society. She does not have that pup with her either. When Max was adopted Lindy and her husband Kevin Terrell lived at 101 County RD 656 Athens, TN. They no longer live there. I tracked them to another address where they had a web site that said they boarded. They have moved from there. Then Lindy said she was living in Cookeville and coaching a college soft ball team. She said her mother lived in the area...Thru ALL of this Lindy refered to the cancer that

animal.description: Kimba probably has a bigger personality than any dog you've ever met! This husky is a complete one of a kind! Every day is different with this girl; she's sweet and sassy, joyful and moody, loving and distant, independent and whiny, and incredibly smart! Kimba uses her astonishing intelligence to be very manipulative at times! She is very stubborn and will do whatever she can to get her way. This can be hilarious and adorable; however it is a behavior that needs to be worked on. She is also very possessive of her food and toys which, mixed with her stubbornness, can be a lot to handle. Kimba's ideal home would be one with a fenced in yard, few visitors and an owner who is willing to spend a lot of time training her! She absolutely cannot be homed with children or other animals. She requires somebody dedicated and willing to come up several times to learn how to train and handle her. Kimba is a real gem, and has just not been given a proper chance in life. If you are serious about putting the training into Kimba that she needs, then come meet her! Give this beautiful girl the home she should've had from the start!

animal.description: Sweet Lucy went to school every day, like a good little girl, and was loved by all of the teachers. However, Lucy is a timid, young Beagle mix who went to school each day because she was slowly starving to death.... and the staff would feed her, give her treats and some attention each day. It broke their hearts that she appeared homeless so one of the teachers took her home so she would be cared for.  She is healthy now, weighing about 35 lbs. Unfortunately, her foster has not had the time to work with her nor has she an understanding of how to help her get ready for her forever home and family. She needs socializing. She prefers females to males. She needs someone who has the time and desire to help train her. Sweet Lucy has waited so long to be loved.  Lucy is praying for a forever home that can shower her with lots of love & attention, showing her there is nothing to be afraid of anymore and to be committed to helping her grow and happily thrive.  Are you the one who will show her how the world is supposed to be? She is a beautiful girl... please consider giving her the life she deserves.

animal.description: Please meet Olive, our newest Chewy's Hope baby. Olive came into a shelter down south pregnant and heartworm positive. She was fostered until her babies were born and weaned. Her babies were then transported to a rescue. For whatever reason, Olive didn't get to go with her babies and was taken back to the shelter where she wound up on the EU list. I happened to see her picture late the night before she was to be Eu'd and knew that we couldn't let this beautiful little girl die. With the help of several amazing ladies, we were able to get Olive from Corpus Christi into our hands where she will get the treatment she needs and will never wind up in a shelter again! Thank you ladies for all your help! You know who you are. It never ceases to amaze me what can be accomplished when everyone works together with the welfare of dogs first in mind. Thank you EVERYONE who had a hand in saving this precious girl!

animal.description:
Sweet Miss Haylee is looking for her forever home! Unfortunately, this great girl hasn’t had the best of luck with adopters, so she has been back in foster while she waits for the right family.

Here’s what you want to know about Haylee:

*Approximately 4 year old Shepherd mix
*Fixed, UTD on shots, and microchipped 
*While Haylee is well trained and can pass her tests, she will be her best self in a home where she is the only dog
*High prey drive, so NO small furry or feathered animals 
*LOVES kids
*LOVES LOVES LOVES balls
*House/kennel trained, but has done well in her foster home not kenneled
*Loves sleeping in a pile of blankets
*Loves to snuggle
*Enjoys play time outside 
*Very smart 
*Graduated fully obedience trained, AKC Canine Good Citizen (CGC) ready, and PhD with Honors in Canine Life and Social Skills (CLASS) ready

animal.description:
Moose can only be placed with a very experienced dog person and a home without kids.

Moose is such a cool guy. He's a sweet boy who has lived his entire life on a chain.  We rescued Moose from a high kill shelter in NC.  He was found on the side of the highway looking for food and still had his chain hanging off of him.  Moose is a sweet boy who is very food driven and easy to train.  We have transitioned him from being an outdoor dog to living indoors.  His favorite hobbies are to stare out the window watching squirrels, napping on his bed (he doesn't get on human furniture) and going for his leash walk.  He glows when he's on his leash walks.  Moose needs an all adult home.  Moose needs to be placed in a single family home with a fully fenced in yard.  He has separation anxiety and food aggression.  Experienced dog owners only pls.  



If you are interested in this awesome boy, please email 

Breshkie@dogworldrescue.com

Our adoption application is the first step in our adoption process.  Please check to make sure you are within our adoption area before applying.  We schedule meet and greets based on an initial match with our online application.  

http://www.dogworldrescue.com/adopt/

animal.description:
Foxy and Goldie are in fosters homes in South East Arizona.  


Foxy and Goldie were given up by their owners due to a move. 

These two worry about each other if they are not in eye sight.   Each knows where the other is at all times.  

Goldie is 10 years old.  he is a bit on the overweight side, he weighs in at 100 pounds.  It would be to his benefit to lose the weight.  A few nice walks and a healthy food should be all it takes, as I believe he was eating very unhealthy in his previous life.  

Goldie is on thyroid which has helped him considerably

Goldie would even make an apartment dog, he would be happy to watch Animal Planet while his family is at work or school but then love to spend time with him for walks, hikes or any other adventure with his family.


Please call for an appointment to meet Goldie

602-316-8919 (no texts please)

animal.description:
Foxy is in a foster home in South East Arizona.

Foxy and Goldie were given up by their owners due to a move.

These two worry about each other if they are not in eye sight. Each knows where the other is at all times.

They need to be adopted together.

Foxy is 10 years old. She is sweet and kind. She loves her Goldie and they two dogs are great company.

Foxy was born without a foot, it does not cause her any problems but if she were to do a lot of walks on a sidewalk or street, she should have a boot, which are available easily. This misshaped foot on her hind leg, the veterinarian said, was a result of the umbilical cord wrapped around it in utero.

Nothing can be done to help or correct it, it does cause any problems, she gets along fine. She goes up stairs and is a just like any other 4 footed friend. We say she has 3 1/2 feet,

Foxy and Goldie do not cause any problems, they know the dog door, they are well house mannered, etc.

Both could be in an apartment.

Please give Foxy and Goldie a home





602-316-8919 (no texts please)
