animal.description:
Hi there.  I'm Ann.  I'm a sweet lovable lab mix girl.  I was born 8/7/2017.  My mother was dumped and some nice people gave her a place to give birth to me and my siblings.  I'm doing great and ready for my forever family.  I would need a fenced in yard to play safely with my family.  I'm up to date on my vetting, spayed and microchipped.  I do well in a crate.  I'm a very high energy lad so will do great with children and other dogs.  I can be exuberant at times.  I'm a bit timid at first but would warm up to my family in no time.  If you're interested in being my forever family, please email PAWS at shoalspaws@gmail.com or visit the website at www.shoalspaws.com to complete an application.

To adopt this wonderful dog, complete our online application at: http://shoalspaws.com/adoption/adoption-application/ Once we receive your application, our adoption counselor will review it and contact you as soon as possible.  Our adoption fees are: $125.00 for mixed or purebred puppies and dogs.

animal.breeds_label: Australian Cattle Dog / Blue Heeler & Harrier Mix
animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Hi, I'm Duke! I am a charming, happy, Cattle Dog mix, about 6-7 yrs old. I love to go for walks

or runs

(and I am really good at it!). I also love car rides, stuffed animals, and playing in a fenced-in backyard. I am completely house trained,

crate trained

,

and am very intelligent. I know what sit,

lay down

,

and stay mean, but I could use some more training to work on those commands and anything else you want to teach me. I love to run and play; I have a whole lot of energy, but I also love to cuddle, give kisses and be loved by my human companion

.

Basically, I just like to be doing what my people are.

I am very cautious of new people. I really prefer to come check you out first, and I really rather you don't pet me until I know you will treat me with kindness.

I may

have to meet you a couple times before

I know I can trust you

.

I can't tell my friends at Last Hope what happened to me before I came to stay with them, but all they know is that it takes me a while to trust people and be comfortable in situations. Because of this, I should not be in a home with young kids or teens.

My dream home would be with an adult family who is familiar with my kind of challenges and who has a physically fenced in yard. I also want 1 other playful dog around my size (50 pounds+) or bigger

to play with (I can play a little rough so they need to be tough like me) and a family who is very patient with me while I adjust to new people in my life.

I am a very loyal companion and I just want to please my humans!

Once I know I can trust you, I just want to be around you and will be your shadow as you go through your day.

I have also had my DNA tested! I am officially an Australian Cattle Dog/Harrier mix!

Last Hope requires that all pets be kept as indoor pets, be altered and current on vaccinations and preventatives. Our adoption process includes reference and vet checks and a home visit. The adoption fee includes: spay/neuter, microchip and vaccinations.
animal.name: Duke/Jock

animal.breeds_label: Australian Cattle Dog / Blue Heeler & American Staffordshire Terrier Mix
animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.

This handsome man is Biscoe! Biscoe had his DNA tested and we now know why he is so handsome! His most dominant breeds found were; Australian Cattle Dog, American Staffordshire Terrier and Curly-Coated Retriever! Don't you just love that face! He does great in the car and loves to explore and go on outings to the park. He loves going for walks and after the walk he would be your couch potato buddy! Biscoe would love a yard he could lay around in and sun bath! He would do best in a quiet home with low foot traffic. Biscoe has called the adoption center his home for a few years and takes time to warm up to people but once he knows and loves you he will love you for life!

If you are interested in Biscoe we ask you to become a volunteer at Last Hope Adoption Center.

Biscoe's adoption fee is $250 and includes his neuter, microchip and current vaccinations as well as a basic obedience class at Cedar Run in Hiawatha. Last Hope requires that all animals be kept as indoor pets only, altered, current on vaccinations and preventatives. Our adoption process includes reference and background checks, a vet check and a home visit

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Hi! I am Barclay. I traveled all the way from Egypt to find my forever home in Iowa. I like it here at the adoption center where I'v called home for a few years now. I had a pretty rough time before I came to Iowa. I am missing some hair on my back end, it happen Egypt and we don't know what happened but could be the reason it takes time for Barclay to warm up to new people. I am all healed up and would love home with understanding people. I would do best in a quiet home with my few people that understand and love me. I will need on going care for my skin so I don't get sores. The volunteers keep my skin nice and moisturized and away from the sun so I don't get sun burns. I know lots of commands, sit, down, shake and I am crate trained. I love to play with toys too! I like playing with other dogs but I need a home with no kids. Everyone says I am a very handsome boy.

If you are interested in Barclay we ask you to become a volunteers at the Last Hope Adoption Center so he can get to know you! Barclay has stranger danger and takes time to warm up to new people.

Barclay will need an owner who has previous experience with dogs who have behavioral issues.

Barcaly's adoption free is $250 and includes his neuter, microchip and current vaccinations as well as a basic obedience class at Cedar Run in Hiawatha. Last Hope requires that all animals be kept as indoor pets only, altered, current on vaccinations and year round preventatives. Our adoption process includes reference and background checks, a vet check and a home visit

animal.description:
Snuffles is not for adoption.  He is part of our palliative foster care program.  If you'd like to sponsor Snuffles by donating towards his care and medications, that can be done through our website, and your donations are tax deductible.  Here's the link:

www.lowermainlandhumanesociety.org


Snuffles was born in 2005 and was surrendered in 2017, after his owner fell ill and could not longer take care of him.  He is a sweet old man, but he does have grumpy moments.


Snuffles has been diagnosed with dry eye conjunctivitis and requires cyclosporine drops 2 x a day ongoing.  Unfortunately he doesn't enjoy receiving these drops and can be very difficult about it. 

Snuffles is totally house broken. Because of his age, he has the old man bumps on his back and some on his face.   Doesn't cause much trouble, and we were advised by the vet that the bumps on his eyes do not cause him any vision troubles, and do not have to be removed. 



If you are interested in sponsoring Snuffles, please go to our website to donate.

http://www.dhanamettarescuesociety.org

animal.description:
I AM IN FOSTER CARE! PLEASE FILL OUT OUR ADOPTION APPLICATION, ONCE APPROVED, GIVE US A CALL AND WE CAN SET UP AN APPOINTMENT FOR YOU TO MEET ME!

I am 2 years old, 63 pounds and I'm great with other dogs.

Adoption Donation: $300

All dogs are microchipped, neutered, current on all vaccines, heartworm tested and started on Tri Heart Plus; Vectra 3D.

All household members and any dogs from the household need to be present at the time of the adoption.

Our website is always kept 100% up to date with who is currently available.  As soon as animals are adopted, they are moved to the Adopted Pets page so if they are still listed on the Adoptable Dogs or Cats page, they are still available. So keep any eye on the site for any animals being added as available for adoption as new animals are added everyday! We would recommend if you haven’t done so already that you submit a general online adoption application with us so it is on file for when you are ready to come out and adopt. The adoption counselors will be able to show you many that would be a good fit for your family. Animal House Shelter can not guarantee breed or breed mix of our adoptable animals. The animals are posted on the website as a breed or breed mix based on their physical characteristics they most resemble. We also can not guarantee the ages of our adoptable animals.

Please fill out an online adoption application. Visit our 'Adopt' page to view adoption process steps, policies, requirements and FAQ. View our 'Visit' page for hours and directions to our shelter. We look forward to seeing you soon!

animal.description:
Kojo is quiet and slightly shy when he first meets people.  He may do a little growl as well but usually warms up with a treat and letting him come to you on his own.

We don’t know a lot about his past. We were told he was given up to a shelter because the owner could no longer take care of him. Kojo has met new people while at Briggs and has been fine around them, even sitting on the futon with people quietly.

One thing that we’ve recently found out about Kojo is that he becomes very bonded to his human companion(s) and then becomes protective of them by getting in between and trying to snap at a person who hugs his human companion.

For this reason, Kojo is considered a “Special Needs” dog. He should not be around children or cats. Kojo’s best home would be with a single person who does not have visitors. This way, he can just hang around with and provide companionship for that person. Kojo just wants to be with his human companion and challenges anyone who shares his space with that loved one.

Kojo is responsive to verbal correction, if he realizes that he cannot get away with his challenges. So it’s imperative that his new owner establishes with Kojo that it is not acceptable to be so protective. That can usually be accomplished by an immediate, strong verbal wording and a “time-out”.

Kojo is middle-aged so he would be best with someone who may also be middle-aged so they can just “hang out” together.

animal.description:
Out of state adoption avaialbe !

Boxie is a very sweet senior dog, between 5-7 years old,  she is very easy going and walks very well on a leash.  She is housebroke.  The only thing is, is that she can not be adopted to a family with other dogs, she must be the only dog, as in the past she has had issues with other pups. She does not get along well with other dogs but is a very gentle dog otherwise.   She would prefer a home with no small children. 
If you are looking for a calm, well mannered dog that wants to spend time with you and lay beside you she would be perfect.  She does not even bark much or shed much.

She would be perfect for a retired couple or individual. She is extremely quite and does not bark much and she would even do well in an apartment or small house as long as she can lounge on a couch with her favorite person :)) Will you give Her a chance to be your loyal friend? She will give you all the love she has and she is a true princess! She walks well on a leash.  She is so loving and is wanting her fur ever home and has been waiting for quite some time.  Don't let her breed or age deter you, she is a loving companion .  We always take the fur babies back into our care if for any reason it does not work out.

animal.description:
In her own words: I was saying to myself just this morning 'Venus, you know what you need? You need a person all your own.' So I sat down to write this post for the nice people at HOPE, because that's the kind of thing they do - find nice people for extremely intelligent and lovable furbabies. I shudder to type this, but I'm LAPLESS! That's right, I have no human lap to call my own. Could you be persuaded to volunteer yours? I can't wait to see my forever home!'
Venus is an active and incredibly smart girl who likes nothing more than to stretch her legs at the beach or at the park. She'd suit an active person who wants an outgoing and friendly companion - if you can lob a tennis ball, Venus will be your friend for life! She would like to be the only pet in her new home.
If you are interested in Venus and would like to fill out a Dog Adoption Application, please go to: http://www.homelesspets.net/adoption-forms/dog-adoption.php . Submitting an application does not obligate you to adopt from us but it initiates contact with us and gets the process started. If you have questions prior to filling out the application, email us at HOPEDogCommittee@groups.io and a volunteer will get back to you.

She's come a long way from her days of living a life outside or in a trashed out vacant home in the D laying on dirty piles of old clothing in a dark and waterfilled basement. Princess loves hugs and belly rubs and enjoys walks on lead. she's crate trained and continues to be worked with some reactivity when she in in the crate. This royal gal really needs to be an only dog since her up bringing was cruel and neglectful. But that doesn't keep her from being a loving and sensitive sweetheart. Princess deserves a life better than she's had.

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Sissy is a true gem that's been overlooked for a family of her own. Sissy just loves affection, attention and some good old doggy treats and cookies. She'll practically do anything for something to eat! Sissy is a bit timid when meeting new people and due to the fact she's had some eye surgeries some decreased vision in her right eye makes her a bit unsure in some instances. All she's getting now is eye meds every day since the biggest issue is dry eye and repeated entropion surgeries. Sadly they may have made her syptoms worse. But it really doesn't stop her. Sissy loves kids other dogs and playing in the hose and wading pool during the summer! She also loves to take hikes to the creek and wade through the clear, moving water watching the fish! She's excellent for her baths, ear cleanings, nail trims and getting her eye meds put in. I think she knows when I do that her eyes feel better. In a perfect world I'd like to Sissy get adopted togeter with her sister Queen. Or at least go to a family with another dog so she has that companionship.
ADDITIONAL MEDICAL CARE:
Sissy may require eye drops daily as a result of the eye surgery she had:
Entropion is the inward curling of the eyelid so that the lashes scratch the cornea and cause irritation and eventual scarring and ulceration. It occurs when the eyeball is too small for the socket and the lids roll in toward the eye. 1/14/21 5:26 PM

animal.description:
Unfortunately sweet Frannie has been diagnosed with terminal cancer and she is now with a wonderful hospice foster. If you would like to help us with her care please contact us.
Name: Frannie
Approximate Age: roughly four
Weight: 45 lbs
Demeanor: this sweet girl has such a lust for life and only wants to make you happy. 
Energy Level- when sweet Frannie will greet you with the worlds most energic and happy hello! Once you're past that she's equally happy to go play in the yard or curl up on the couch. 
Outgoing/Social- she has yet to meet a person she doesn't love, or a face she doesn't want to lick!
Submissive/Dominant- dominant
Affectionate- the most loving girl you'll ever meet! 
Likes/Dislikes: 
Car rides- she does great in cars!
Cats- no
Other Dogs- prefers to be your one and only pet
Particular Toys- this sweet babe loves to chew her bones, and play tug-o-war 
Manners: Francis is a quick learner that only wants to make you happy. 
House Trained- yes!
Crate Trained- yes!
Leash Trained- yes
Verbal Commands- no, sit, leave it, down, and place (crate). If you use her full name in a stern voice she immediately lays down and waits for you to tell her what to do, or love her and tell her shes okay.
Tidbits/Endearing Qualities: just wants the love of her human

animal.description:
Meet Ash!

Ash is about 3-4 years old and came to us when he was a pup and was adopted into an amazing home where he spent his days relaxing in a comfy bed in the corner of his mom's Pilates studio and just provided to the cuteness of the atmosphere while his mom taught Pilates classes. You see, Ash just LOVES his people. He is not high energy, his foster says he is a couch potato.

Unfortunately, Ash is a victim of hurricane Harvey now. Multiple people in his family lost their homes and Ash is also part of that loss. Ash is a small to medium size boy, about 40lbs and fully vetted, neutered and house trained.

Ash has developed Masticatory Myotisis which is a big word for basically, lost some muscle tone. He had a huge head, and now his head is a little smaller. The vets say this was caught soon enough and is under control. And is kept at bay with a small dose of prednisone. And other than a "normal sized head" there are no other effects that Ash is showing. Please do not let that stop you from adopting Ash. We'd be happy to talk with you about this!

Visit www.scoutshonor.org and complete an application today if you can give Ash his forever home.

animal.description:
ALICE is sponsorship only at this point, as she has damaged ankles and toes and her right eye needed to be removed.  She was rescued from one of the Los Angeles City Animal Shelters just in time.  She was slated for death because they claimed she was still on medication, which in fact she no longer was!  

Alice now receives cold laser treatment to her various joints every week which has enabled her to move about well and be able to walk smoothly without the pain that she had before.  Her treatment has also shrunk the swelling on her ankle joints.  Her remaining eye is now very healthy and she can see out of it very well.  For Alice's supporters we can provide the name of Alice's veterinarians and copies of all her vet bills.

To meet and sponsor Alice, please contact:   theanimalsleftbehind@socal.rr.com  (also our Paypal donation/sponsorship email address)

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.What a softy I am! I love to cuddle - Requires l TPLO - Taz is the most beautiful brindle with a broad white chest. He is a gentle giant at 92 pounds. This boy is a world class cuddle bug. He has an adorable paint spot of white on his nose that just enhances his beauty. Taz loves to play with his siblings and foster brothers. Taz loves to cuddle and give kisses. This guy is a bundle of gentle love and affection. Great with kids and other dogs. How could you not fall in love the Taz Man?
Taz is a compassionate guy. He loves to play with our Chihuahua pups and Oscar, our special needs pup. He knows that they are special and he can't play as rough with them as he plays with his siblings. He is an amazing dog. Taz is looking for a loving home - could that be you?
Mom did my DNA test and Surpise! The results are here! Please contact info@aarfhouston.org for more information about this dog. You can apply online at www.aarfhouston.org/forms . Once your application is approved, we will schedule a meet and greet. Thank you for considering a rescue! The adoption fee includes vaccinations, Bordetella, de-worming, rabies, spay/neuter and microchip. There is a an additional $12.99 fee for Home Again for a lifetime registration of the microchip.
Puppies cannot be adopted outside of the Houston area until they are spay/neutered after they are 4 months old. It is against the law in the State of Texas for a rescue not to be sterilized so we have to make sure it gets completed and that we have record of it.
NOTE: In our bios, we provide information based on our volunteer's experience with a particular dog; such as temperament, training, and ability to get along with others.
AARF is a 501(c)3 Non Profit, all breed, no kill organization. Our group is always in need of donations in order to continue to give the needed medical care to our rescues. Adoption fees do not begin to cover all of the medical costs. Any donation , no matter how small is a big help and is greatly appreciated. Please help us to continue to help them. Thank you.

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Theo is a great Big cuddle bear! He is a special needs dogTheo is a gorgeous Brindle boy with a flash of white on his chest and a black face that just screams to be kissed. Theo is a confident boy who loves to play in the yard with his siblings, or play tug with his siblings. At the end of the day, before we go to bed, he has to have a snuggle with mom on the couch. As adorable as this boy is, he will be happiest with a sedate household that just want an adorable loving guy to snuggle with. He will not be a running companion, nor will he do well with lots of stairs. But Theo loves to go in the car and slow walks around the neighborhood.
Theo is anxious to learn and will be an awesome family member. He is best suited to a family with a yard. He has grown up with chiuahuah's and larger dogs and is a very compassionate guy who plays gently with his friend who is special needs. He was a bottle baby and has only known love and affection. Theo has a depth perception problem so doesnt like to do stairs or cross over colors that he isnt familiar with. Like on walkway crossings.
Theo had a genetic defect and both of his back knees have had TPLO surgery to correct. His right ankle fluxates, but there is nothing to be done with it.
This young man is perfect. He loves to cuddle and lives his treats. Theo has the sweetest purring sound when he is playing with the other dogs. He sounds like a bull horn when he gets nervous. I cant imagine anyone could love this boy more than I do, but he is available for adoption to the right family who can care and love him.
Please contact info@aarfhouston.org for more information about this dog. You can apply online at www.aarfhouston.org/forms . Once your application is approved, we will schedule a meet and greet. Thank you for considering a rescue! The adoption fee includes vaccinations, Bordetella, de-worming, rabies, spay/neuter and microchip. There is a an additional $12.99 fee for Home Again for a lifetime registration of the microchip.
Puppies cannot be adopted outside of the Houston area until they are spay/neutered after they are 4 months old. It is against the law in the State of Texas for a rescue not to be sterilized so we have to make sure it gets completed and that we have record of it.

animal.description: Ladies, are you looking for a new BFF who will never let you down?  Meet Meg, a four year old female Terrier/Beagle-mix with a spunky personality.  Meg is a stocky little spitfire who weighs around 30 pounds.  Shh! Don’t tell her, but she is a little on the pudgy side.  She loves women and becomes very attached to her person.  Meg would do best in an adult home where she can always be by your side.  She has good house manners and is completely housebroken.  One of her favorite things is going on long walks.  Meg is all smiles and wiggles the moment she sees the leash.  Though exuberant at first, she quickly calms down and is a dream to walk.  Meg enjoys her time playing outside at the shelter with her doggie friends.  A calm, submissive dog would be a good companion for her.  A fenced in yard will be needed to make sure she is safe from wandering.  Meg will be a faithful companion who only asks for love in return.  Please give this chunky monkey girl the second chance she truly deserves.  To adopt this pet, Click "More About Us" and then "Adoption Application" to be directed to our online HSNWGA application form.  You will be contacted by our Adoption Coordinator once your application is reviewed and approved.  Due to high volume of applications, we are only able to contact those applicants that best meet the needs of that individual pet.

animal.description: Dove is a 3yr old puppy at heart with a lot of awesome training under her belt. She was brought in as an epileptic alert service dog and went through six months of work towards becoming certified. She's fully crate trained, knows many commands, leash trained, fantastic with children of all ages, loving, and an absolute champ at cuddling. Dove does need to be an only dog, however. She was the victim of some pretty serious abuse when she was a puppy and now sees other dogs as a threat to her life. She needs to be in a home where she can love and play and be the wonderful girl we know her to be without having to fear that she'll be attacked by other animals. Dove would do so well as a family girl, or a hiking companion, or a fellow couch potato (she loves watching baseball games). She would fit in any place that can allow her to be the only pet. Please contact us at 520-977-8000 or 520-406-7533 or fill out an adoption applications at smilingdogrescue.com

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.
Online Adoption Application 
Hansel is a sweet boy who has come far from the day that he was surrendered to our care. He loves going for walks in wooded areas, rolling in the grass, and swimming in little pools or lakes. This loving dog is great with all animals big or small. Morning time is Hansel's favorite time of the day. As soon as he wakes up he seeks out cuddles and genuinely looks forward to saying 'good morning' to you. Going for a trip to the dog park and getting lots of treats are the makings of a perfect day for this little man. Hansel is particularly fond of toys that squeak and always sniffs out spare slippers and socks to snuggle in bed with (yes he really cuddles with them). He loves sun naps and drags all his toys outside to take naps with him. This dog would be perfect for an outdoor enthusiast who is looking to add another dog to the family. Hansel will sleep all day if you let him, but when you bring him outside he unleashes all kinds of energy and joy. Due to the the world he grew up in, Hansel requires a week or two of patience for him to come out of his shell and show his true personality. He grows quite attached to whoever he bonds with. New environments are stressful for him but he adapts with praise and consistency. Hansel looks to other dogs in the home for guidance and confidence so having a doggie sibling or two in his adoptive home would be ideal. A calm and loving home will be best for our buddy but we think he'll do ok with older, quieter children too. Hansel is very attentive to his human's emotions and body language and would be an awesome addition to your family!

animal.description:
Birthdate: 2/12/2015

Breed: One of a kind

Weight: 80lbs

Peanut and his gorgeous dreamy eyes will wow you everytime! Peanut loves to go out on his long walks, and when he returns will play in the play yard with his favorite rope toy or fetch a tennis ball for you. When he wants you to pet him he will gently raise his paw for you, or back up into you for a quick rub on the back. He loves his special time with the volunteers, and just imagine how he would feel having special time with his forever person/s. Peanut is a big boy and probably too much for children, but if you love to walk, play fetch and want a buddy to do it with, Peanut would love for you to come and meet him. 

*Peanut is on a training plan and requires more than one visit with our Behavior team. If you are interested in meeting Peanut, please contact us at adoptions@pawscrossedny.org for more information!*

Before you can adopt sweet Peanut, please complete an adoption application on our website at pawscrossedny.org! Once your application is approved, you will receive a link to schedule an appointment online. If you have any questions about Peanut, please email us at adoptions@pawscrossedny.org for more information. Please understand we cannot hold any pet. All adoptions are done on a first come, first adopt basis for approved applicants.

The Shelter software system requires that we choose a predominant breed or breed mix for our dogs. Visual breed identification in dogs is unreliable so for most of our dogs we are only guessing at predominant breed or breed mix. We encourage you to select your new companion by considering each dog's individual personality and pet qualities instead of relying on a breed label that is only a guess.

animal.description:
My name is EFFIE and I'm a darling 7y F Blk/White Chi X. I'm 12 lbs of PURE SPARKLING BLACK DIAMOND. I'm being rehomed due to a "new baby" and "no time". I was diagnosed with diabetes and need 2 shots of insulin daily and must be on a special "homemade" diet. Regardless of my condition, I'm a VERY SPECIAL little girl. I'm super sweet and lively and have a perky fun loving personality. I'm very affectionate and love to snuggle next to you on the couch. I'm nervous around young kids so an ADULT ONLY home is best for me  where I can get full TLC.  I am ok with other dogs and have lived with another dog & cat; but I would prefer to be a SOLO DOG.  I'm nervous with new dogs on the street at first so I can be a little vocal but once I get to know the dog I'm fine so a QUIET HOME in the suburbs would be preferable as opposed to an apt in the city.  I'm a typical chihuahua in that I will "alarm bark" and let you know if there someone in the hallway or at the door. In the house I love to hang out on the couch or snuggle in bed and I like to sleep in late! I'm a GEM OF DOG!! Please come meet me today!

For more info/app; please email: INFO@TAILSOFLOVERESCUE.ORG

animal.description:
Gorgeous redhead looking for love. 

 Adrian is 8 years young, and equal parts spunky and couch potato.  A lover of walks, a master of learning new commands as well as agility moves, she also loves long naps and will steal your spot on the couch when you get up. "Thank you for warming up this spot", says Adrian! 

Adrian loves affection, giving it as good as she gets it, and loves to make a nest out of her blankets and bed. Her foster mom tells us she listens well, is super smart, doesn't touch anything that isn't hers/given to her, and simply wants to be with her person all the time.

 Adrian would prefer to be the only pet in your home and will shower you with love so you will realize you only need her.

 Snuggle buddy, walking partner, meal companion (she doesn't beg), TV watcher if that's what you want to do, Adrian is the perfect best friend who is happy if you're happy. And she's happy as long as she's with you!

She loves going for walks and even better at the beach She loves the water 

Housetrained, spayed, microchipped, current with all vaccinations, and ready to curl up on your couch!

Please fill out this application by copying and pasting the link into your browser

https://poshpetsrescueny.org/dog-application/

animal.description: Tritan was rescued from animal control in Ottumwa after being abandoned by his owners.  He is such a happy, bouncy boy! He has this little prance he does when he's happy and playing. He loves his foster families kids! He tucks them in every night. He LOVES to play! Especially with balls, stuffed squirrel, his nerf toy frisbee and rope. He loves chewing on his nylabone. He kennels well and has his bone when he's in his kennel. He knows wait, leave it and sit.  He will need more training to continue to work on his manners. He just needs some treats with his training since he is very food motivated. He is not food aggressive at all. His personality is really starting to come out. He's so sweet, snuggly and funny. He's really excited when he's let out of his kennel, he's playful but mostly calm. He is very interested in the cat owned by his fosters and he has chased him. He may be fine with cats it will just depend on the cat. He does well on a leash with his harness. He does well in the car. He doesn't like going to the vet, he's very nervous but does well during the exam.

Lila is a beautiful 3-5 yr old Lab/Vizsla mix weighing in at 54 lbs! This girl spent a majority of her young life on her own fending for herself without much socialization. animal.description: Stitch prefers to spend her days quietly curating her tennis ball collection.  To this mellow 7-year old lab/shepherd mix girl, tennis balls = life.   She loves everything about them: their perfect shape, their chewy, nubby texture, the way they fly through the air like neon orbs of happiness, the way you can almost fit 3 in your mouth at once, with some concentration.  Stitch is living with a foster family right now and has settled into an easy, relaxed routine.   They adore her company.   Her foster mom says she’s so mellow and low-maintenance.  She does very well on her own at home, but Stitch also enjoys being close to you when you are around.  Her foster mom says Stitch will quietly follow you from room to room,  but she is never pushy or too much.  She will wait for you to ask her to jump up on the couch.  If you would prefer the couch to yourself, that is okay with her, too.   She thrives on the routine of living in a home with her people.   That is her true happy place.  The only time she gets a little nervous is when she goes outside into the world and gets thrown off her game — by strangers, noise, etc.  So, while she loves exercise and play, Stitch is more of a homebody, who prefers to focus her adventures on the backyard she knows, minus the long walks in strange new places she doesn’t know. She would do best in a home without young children.
animal.name: Stitch

animal.description:
Are you looking for an intelligent and fun-loving sidekick for your active lifestyle? What a coincidence, so is Julio!

Julio came to us after being mishandled for much of the first year of his life. He was clearly stressed and traumatized, but bounced back quickly with some Friends For Life TLC. With gentle training techniques, he is learning to feel confident with different people and situations.

With every day that Julio spends at FFL, we love him more and more, and this is why:
-Julio is a canine genius! It only takes one repetition for him to learn a new trick. He knows how to sit, lie down, go to his mat, make eye contact, and come when called.
-Julio is easy to please! He not only works for treats, but he will perform his trained behaviors for toys, a chance to put his leash on, or for you to open the door for him.
-Julio is so much fun! He can chase toys all days for you and, even better, he’ll bring them back and relinquish them to your hand automatically, no commands needed!
-Julio does like an occasional massage and belly rub, but he’s not clingy. He’d much rather play than cuddle.

Julio is a bright, enthusiastic, and tenacious guy who could be your ideal activity partner – if you wouldn’t mind hanging with a dog who may just be smarter than you!
animal.name: Julio

You can see this in his eyes in the pictures. He is very willing to please and easy for a good handler to walk on a leash.
please fill out an application at www.LindaBlairWorldheart.org and you can see our other great dogs up for adoption.

animal.description:
Hi, My name is Molly.  I am currently in the Houston, TX area. I am an incredibly sweet girl who is about 2 years old.  I was given to a homeless couple who could not care for me.  Luckily they were able to give me to a friend of theirs, Sherrille who has a rescue group.  Being a stray, I am not sure what breed(s) I am.  I am thinking  maybe Lab and Pointer Mixes.  Sherrille is fostering me and tells me that I am so smart for such a young girl no matter what I am.  I love sleeping in my crate and running around the play yard playing with my new friends.  So far I have managed to have good house manners.
   I would really like a family or human of my own.  A family or human who can give me attention, petting, play time, teach me the ropes, have patience with me and maybe enroll me in an Obedience and Behavioral Class, because I have so much energy I would love to go on long walks or hiking in the mountains would be awesome.

My adoption fee is $150.00.

If you think you could be that family or human, please text or call Sherrille @ 281-706-0242 or Penny @ 713-824-2737 or email @ pennykbryce@gmail.com

I will be looking forward to meeting you soon!

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Marshall County Humane Society is now following CDC guidelines for Covid-19 in order to keep everyone as safe as possible. We are showing dogs and cats to prospective adopters, but only on the grounds outside our shelter. We will need appointment to show the animal and we will want to have social distancing of 6' while you are there and we are wearing masks. We are doing Zoom interviews to see inside of your home since we aren't going into homes for home visit. We do come to your home before finalizing adoption to check the security of your fence if you are adopting a dog. Our dogs are given much care and attention and we treat every medical need of animal once we take them in.
MCHS is a limited intake adoption center. We are an all volunteer, non-profit organization. All of our animals are disease free, have been spayed/neutered and are up to date on shots. We charge a Dog adoption fee of $125 which includes a microchip. Our Cat adoption fee is $75.00. Most of our dogs will require a fenced yard. To fill out application, go to our website Marshallcountyhumanesociety.org, go to Adoption Info tab and click on Application. For more info, call 662-564-2900. I'M TOOTSIE AND I'M AN ADDICT.
When I see cats I go after them. Do you think I need to go to therapy? The volunteers at the shelter where I live say I'm the very best dog. I housetrained myself and I get along well with all the other dogs and I love being with people. I'm trying to understand why everyone who has wanted to adopt me has a cat; when they hear about my problem, they don't want me any more. Is there anyone out there who wants a gentle friendly girl that doesn't love cats?
All Marshall County Humane Society animals have been spayed or neutered, up to date on all shots and vaccinations, plus flea and heartworm preventatives. For complete list of our adoptable animals, or online applications, see Marshallcountyhumanesociety.org. For more information call Humane Society at 662-564-2900 or email Dogsncats11@gmail.com.
If you are interested in her, plz go to website; http://marshallcountyhumanesociety.org and go to tab 'Adoption Info' and click on 'Application.'

animal.description:
Sweet Lindy was a pregnant and homeless girl in GA who had no one. A nice family took her in and took care of her while she gave birth to her four puppies. She was a very good momma. Soon her puppies were all adopted out down in GA and then the family had to move and couldn’t take her - and Lindy had nowhere to go. It was looking like she would have to go to a high kill shelter in GA (owner surrenders are killed first). A Hamburg Mutts volunteer heard her story and knew she couldn’t let that happen. Thankfully, Lindy came to Buffalo and she is such a love – and a character. She gets the “zoomies” and runs around the yard so we feel she needs a fenced yard for her to zoom in. She loves to be with people, cuddling on the couch. She has the cutest little snore and makes the funniest little Chewbacca sound when she yawns!!

Lindy is smallish – she is 17” tall at the shoulder, and weighs 40 pounds. She is About 5 years old. . She is house trained, crate trained, knows basic commands, and walks well on leash with a Liberty Harness. She knows “leave it” for the squirrels & rabbits she wants to chase. She has a high prey drive so probably a house with no cats is best. She can live with other dogs, but slow introductions are best and she needs to be with a calm, balanced doggy like her current foster sister. Lindy is great with children, but we think older children would be best because if she were to have an energy burst, we wouldn’t want a little one to get knocked over by accident.

Lindy is currently working with a trainer, and her lessons can continue with this trainer with no cost to her adopter!! If you would like to make this sweet girl a member of your family please email hamburgmutts@gmail.com.

animal.breeds_label: American Staffordshire Terrier & Labrador Retriever Mix
animal.description:
To apply to adopt, please fill out an adoption application here:

http://littlebigdog.org/available-dogs/
I am a senior with the heart and soul of a puppy. I love to play play play. I love playing with other dogs. I am obedient, house-trained and crate-trained. I pack-walk off-leash and I stay with my pack! I walk nicely on leash with a easy-walk harness. I am 13+ years old. I'm in perfect health. When I get the "play" out of my system, I sleep like a born couch-potato! In other words, I am the perfect dog for an active person or a family with an active person. I require a fenced yard. If I am not an only dog, I must dine at a table for one. So no matter how much I might love my doggy roommates, I want to dine alone. I had an eye removed in the end of 2019. I prefer no surprises on the right side of my body. Speaking before approaching on the right is a good idea so that I'll turn my head and see you. I am charming and a lover. I love back scratches and I'm a world-class kisser. I don't do cats.

Unfortunately, I no longer match my profile from three years ago. Yes, there has not been ONE adoption interest in me in three years. I recently suffered two strokes. I am weak on my right side but I am independent and I still like to play! My cognition is not what it used to be either. I am slower in responding, and I am slow to eat, so my foster mom feeds me by hand. I continue to be house-trained with a doggy door, so my brain injury has not affected my indoor manners.Adoption fees are $200 unless otherwise stated. Senior residents of Dot's Old Dogs Home are generally not available for adoption. 100% of adoption fees are put back into the rescue so that another lonely and neglected chained/penned dog or yard-sale dog can be rescued. We are grateful for your interest.

Upon approval, the adoption fee is non-refundable. The fee includes the following: de-worming; grooming (if applicable); heartworm, lymes, ehrlichia and anaplasmosis testing; all vaccinations including rabies; flea and tick treatment, microchipping and spay/neuter.

Please contact us if you have questions about our adoptable dogs, we would love to talk to you!

animal.description: Hey, Hi my name is Patty and well I have been at the Sanctuary for over a year now waiting for my forever home. People have come to meet me but I have a hard time containing my excitement. When I jump up and wanna play tug with their coats they seem to get a little upset. I will work on that. Will you work on it with me. I have been to training class so I know how to behave but I seem to need lots of reminders. My excitement seems to override my common sense sometimes. I love love love love to play especially with tug toys and sticks. Oh sticks, I love small ones, big ones, ones that I can barely carry... oh sticks. I do like playing with some of the dogs here at the Sanctuary but they are the ones that follow my rules and let me be in charge. I am only a couple years old and have spend about half that here at the Sanctuary. Before then I was abandoned in a trailer with no food or water with my litter of puppies. Thank goodness I was rescued and all my pups found forever homes. So thats my story. I hope that someone somewhere will realize that I am the dog for them. Just go to www.libertyacresunited.com and submit an application to adopt me.

animal.description:
Spuds is a long legged lemon beagle/lab mix, 4 years old and 40-45 lbs. He's got a stubbed tail - shelter thought he had some cocker spaniel in him - we don't see it. He has developed some great friendships with other B&B dogs - might help if he was adopted with one of those companions.
Very selective of his people - not good with strangers. He will bite. But with the right people, he's a good boy- friendly, loves cuddles, mingles well with other dogs, runs around the yard, and follows his people obediently. Does well on a leash.
Here's how he likes to learn to trust: Someone come very frequently and spend 15+ minutes with him - less in the beginning. Check in with him - go volunteer with another dog or other task - and then back to him. Repeat this often and until he is happy to see you. That is how he learned to LOVE us here.
We rescue a fair number of very shy, unsocialized dogs - they can heal - if we, the people, don't mess it up. We use the help of a terrific trainer/dog whisperer - terristeuben.com
Please find our applications and valuable information under 'Adopt a dog'* on our website: *www.beaglesandbuddies.com* and email your application to beaglesandbuddies@gmail.com. Let us know your preference of appointment day/time and which dogs you are interested in and we will do our best to accommodate and email you the closest appointment available. Please allow us up to a week to get back to you. Most appointments will be Friday-Sunday, 10 am - 2 pm, for an hour.
*Note bring any other dog/s and the entire family to your meet and greet at B&B.* A complimentary training manual is included with each adoption, authored by terristeuben.com. Check out her website - she is fabulous!
B&B is glad to be open during the pandemic. We know the value and comfort of a loving pet companion and are doing our best to help the dogs and folks who need them. We update our website daily and are always rescuing, vetting, rehabilitating, socializing.
* We are accepting applications for volunteers to spend time with our dogs, hang out, sing/read to the shy ones, walk/toss ball with those who go to the playgrounds; cleaning, office work, gardening, and building/repair projects! *

Are you my furrever family?

For further info on the adoption process, please visit our home page and check out the "Adopt a Dog" section, which has thorough instructions. All our dogs are spayed/neutered, microchipped, and

fully vaccinated before adoption; they have been wormed, bathed, socialized, walked daily and much loved; each adoptee leaves with a leash, collar, and all medical records.

Our prices are higher than the shelters' because we nurse the dogs through their illnesses and get them needed surgeries and dentals. We also spend time socializing. Furthermore, unlike shelters, rescues do not get financial aid from the government and must rely on donations, grants, and adoption fees. Our fees for adults start at $150 and go up to $750. The higher end is for our most in demand dogs, such as young beagles and other purebred dogs. The lower end is for dogs who have been here a while. For puppies, we may go beyond this and charge $1000. The good news is that, because rescues fall under the "charity" category, the fees for our dogs are officially donations and are therefore tax deductible. You can think of it as donating to a worthy cause and getting a dog in return!

Sponsor Me

Beagles & Buddies must find ways to raise money so we can continue saving dogs. Your tax-deductible donation keeps our rescue kennel operating!

Hours

Friday: 10 am to 3 pm

Saturday: 10 am to 3 pm

Sunday: 10 am to 3 pm

Monday: CLOSED

Tuesday: CLOSED

Wednesday: CLOSED

Thursday: CLOSED



Weekday appointments may be available. We are a small staff and do our best to accommodate your needs. **Note that during COVID, we are not holding open houses on any day. Please email us for an appointment and include your application (found on our website, beaglesandbuddies.com, under "Forms"). Most appointments will be Friday through Sunday, though other days may also be available. We usually schedule one appointment per hour. Allow 1-2 hours for your appointment. Please look at our website and make a list of one or more dogs that you would like to see.

Contacting Us

If you have a question about adopting, giving up a dog, boarding, or volunteering, please visit the appropriate tabs on our
home page.

For more specific questions, call 626-444-9664 (please leave a voicemail if no answer) or email at beaglesandbuddies@gmail.com. Note that
Emailing
is always preferred!

Thanks!

Please note: If you are viewing this profile anywhere other than Beagles & Buddies own website, you are not receiving full info. Visit info on pet here.

animal.description:
Hi there! My name is Sissy and I am an eight (8) year old female pit bull mix. They call me Sissy because I am a really good sister to my canine foster sisters.

I really LOVE to gallop into the kitchen ahead of the human when it is time for breakfast or dinner! My foster mom is patient with me when I poke my head in the fridge to make suggestions on what she should put in my bowl. I like it when me and my foster sisters are finished with our meal and it is time for biscuits. We sit patiently and then catch our treats in our mouths!

My tail wags all the time. In fact, it wags so much that sometimes when it hits against the wall or couch, I think someone is behind me and take a look!

My foster sisters and I have figured out who is in charge of what in the house. When there is a cat in the backyard or when someone comes to the front door, I am the first one to sound the alarm! My foster mom had one of her friends bring over her small dogs to see how I would react to them. At first I was very curious about them, but after a while they were the ones following me.

I wouldn’t consider myself a cuddler, but I like it when humans pet me and give me hugs and kisses. When that is all over, I just go and lay down in one of my favorite spots in the house. I love to lay on couches because they are soft and comfortable for my older bones. I really like to be around humans, but I sleep by myself at night so I can guard the house.

I am spayed, microchipped, and vaccinated and available for adoption in the Los Angeles area. I am house-trained and know commands like sit and stay, and I really want a home I can call my own. Is it your home?

If you are interested in adopting Sissy, please fill out our application form online at www.jasonheigl.foundation/adopt/sissy. Contact us at info@jasonheigl.foundation

IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN FOSTERING OR ADOPTING PHIL, PLEASE GO TO THE MAKE A DIFFERENCE RESCUE FACEBOOK PAGE AND SEND A PRIVATE MESSAGE THAT INCLUDES YOUR PHONE NUMBER AND EMAIL ADDRESS..

Phil is a 4 year old Border Collie mix. He is very affectionate and loves to be around people. Phil loves to go for walks, be a copilot on car rides or just snuggle up to watch TV. He is very eager to please and is treat motivated so  it would be easy to train to do new tricks. He is dog social, but unfortunately we do not know how he is with cats. NO CHILDREN. Phil's forever home is required to have a PRIVACY fenced yard where he can safely run and play. He can jump over a chain link fence. Phil is neutered, up to date on his vaccinations, on monthly heartworm preventative as well as house and crate trained. Phil will make a great furry family member for a very lucky family!!!

All dogs we rescue stay with us until they find their forever homes. We do not do same day adoptions.  home visit is required to ensure our dog is going to a safe environment and our dog gets along with your dog(s) and/or cat(s). We require all our dogs over the age of 1 year attend 1 obedience class (6 week session) outside the home. You must live within 1 hour of Birmingham, MI to adopt one of our dogs. Phil's adoption fee is $275.

animal.description:
Another perfect pup, victim of Hurricane Maria, from Puerto Rico,.Ziggy is roughly 6 years old. He was a Sato rescue from post hurricane Maria Puerto Rico.  He is a gorgeous black and white pup who looks to be part border collie. His fur is silky and soft and he sheds but BARELY.

He likes to chill at home with his family. He is utd on all medical and in good health. 
He likes walks and being outdoors to romp but doesn’t necessarily require an active (working breed) lifestyle.

Ziggy knows:
Sit
Stay
Come
Paw
Other paw
Leave it 
Take it 
He is trained to use a doggy door.

He is easygoing most of the time, even when playfully roughhousing he can be trusted to be careful. 
Loves belly rubs. 
He loves to be able to park himself where he can look at a window. 
Knows the term “treat” which we generally use to refer to Greenies. 
FAVE TREAT: LOVES CHALLAH BREAD 
Will gladly take meds and supplements if they are wrapped in a dab of cream cheese and a little piece of American cheese to conceal. 
 
 ONLY EXP Owner for this purrfect pup--UNDER THE RIGHT CONDITIONS
Ziggy can be reactive due to fear aggression (we believe this to be a resulting of having had to survive on the street). His triggers are predominately food based. 
He can be very inconsistent around other dogs. When you walk him always be aware that he could seem at ease and accepting, and then suddenly react. 
 
While he is acclimating to his new home be aware of the following:
Make sure he is aware and see if you’re approaching so as not to startle him.
Approaching from the front and make sure he sees your hand coming before you touch him. 
Be hyper aware when there is food involved. Don’t approach him when he is eating from his bowl, he will react.
If he is sitting nearby when you are snacking or if you are giving him a treat, if he perceives someone is trying to take it from him, even in correctly, he will react. Always remember that he grew up on the street and had to fight off other animals for his food. 
Unfortunately, as a result, we believe Ziggy has some sort of PTSD. He is a very good gentle and loving boy, but if he perceives a threat, even if it is not actual, his first impulse will be to go on the offensive. 
 
In my home, he is a accustomed to being allowed on the furniture and on the bed, but can easily be retrained to stop that with reinforcement. We have him trained to sleep at the foot of our bed, where we give him his own little pillow. 
 
Ziggy will do best in a home where he is the only pet and there are no small children.  He is a working dog and is bored doing nothing...(aren't we all?)

Facebook: Zani's Furry Friends ZFF (weekly adoption event info posted here)
Instagram: zanisfurryfriends 
Twitter: zanisff 

Please fill out an application at http://zanisfurryfriends.org and return to 
dogs@zanisfurryfriends.org 

Many of us (cats/dogs) will be on display on Sundays and sometimes on Saturdays--please ask by writing us at dogs@zanisfurryfriends.org and following us on FB. If you are seriously interested in adopting one of us in particular, please fill out an application by Friday so that we can be sure to be there. Otherwise we decide based on other variables. Usually we are in our foster homes so this is a bit more stressful and a slightly artificial environment but we do want to be seen and find our furever homes too.

Please consider providing a home for more than one dog, especially if you are considering adopting a puppy. Dogs are pack animals and very much enjoy as well as need other dog company to learn to play, socialize and be good companion animals to people. The upside to this is that you won't feel as guilty leaving them alone and you get twice the love. Please come! And if you can't adopt, maybe you can foster or volunteer, and you can always donate!

animal.description:
MISSION • The mission of Rabun Paws 4 Life is to make a positive difference in Rabun County by providing a no-kill animal control and shelter to care for and protect animals from abuse neglect and abandonment.  We are committed to maintaining the highest standards possible for the humane and compassionate treatment of all animals.

Vision • Our vision is a forever home for every cat and dog in our care.

Values • Every animal has intrinsic value and the right to be treated humanely.  We seek to advance the welfare of companion animals through meaningful outreach and education programs.  We strive to end pet overpopulation through an affordable spay/neuter program.  Accurate recording of finances will be available to the public at all times, with transparency the goal of all our activities.

animal.description: Angel came here from animal control.  Her owner could no longer care for her.  She is an Akita/Husky mix that was so severely matted her fluffy coat had to all be shaved off.  Her reddish-brown and white coat is very short right now, but it is growing back!  Angel is now spayed, fully vaccinated, and weighs 50 pounds.  Her prior lifestyle is unknown, but she does show a definite dislike for other dogs.  Cats and other small pets would likely be seen as "prey".  Angel is friendly with people and really goes nuts for treats.  She is not always housebroke here-she just needs a personalized potty schedule!  Angel is aloof sometimes and probably doesn't understand why she is here.  She will be 7 years old next month.  Angel hopes the next 7 years will be spent in a "forever" home with loving care and yummy treats for her!  Update:  Check out her new pictures to see the "before and after" transformation!  She is much more social with people and is up to 67 pounds.  She has really blossomed  and would love the comforts of a home now that she is 8.

animal.description:
This dog is located at the Hearne animal control facility in Robertson country, TX.  This is not a shelter and does not have regular open hours.  You must contact Debbie at 979-279-6388 to discuss or meet the dogs here.  Until a few months ago, this was just a catch and kill facility with no adoption program and virtually no hope for the dogs that were impounded here.  A local resident (Debbie) and other concerned volunteers are leading a grassroots effort to save as many of these dogs as we can.  If you are interested in one of the dogs here, call Debbie immediately at 979-279-6388.  These dogs do not have the luxury of time.  The urgency can't be overstated.  
Unfortunately, in most cases we know nothing about the dogs' histories....medical or otherwise.  We do our best to learn about their personalities and will always be completely honest based on our observations.
Please visit our facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/pages/Urgent-Animals-of-Hearne-Robertson-County-Texas/472642442810842
A vet reference is necessary to adopt an animal from this facility.  To discuss fees and the adoption process, call Debbie immediately at 979-279-6388.

animal.description:
Hi!  My name is  Stella.  I'm a friendly young dalmatian labrador retriever mix female, about 4-5 years old, who ended up stray in the high kill East Valley shelter in Van Nuys.  Luckily for me, Rescue saw me and got me out of there quick.  Now I live with a group of dogs in a kennel in Newport Beach .. what fun!  I get to play all day long and have made so many friends, 2 legged and 4.  I am friendly with people and other dogs altho i do not like other dominant female dogs, I am well behaved in the car and while I could use some training, for my size and age I walk nicely on leash.  I have a nice short coat, easy to keep clean.  I am spayed, microchipped and have all my shots so I'm ready to go home anytime you call for me.  Couldn't you make room in your home and your heart for a long patch eared pup like me?

If you are interested in me, please contact Dalmatian Rescue of Southern California, Inc., by email to dalrescue@sbcglobal.net.  Upon submission and approval of an adoption questionnaire, to see if we might be a good match, arrangements can be made for you and your family to come meet me and my friends at the kennel where I live.  I am very much looking forward to finding my new family and forever home so please contact Dalmatian Rescue of Southern California, Inc., as soon as you can, and ask to meet me, Stella.

To learn more about Dalmatian Rescue of Southern California, Inc., a 501c3 non-profit charity, and to see all of our available dogs, please visit our website at www.dalrescuesocal.com.  You can also visit us on facebook at www.facebook.com/spottyfriends.  We love reading your posts and seeing your photos of life with your spotty friends so please, keep them coming.  Thanks!

animal.description:
Meet Avi! He is the true meaning of rescue.  Avi used to live with an abusive owner, until we changed his path! He has come so far, and has been clicker trained, but is still healing and will need a patient adopter who is willing to continue his training.  He is 4-5 years old and weighs around 55 lbs. He loves everyone he meets, but is not good with children or cats, and doesn’t understand why they move so fast.  He is slow to trust, but very playful and affectionate once he knows he is safe. Avi will jump a fence that is smaller than 6 ft tall, and will need long daily walks.  He currently lives with and loves his boxer bulldog mix foster brother, but knows he is the pretty one!  A home with another playful husky or other dog similar in size would be ideal! HUSKY EXPERIENCE REQUIRED. CANNOT BE PLACED WITH CHILDREN OR CATS.   If you want to be a part of Avi’s recovery and future, and are willing to invest in long term training, apply for him today! His adoption fee is $25.

All of our dogs come spayed or neutered, fully up to date on vaccinations, including rabies (if age appropriate) and bordetella, are microchipped, heartworm negative, current on flea/tick and heartworm prevention, dewormed, and treated for any ailments found upon veterinary examination. The adoption fee covers a portion of these services, and makes it possible for us to continue rescuing animals.  

For more information on the adoption fees and the adoption process, please complete our adoption application here: http://www.louieslegacy.org/adopt - an application allows us to get to know your family better so we can assess whether the animal you are interested in is a good match for your home. An application does not obligate you to adopt. You will receive an automated confirmation once your application is successfully submitted.  Please understand that due to the volume of applications some animals receive, we are unable to contact all applicants. If your application is considered a good fit for the dog you are interested in, or even a different pet, a volunteer will give you a call ASAP.  

We are a foster based rescue and do not have a shelter location where dogs can be seen during the week. Please see our Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/LouiesLegacy for our weekly adoption album if you are interested in meeting a dog in person. Not all animals attend every adoption event, please check our Facebook page for animal event times and locations before you make a trip to meet a specific animal.

Thanks so much for caring about a needy animal!

animal.description:
HOUND- Sleek cream jacket, tan oval spots near hips, tan at base of tail, around face and ears.  53lbs
ADULT MALE; Est DOB: 2015
ARRIVAL: September 9, 2017
HISTORY:  Owen was pulled from a high kill shelter when space became an issue.  At the prior shelter,  he had taken up with a family as a stray but they could not keep him long term.
MEDICAL NOTE:  Owen has limited range of motion in his left hip likely due to an untreated older injury.  He takes daily meds to manage his pain.   Owen runs and plays like any normal, happy dog and the limited range of motion in his hip does not slow him down…at all!

I’m at my best surrounded by toys and more toys and yes, a human by my side. Howdy, folks.  It’s me Owen.  I love to play. I love my purple stuffy!!! I also like to chase tennis balls. Folks have commented on how I can seemingly self entertain for long periods of time if given just a few simple toys.  I will carry and throw toys around and then roll on my back in great delight.  Still can’t believe the good fortune I have come upon in winding up at CFC!   I’ve never met a stranger and I’m told I’m graced with a super sweet disposition typical of many hounds.  I’m a good match should you already have a dog in stock but cats look just like small little toys to me so they are not a good choice for me!  LOL. I’ll admit, I get very excited when I see someone heading toward my pen with a leash. I get so excited it’s hard for me to focus on what I’m told. But I sure am enthusiastic with my affection! I’m not so happy when it’s time to go back inside the pen, though. Sometimes I have to be lured inside because I am so afraid I’ll be left alone again. I would love to be adopted by someone who could be patient with me until I gain some confidence and feel secure once more.

Staff Update Nov 2020: “Owen is a five-year-old hound mix who has been with us at CFC for about three years. The first thing you’ll notice about Owen is how much he loves his toys, especially his tire. It rarely leaves his mouth, with one employee describing it as “like a kid and his stuffed animal.” He loves people and food, although he can be picky with the latter. Owen is notorious for eating everything in his winter food mix other than the cherries. He is an energetic dog and loves to play. If he really likes you, he’ll nuzzle his head into you like a hug. Owen can be a little reactive towards strange dogs and loud noises, but after some time to get used to new dogs he warms right up to them. Does a friendly game of tug-of-war with Owen sound like your cup of tea?”

Update October 2020: It's Owen's time to shine! We're not sure why this incredibly handsome, fun-loving guy hasn't had more adoption interest, so we're giving him a moment to bask in the spotlight. Surely the right home is out there for him. Could it be with you?

Owen arrived at CFC almost exactly three years ago, and we've learned a lot about him since then. For example, we just recently learned he LOVES going for car rides! He hops right in and even flops on his back in delight as he settles in for a new adventure.

He gets super excited when he sees volunteers heading his way, and he has mastered the "sit" command. He is treat-motivated, which always makes training much easier, and he takes his treats very, very softly. He can be strong out of the gate, rarin' to go, but once he burns off some energy, he's a terrific walking partner. A regular exercise routine would keep him at his best. An old injury limiting the mobility of his left hind leg does not slow him down at all. He is eager and ready to hit the trails.

But what Owen is most famous for at CFC is his love of toys. Give him a toy, and he just lights up. You'll swear he's smiling as he runs around gathering all the toys, rolling around with them, and tossing them in the air. He can self-entertain, but he really likes to have a human partner in play. A note of caution though: he will tear his way through stuffed toys pretty quickly, so tough toys (especially with a squeaker) are the way to go, unless you enjoy cleaning up lots of stuffing.

We currently have Owen listed as a hound, but after spending some time with him, it's clear a flavorful mix makes up his genetic recipe. There might be a pinch of Aussie or Border Collie in there, or even Brittany Spaniel. Whatever his background, we think you'll agree that the result is one beautiful dog.

Owen is still young--only about five years old--and weighs in at around 53 pounds. He prefers a home without cats. He can get very excited meeting other dogs, and he hasn't quite mastered the art of politely introducing himself to them, but that is something that can be worked on through training.

If you're looking for a fun, energetic, happy dog, look no further! Email us at cfchome2@gmail.com if you have any questions or to set up a time to meet this joyful boy.

animal.description:
Taz is a sweet, well trained dog but unfortunately not getting along with one of our other dogs.  In the shelter he showed no signs of aggression toward other dogs or people.  When we got him home he acclimated quickly and integrated with our other two dogs just fine.  One of our current dogs named Outlaw (11 Years old) tends to have issues with meeting new dogs but once he is used to them he is fine.  Both Outlaw and Taz are mostly fine together but there have been a couple big fights over triggers (i.e. our neighbors dogs barking or other dogs being walked by our backyard fence,, food, etc..)




 We walk Taz with our other very passive dog named Kaleah (Shes a 50 lbs Pointer mix of some sort) and there are no issues with her.  




We hired a dog trainer and after two meetings to assess the situation they recommended we re-home Taz.  At this time they also recommend that Taz be crated while in the house to avoid any issues with him and Outlaw.  I have been working with Taz during our walks but his extremely intent at focusing on what his "triggers" are.  we have had visitors to the house and he is friendly to them but He is very excitable.  




So this is our dilemma, we do NOT want to send him back to the shelter center because as much as they are doing a really good thing for dogs they are still not No Kill and we feel he will be Euthanized.  He is really just too sweet to not try and help but he needs attention and care that we can not give him.  As well we feel restricted  because of our other dog that he does not get along with.

animal.description:
Hi!  My name is Kaya  and I came to rescue as an owner surrender.   I am 7 years old.

I had been kept on a chain, since I was a puppy and for the entire 4 years I lived at my former home.
I lived far away from my owners house, in a back field, and I never saw other people.  

I am not shy, but I do not understand this touchy thing people want to do to me, but I can tolerate being touched for a few minutes.  You see, I was never touched before, and I think it is strange and weird that people want to touch me.  But I like it when my foster mom rubs my ears....

My foster mom says I have come a long way since I got to her Bed and Biscuit back in February of 2017, but says I still have a way to go yet.

I do NOT like other dogs because they scare me (like the coyotes that came out of the woods and night where I used to live), and small animals are a food group to me (because I was so hungry), so no cats, rabbits, chickens...  you know...  

I am here at the Bed and Biscuit trying to learn how to be a good girl...  and if you want to talk to my foster mom about me, that would be ok.  But she is really going to be super picky about anyone that might be interested in me...  you know...

If you would like to sponsor my care, while I get better, that would be PAWSOME!
animal.name: Kaya - A work in progress

animal.description:
Our sweet Cosette is still looking for her forever family and her foster mom can’t figure out why! Cosette is a 12 pound, six-year old, spayed female Chihuahua who came into the shelter as a very scared little girl.  Now in a foster home, she gives great kisses and will snuggle under the covers if you let her.  

She is good with cats, dogs, even pigs and chickens, she loves kids, she rides wonderfully in the car, she is crate trained and potty trained! Cosette is a sassy little girl that will roll on the ground to scratch her back any chance she gets! She walks like a show pony and loves snuggling in your lap to watch a movie. She is perfect. She deserves the perfect family, could that be you? She will bring so much love and loyalty into the life of whoever adopts her. Cosette prefers to not be crated as she was isolated in a crate a good part of her earlier life and is thriving without crates. 

Potential adopters need to know that Cosette is being seen at the Eye Clinic for Animals twice a year and is on two kinds of daily eye drops which will be a yearly expense of about $585.

To meet Cosette or learn more about her, email fciaadoptions@aol.com. As we are currently not having any adoption events, we are asking interested people to please fill out our application at www. FCIAnimals.org and if it looks like a good match, we will arrange an introduction.

animal.description:
Goldie - or Munchkin as she's lovingly called - is a Basenji mix.  We actually have no idea what breed she is, but it's the closest explanation for the curly tail! Ha!  She was found abandoned with her 3 siblings living under a house at 5 weeks old.  But she's a fighter through and through!

You see, her siblings all left for homes in PA but she had to stay behind.  Goldie has a condition called Congenital Lymphedema, predominantly in one of her hind legs. It's very rare, the specialist who saw her said he's been practicing for 24 years and has only seen 2-3 cases.  After several consults, the vet feels confident that she's currently a happy, healthy, playful puppy and her life expectancy is 2-3 years. Initially, she was on several medications to help manage swelling and pain, but after switching to all natural methods including Tumeric and CBD oil, she is now off all medications and doing INCREDIBLY well--pain free!

We'd love for her to find a home where she can find that love and compassion for the 2-3 years she's got.  She lives in a foster home today with other dogs and holds her own!  She sleeps in her crate through the night and is house trained.  If you think you're the person or family for Goldie, please let us know!  We can also discuss more regarding Congenital Lymphedema and AJL's commitment to help with medical bills.
animal.name: Goldie

animal.description:
ELLIE was pulled from Indy Animal Control on 9/21/17. A 6 year old Sharpei Terrier mix, she originally came to us in 2014 as s 6 week old puppy. Ellie couldn't be sweeter! She's a bit of a goofball and fun is her middle name. Insist that she sit and eventually you'll get a funny girl rolling in the grass. Ellie is like coffee in the morning, she really perks you up! Her adoption fee is $150. Ellie is currently being treated with flea, tick and heart worm preventative.

Ellie was adopted in May 2018, but returned 4/22/19. Still as caffeinated as ever, her energy proved to be too much for her new family, especially with the added responsibilities of a new baby. Pets, like humans, have a range of needs - some need more attention, interaction and guidance than others. Ellie is one who needs that bit of extra help for her to reach the level of happiness where she doesn't jump or crawl under the fence or dart out the door. She's seeking an owner/family who will provide the mental and physical stimulation that meets her needs so she can be the dog you dreamed of.

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Wallie is a very active boy who has been thru a LOT of change after being rescued from a shelter, and then just a short year later evacuating from his flooded home during Hurricane Harvey only to lose his precious mom (a beloved fellow doxie rescuer) very unexpectedly in the aftermath. Her family chose to surrender 4 of her dogs to ATDR so we could help place them in loving homes as she would have wanted. It has been a confusing road for this sweet fellow, but Wallie is excited to find his new forever family. He loves to be petted and cuddle on the couch but is also very gregarious and needs a calm home with an experienced, but gentle and loving pack leader to guide him. His personality seems to be more like a Beagle. He gets along well with other laid back dogs, however he must go to a cat free home with no pocket pets. He also dearly loves his toys...they are his babies and he takes them to bed with him and he just loves to play fetch. It is his favorite thing. He uses the doggie door and will go outside to potty, but prefers to relax where the people are in the air conditioning. His Beagle side is very chatty when he is excited but he behaves very nicely in his crate at night and when his foster mom goes to work. Wallie requests a home with a securely fenced yard.
Wallie is ready to find his forever person or family. He knows they are out there looking just for him.

IMPORTANT!! Due to time and staffing constraints, ALL inquiries/questions MUST BE accompanied by your completed Adoption Application (Matchmaking Questionnaire). Please click on "More About Us" for the link to the form. Any inquiries/questions sent without the completed form will NOT receive a response. Thank You for understanding.
"Special needs" Ginger is an affectionate 4 year old girl who had a rough start in life.  She weighs about 13 lbs and is very friendly and playful.  For the first year of her young life, Ginger was strictly confined in a small crate with only a few potty breaks, and as a result she suffers from claustrophobia and is terrified of leashes.  Despite all this, Ginger loves nothing more than to jump up on your lap for a tummy rub, or sit beside you on the couch watching TV.  She loves to sleep in bed with you, too.

Ginger is perfectly potty trained and uses the doggie door without fail.  She likes toys and chew bones, and is fine with other pets.  Ginger is a loving girl in search of a forever home that is as special as she is.

Her adoption fee is $125 and includes her spay and all vaccinations.

For more information, please call "Sandy" at 602 993 9393.

animal.description:
Faith UPDATED 9/27/19

Aussie seeking starring role in It’s a Wonderful Life – canine edition!

This beautiful little lady has lived a life destined for the silver screen. After finding herself down on her luck, she is looking for an angel of her own to show her just how wonderful life can be.  Maybe that someone is you.    Faith is a smooth-haired merle Australian shepherd mix with lovely red and white markings offset by her striking blue eyes.  Faith is quite shy to start but this adorable girl is absolutely worth the effort.  Once she gets to know you, she is all in with belly rubs, kisses and tail-wagging galore!  Faith will truly blossom in a home where she feels loved, cherished and safe.        

Faith needs her angel to hold her paw each step of the way and give her the courage to come out of her shell and really embrace the beautiful life waiting for her. This also mean Faith needs a fenced in yard where she can be free to run and play, fetch and chase.  Faith will also be very happy curled up on the couch watching her favorite old movie with her new family.   After all, movie night is the optimal time to work on loving her, petting her, sweet-talking her, and outright adoring her until she finally concedes, “it’s a wonderful life after all”!  

Faith is between 3-5 years of age, housebroken, spayed and up-to-date on all vaccinations. She is not a candidate for leash training so she’ll need to be carried to those annual vet check-ups.  Faith would be fine with another canine companion in her forever home and has tested well with cats too.
