DOB 6.12.2016 

Lobelia is a very sweet girl. A bit on the shy side but warming up quickly
She appears to be a very quiet Lab/Hound mix.

She is affectionate and would love to snuggle on the couch !

This beautiful girl is looking for a loving Home to call her own. 

To inquire about Lobelia please complete  and submit our Adoption Inquiry at  
www.starsgeorgia.com/adoption-inquiry

Follow this link to view more pictures:  https://www.facebook.com/pg/starsga/photos/?tab=album&album_id=1926661354122637

Age and Breed are estimated to the best of our knowledge and no guarantees on size and temperament can be given.
Make sure you chose a dog by breed, size, energy level and age that will fit your activity level and lifestyle
We require a fenced yard (exceptions made on a case by case basis - NO exceptions for puppies or deaf/vision impaired dogs). We require that all other animals in the home be up to date on vaccinations and heartworm prevention (proof required)as well as spayed/neutered and that all dogs live inside as a part of the family. Our approval process consists of an application, vet reference, phone interview and home check.  
To start and speed up the adoption process please complete and submit our Questionnaire  BEFORE you inquire about our Pets.You can find the Questionnaire on our WEBSITE  
www.starsgeorgia.com
After submitting the Questionnaire we will contact you within 48 - 72 hours. 
Our Animals have been vet examined are ALL spayed/neutered via laser, vaccinated current to age, heartworm tested and kept current on monthly preventions. 
All Animals  ARE MICRO CHIPPED (registration included) All microchipped pets come with a 30 day FREE Pet Health Insurance.
 WE DO NOT HAVE A LOCATION at this time. All of our animals are in loving & caring foster homes. 
We are always happy to arrange a meeting so you can visit with our FOSTER KIDS.Just email starsgeorgia@yahoo.com or call 912-536-6893.Come and visit us at one of our Adoption Events.All events are posted on our Website
Get involved! HAVE A VOICE FOR THOSE WHO DON'T - HELP US HELP THEMFIND THE HEART OF A STRAY - ADOPT A PET AND SAVE A LIFE!

animal.description: Meet the adorably handsome Turko.  This brown-eyed beauty is about 7 years old now (September 2020) and originally came to us from a home with two female Dobies. Unfortunately, while the owners were away from home, their two chihuahuas crawled into the yard with the three Dobies and another large male dog which ended in the death of one of the little chihuahuas.  No one knows which dogs were involved or if a "pack mentality" took over but the owners decided to give up all three Dobies just to be safe.  Turko needed a bath and some vaccines but he was a pretty sweet guy so we got him fixed up and want to find him a new home.  He bonds really well to people and though he has some watchdog skills, he is well behaved with strangers.  Turko was an outdoor dog so he will need some introduction to indoor living but he is so bonded to people that we want to see him be a part of a family.  He only knew the company of the dogs he lived with before and we have only seen aggression towards other dogs we have introduced him to so he must be the only dog in the home.

animal.description:
Ginger is a 5 year old female mini lab mix. She's a perfect size, only 35 lbs, full grown with a gorgeous caramel coat.

Ginger is a sweet, very spunky girl who’s still very active but also has moments of being calm and laid back. Although she’s an inside dog, Ginger loves having a fenced yard where she can relax in the sun and run around safely in. She’s strong on leash for her size. An active owner is best, and a person who has owned and raised dogs. Ginger is a sweet girl but can be stubborn at times. She doesn’t like you to grab her collar until she’s very familiar with you and has gained trust. She’s good when she meets strangers, but can get very scared at the vet when she has to get shots and her nails clipped. Someone who’s owned multiple dogs in the past and preferably someone who’s even owned a dog with behavior issues would be a good match for Ginger.

She likes running around outside with other dogs and loves going for walks.  She loves people, plays well with other dogs, but doesn’t care for overly hyper dogs who jump on her.

She's never lived with small children, so a home with kids at least 12 and up would be best. Ginger is also housebroken, spayed, current on shots.

animal.breeds_label: American Staffordshire Terrier & Border Collie Mix
animal.description: Hello everyone, my name is "DIANA"! . I am a 3-4 year old, white/black Border Collie/ American Staffordshire Terrier mix.  Yes, they did a DNA test.   I weigh approximately 40 pounds. I am a sweet, bouncy girl with a loving personality.  I walk well on a leash,  very attentive to my person,  ride well in the car, love being near my person and consider myself a lap dog if allowed.  I am happiest being with you whether it is outside playing or sitting and watching TV.  I know my basic commands such as sit and come.  I am treat motivated, positive praise motivated and just want to please you by doing the right thing,  I have a silly side too which will make you laugh!  You can tell when I am happy by the smile on my face.  I like to play fetch, play soccer, sit in your lap and go for walks.  I know how to play and I know how to chill so if you are looking for a lover, please apply to adopt me!  I would love a home without cats and with a fenced yard so I can run off leash to fetch the tennis ball. A fenced yard will be a requirement.  I would make a great running and hiking buddy!   I am a very smart girl who can adjust to situations quickly. I would make a great sports dog too! I am particular about other canines and would be happiest as an only child. If interested in giving me a forever home, please complete an application at www.safeanimalhaven.com.  Thank you!

animal.description:
Handsome Kingsley is a great dog, handsome, fun, cute, and funny! He thinks he is a comedian. We find him to be a great, easy dog. He is self entertaining and great company!
About 4 years young. Watch his video and you will fall in love.
 He use to play all day with Puddles, until she was adopted, sitting on top of the igloo and has a ball. He is loving, playful, sweet and very handsome. He is  easy on a leash and loves going for walks on the trails or cuddling on the couch with volunteers.  He is gorgeous, dog friendly, loves people. He has a wonderful personality and would make a perfect companion to go running, hiking, camping or to the beach with.
He has a new friend in the video called Princess Grace! 
We do ask that adopters have canine experience with handling and behaviors, to live a happy life with their adopted dogs.
LBWF dogs are all athletic and need physical exercise and mental stimulation.

 He is up to date on vaccines, micro-chipped and neutered. If you are interested in adopting Kinglsey fill out an application today and tell us what a great life you have in store for him or one of his adoptable friends!!

Applications can be found on our website www.LindaBlairWorldheart.org under the Adopt Today tab.  Southern CA adoptions only due to home checks.
To see all of our dogs available for adoption please visit our website www.LindaBlairWorldheart.org
Follow us on Social Media Facebook/LindaBlairWorldheartFoundation

animal.description:
Tina is waiting for you.

She has been through a lot and really needs her next home to be truly forever.

Tina is a sweet girl once she gets to know you but it may take her a little extra time.

She doesn’t trust easily and with good reason having been discarded time after time.

Tina loves to play and enjoys the company of other compatible dogs.

Her favorite playmates seem to be smaller male dogs.

Tina can leap tall buildings in a single bound. Well, not really.

But, she is a fence climber and so potential adopters should be watchful even in a sturdily fenced yard.

She loves to leash walk and this may be the better solution to her escape artist antics.

Tina would benefit from a quieter home and a having a compatible dog in the home may help to build her confidence.

Potential adopters should also have experience with fearful dogs and how to handle them.

Tina has been known to nip out of fear when approached or touched by strangers.

For this reason we will not adopt Tina into a home with small children.

We would love to see Tina in a true forever home with adopters who know how to help her become her best self.

animal.description:
Ruffles came to TARP via Troy Pound in Troy, AL. She was severely emaciated, with large sores on her body from neglect. It took several months but now Ruffles is ready for adoption. Ruffles would do better in a single dog home or with one other large dog. She is very energetic so we recommend a home that does not have small children. She would love a home with someone who runs or spends a lot of time outdoors.

All dogs adopted through Troy Animal Rescue Project are up to date on vaccinations, spayed/neutered (age appropriate), and heartworm negative. All dogs are given monthly flea/tick preventative, monthly heartworm preventative, and are dewormed regularly. Dogs adopted through Troy Animal Rescue Project are microchipped. Adoption fee is $50. Home visit and vet reference required. Applications can be put in online at http://www.troyanimalrescueproject.org/adopt.php or in person at our rescue center.

The address for our rescue center is 34 County Road 2266, Brundidge, AL 36010. We are one turn off Hwy 167. If you use Google maps, type in Troy Animal Rescue Project and it will take you right to us. Hours of operation are from 10-3 daily. We are open Saturdays and Sundays. No appointment necessary for pets that are located at the rescue center. Appointments must be made to visit pets in foster homes. Appointments can be made by calling 334-508-2367 or emailing troyanimalrescueproject@gmail.com. Location information will be listed beside the pets name if they are at a location other than our rescue center.

Questions can be emailed to troyanimalrescueproject@gmail.com or call 334-508-2367.

animal.breeds_label: Jack Russell Terrier & Australian Cattle Dog / Blue Heeler Mix
animal.description:
Introducing volunteer favorite, Batty! 

Batty is a four year old neutered male Jack Russell Terrier / Australian Cattle Dog Mix who was returned back to the shelter after his human crossed the rainbow bridge. Upon arriving at the shelter again it was observed that with a lot of excitement or unfamiliar faces Batty can become overstimulated and reactive. Batty is a very smart boy who thrives for “tricks for treats” with all his favorite shelter people! Batty has been here at the Humane Society of Lebanon County since 7/25/2020. 

Once Batty gets to know you, he absolutely loves belly rubs and pleasing his people! Frankly, Batty loves his people’s attention SO much that he will need to be the only pet in the home. That’s right, he wants to be the only apple of your eye, so families with other pets, need not apply! Batty’s perfect forever will also include a family with no human kiddos please. Due to the unpredictability and increased activity of children, we feel Batty would flourish in an older adult only home. An owner who has patience and time to devote to training and positive socialization will be preferred. Batty will need a strong leader who is good with setting boundaries in order to ensure that he does not rule the roost! It will take some patience and numerous visits for Batty to learn to trust you, but once he trusts you, he will be your new best friend! Batty also will resource guard his “valuable items” and therefore need an owner experienced/educated in resource guarding in order to positively handle this mild blemish. 

If you are interested in adopting Batty, please fill out an adoption application on our website at www.lebanonhumane.org and email it to info@lebanonhumane.org. Applications are processed in order of the best fit for the dog, rather than first come first serve in order to ensure that we are setting both our animals and adopters up for success. Please be patient with our process as we are working on an appointment only basis at this time.

animal.description:
Birthdate: 11/6/2007

Breed: One of a kind

Sonya, our pretty lady, is patiently waiting for her perfect companion. Could it be you? Sonya is a loyal loving girl who is looking to live out her senior years in a home with a loving family. Ready for a committed partner to sit on the couch and just hang with you? Because that is Sonya's favorite thing to do! Even though she is a senior, she does still have some spring to her step and loves to be outside exploring and relaxing in the sun! 

*Sonya is on a training plan and requires more than one visit with our Behavior team. If you are interested in meeting Sonya, please contact us at adoptions@pawscrossedny.org for more information!*

Before you can adopt sweet Sonya, please complete an adoption application on our website at pawscrossedny.org! Once your application is approved, you will receive a link to schedule an appointment online. If you have any questions about Sonya, please email us at adoptions@pawscrossedny.org for more information. Please understand we cannot hold any pet. All adoptions are done on a first come, first adopt basis for approved applicants.

The Shelter software system requires that we choose a predominant breed or breed mix for our dogs. Visual breed identification in dogs is unreliable so for most of our dogs we are only guessing at predominant breed or breed mix. We encourage you to select your new companion by considering each dog's individual personality and pet qualities instead of relying on a breed label that is only a guess.

Birthdate: 7/11/2012

Breed: One of a kind

Majestic, stately, dignified, distinguished, solemn, magnificent, grand. All this describes this gorgeous boy in every way. Jasper would be an excellent companion! He is loyal and dedicated to the people he loves. A little about him from his favorite volunteer:

Jasper is an 8 year young gentleman. He is good on a leash, takes treats softly, loves people and enjoys tender back scratches. His is generally mellow and patient, but always up for fun - his face lights up when it is his turn to go out. This devoted companion loves long brisk walks, calmly exploring along the way. Jasper would love to get some regular exercise and he also enjoys just relaxing with his favorite people.

*Jasper is on a training plan and requires more than one visit with our Behavior team. If you are interested in meeting Jasper, please contact us at adoptions@pawscrossedny.org for more information!*

Before you can adopt sweet Jasper, please complete an adoption application on our website at pawscrossedny.org! Once your application is approved, you will receive a link to schedule an appointment online. If you have any questions about Jasper, please email us at adoptions@pawscrossedny.org for more information. Please understand we cannot hold any pet. All adoptions are done on a first come, first adopt basis for approved applicants.

The Shelter software system requires that we choose a predominant breed or breed mix for our dogs. Visual breed identification in dogs is unreliable so for most of our dogs we are only guessing at predominant breed or breed mix. We encourage you to select your new companion by considering each dog's individual personality and pet qualities instead of relying on a breed label that is only a guess.

animal.description:
If you have ANY QUESTIONS or are truly interested in adopting any animal from PAW Animal Shelter Please, fillout an adoption application FIRST! WE are a high intake No Kill Shelter ran by a staff of 4 and do not always have time to answer every question asked by so many. If you are a good fit for the animal you are interested in -we will call to speak with you, If we feel you are not a good fit , we will contact you about other pets that may be a good fit for your home. Many people are losing the opportunity to adopt the animal they want because they fail to put in an application and the pet was adopted before we could answer your email. .If you have applied for an animal in our facility and have not received a response within 7 days, PLEASE call or contact us again. Though we do our best in trying to answer all emails in a timely manner, sometimes things get away from us, get lost or misplaced. It is never our intention to ignore a request about an adoptable animal in our facility.

Sandy Brown, Director, PAW Animal Shelter

319-372-2274

animal.description:
Bentlee (Male Lab/Bully mix, DOB 4/20/15) came to us as an Owner Surrender when he was a year old. Bentley is a wonderful dog but needs an experienced handler as he is a bit stubborn and unruly. He was in a home with a young lady who gave him lots of love but very little structure and manners. He can be a bit over protective and needs proper introductions with other dogs. He does however like cats. Bentlee would do well in a home with an owner who has time and patience to spend with him. He needs plenty of exercise, set boundaries, rules and older children. In time, Bentlee will soon become the great dog he was meant to be.

If you have ANY QUESTIONS or are truly interested in adopting any animal from PAW Animal Shelter Please, fillout an adoption application FIRST! WE are a high intake No Kill Shelter ran by a staff of 4 and do not always have time to answer every question asked by so many. If you are a good fit for the animal you are interested in -we will call to speak with you, If we feel you are not a good fit , we will contact you about other pets that may be a good fit for your home. Many people are losing the opportunity to adopt the animal they want because they fail to put in an application and the pet was adopted before we could answer your email. .If you have applied for an animal in our facility and have not received a response within 7 days, PLEASE call or contact us again. Sandy Brown, Director, PAW Animal Shelter

animal.description:
Hi! My name is Nala.
Ive been at Dolly Goodpuppy for quite a while where watched so many of my good friends get adopted adopted. I hear they are all loving life with their families. I am excited for them but sometimes I get a little sad and wonder if my forever person will ever come along.

I had a rough start in life being dumped by my original owner, but I have learned that there are some pretty amazing humans out there who love and care for me and won't throw me away.

I am a very affectionate, pretty, lab mix who loves to go on long walksor runs. Whatever I can do to burn of some of this energy. Oh my gosh I have so much energy.

If I had to choose three words to describe myself, I would go with active, agile, and lovable. Isn't that a great combo?

I can easily scale a 6-foot fence, (because what dog doesnt like a bit of mischief and adventure?) so I will require a home that can keep me secure and safe. I would really enjoy an owner who can find fun ways to keep me physically and mentally engaged. 

But at the end of the day I still look forward to an evening curled up next to my owner. If you are looking for an outgoing, bright-eyed girl, then you have come to the right place.

My adoption fee includes; spay, microchip, vaccinations, and UTD heartworm/flea/tick prevention. 

Complete a foster or adoption application at dollygoodpuppy.org, come for a visit - I will take you for a walk.

animal.description:
EMAIL for INFO: huskyhavenofla@hotmail.com
---------------------------------------------------------------------------

GNERL INFO re all dogs listed:
For more info contact our email add stated just above
WE are hard to reach by phone due to our work load
We make appoint to meet AFTER receiving and completing the application process NOT before.
We do NOT adopt outside of CA, except for Reno, NV
There is helpful info on our website: huskyhavenofla.org- BUT it is outdated with some info We do not have funds to complete a new website
The adopt fee stated is VERY old: Our current adopt fee for adults is bet $245 and $285
Everything is done: all vaccines/spay o r neuter/microchip/evaluation. If vet intervention was needed, this info will be provided as well
PLUS 30 dys FREE vet insurance and access to continue vet insurance at VERY low cost
Most dogs have videos and "clicking" on the video link ( the little film icon) is helpful to learn more..

PLS DO NOT submit an application if you are NOT ready to adopt within the next 2 wks.

If any of the following LIST applies to you pls EMAIL first BEFORE applying so we can give you addl info:

If you have a sml dog weighing less than 35 lbs
If you have a cat or cats
If your current fencing is NOT min 6 foot all the way around including the gates
(Some of the dogs are ok with 5 foot but NOTHING less)
If you have an inground swimming pool NOT safely fenced off
If the location you are residing at is your parents home
If you are a renter, we REQUIRE WRITTEN landlord approval
PLS make sure you have asked if there are restrictions re the breed or size or weight for your complex.

animal.description:
Out of state adoption available. Spot needs to be in a one dog home, with preferably no small children. 

This cutie is a bit bigger than his pictures now, he came to us covered in ticks and fleas but is now happy and healthy.  He is about 3 years old and apx. 45 lbs. He is high maintenance in that he likes lots and lots of attention.  Spot is seeking an adult, indoor home with a fenced in yard.  A home visit will be need to be made by a volunteer prior to a adoption and if the adoptor is out of town it is likely that arrangements can be made with another rescue group for a curtesy home visit..   He is a wonderful dog and will make someone a very good friend! He can walk on a leash pretty well.  He is a very loving dog and has been waiting for his fur ever home, will you open your heart to him? We always take the fur babies back into our care if for any reason it does not work out.

He does really not like other dogs so we are looking for a  One dog home. Thanks!


NOTE-FOR SPOT IF YOU LIVE OUT OF STATE TRANSPORTATION TO YOUR LOCATION IS POSSIBLY AVAILABLE WITH AN APPROVED HOME STUDY/APPLICATION.  PLEASE INQUIRE IF INTERESTED IN FINDING OUT MORE.

animal.description:
Thank you for your interest in dog who needs a new home. Adoption can be one of the most fulfilling experiences in your life and especially in the life of your new canine companion.

A note to those looking at CPR. We have no perfect dogs - but many of our dogs have proven to be perfect for a certain someone. Our job is to find those someone's. Our most successful adopters come to CPR not because they want a dog. They come to us because they want to give a dog a home. We urge all of our potential adopters not to fall in love with a picture. While we like to know what you like in looks, a dog is more than a pretty face. Our goal is to match you with the best possible pet for you and your home. We want to create furever families.

Our descriptions contain all that we know about this dog today. We'll update as more information is known.

Are you looking to adopt within the next 30 days? If so please visit our webpage at www.carolinapoodlerescue.org and complete the application. You'll find it in the menu on the left hand side. You'll also find a total listing of all our dogs available.

Just browsing but interested in poodles and poodle mixes? Please drop a note to applications@carolinapoodlerescue.org with your name, address and phone # and email. We'll add you to our mailing list.

thanks
the CPR Adoption team

Smarty pantsDate into Rescue: 9/9/2017

Reason for being in rescue: One of Hurricane Irma's orphans.
Foster location: Dreamweaver Farms, Pacolet SC
Special Needs? None noted
Weight: 65 lb
Height:
Spayed/Neutered: Yes

Adoption Fee: $99

Fence needed? Yes, a high fence he can't climb. He needs room to run!

What kind of home would be best for me? I would love a home with lots of excercise and playtime, maybe a field to run in and play and at the end of the day when my family and I are all tuckered out we can go lay on a comfy bed in front of a fireplace! Dreams can come true, right?

What is my personality like? I am nothing but sweet! I'm still getting used to everything around here but considering everything I've been through (hurricane Irma and moving so much during rescue) my caregivers say I'm doing great! I like to howl at the moon when I'm outside at night like a true-to-breed hound and I love to play with people and give hugs! I love to explore, I would make a fabulous tracking dog with the right training. That is what I feel like I'm supposed to do! Sniffing and hunting things down.

I can be head strong, just like any other stubborn hound dog.. but with the right people I'm working through them. I would prefer to be the only dog since I can be dog selective but I'm not against meeting your 4 legged members to see if I will like them!

How do I act when I first meet new people? I am sweet and loving a bit shy at first but I warm up to you between snacks and rubbing behind my ears. :)

Other tips and tidbits: Estimated Birthdate: 7/18/2015. I'm really smart. I am highly treat motivated and know how to sit, hand shake, lay down and when my caregiver said play dead I even rolled over on my back belly up!

House trained? Dogs can be house trained if they are in the right environment and are allowed to follow a schedule as long as a physical reason doesn't keep them from being trained. A dog house trained in my home may not be in yours. We will help you teach your new dog this necessary skill and based on your schedule.

Please note - we do not ship dogs. If you are interested in adopting, please take a look at the distance between the foster home location and your location and make sure you are willing to make that trip. Most of our dogs are at our farm in Pacolet, South Carolina.

To apply, please visit our webpage at www.carolinapoodlerescue.org and visit the tab on the left that directions you to the online application.

Please note that when screening applications, we look at the entire home and then make suggestions based on what would be a good fit for your home. You are not being screened for a specific dog although we are looking to see what type of dog interests you - poodles or non poodles, color, age, etc. Others here may be a better fit for you. It is very difficult to get to know a living animal from a picture and a short description. Since we are constantly getting in new dogs, this may be a dog not in our listings yet. We want you to be very happy with your new companion and will make suggestions based on what you tell us about you.

Thank you for considering CPR.

animal.description:
Meet Holden! 

Estimated age: 4-5 years old
Breed: Pittie mix
House & crate trained

Are you a homebody looking for companionship? Holden might just be the guy you've been searching for. Holden enjoys a quiet and simple life without a lot of socializing with dogs/people. He's searching for a like-minded family to call his own and he is happy to share his house with a doggy sister.

Seeking:
-Home WITHOUT children
-Family who is dedicated to crating Holden when guests come over. Holden is wary when new people come into the home, so he will need to be crated when guests are over. 
-Family who will provide gentle introductions to strangers. Holden can be anxious meeting new people, and is looking for a family who will take it slow with new people.
-Home with plenty of toys and treats! Holden is quick to show off his basic obedience (sit, down) when you have a treat for him!
-Not suitable for dog parks/dog bars
-Has not been tested with cats

Favorite Things:
-Holden loves to play! Squeaky toys, tennis balls, ropes...he loves them all
-Snuggling! Holden turns into a major snuggle bug and likes to curl up with you on the couch or in the bed for a snooze
-Being with his humans. Holden enjoys the company of people and is happy to follow you around the house as you do chores. He doesn't want to miss a thing!
-Playing with other doggies! Holden loves his dog siblings and enjoys a good wrestling match
-Rides like a champ in the car

Before emailing- please read:
- Yes, this dog is available for adoption
- The adoption fee for Holden is $256
- Apply at c2cnd.org
- The adoption fee covers their age appropriate shots, microchip, deworming, spay/neuter, and any other medical expenses while in our care.
- Local adopters only. Due to our thorough adoption process including home visits, we limit our adoptions to local families in the greater Charlotte area.
- If you have any additional questions, email us at dogs@c2cnd.org and we will respond as soon as possible!

animal.description:
Hello, everyone!  My name is Boko.  I came to TIRR Rescue in 2017.  My owner could no longer keep me and wanted me to have a chance at a new life.

I like to have fun, but I also have a bit of a serious side.  I pick my dog friends very carefully, though I can get along with just about any dog.  I can sometimes get a little impatient with younger dogs, especially when they haven't learned to tell when I don't want to play.

I can entertain myself, but I do sometimes get bored easily.  I will need a family that is willing to play with me and keep me busy but will also let me chill on the couch when I want to (P.S. I do not like for my naps to be interrupted!).  If you think you might be my forever family, be sure to contact my rescue people!

~~~~

PERSONALITY:
Boko is a fun dog with a bit of a serious side.  While he likes most dog, he is selective in his dog friends.  He is not at all scared of the vacuum, sometimes forcing rescue workers to vacuum around his body.  When you want him to do something that he does not want to do, he will try to distract you by giving you his paw and smiling.  Though Boko is not always good at first impressions, he does impress once you get to know him.

~~~~

To learn more about Boko, please visit tirrrescue.org/boko.

animal.description:
SOCHI is a 6 yr old flashy/fawn boy, with natural ears and docked tail. Will turn 7 in January 2020. He has been in this rescue program since Aug 2017, when he and boxer sister witnessed the passing of his human mom and wasn't removed until days afterwards when she was found deceased. 

SOCHI is neutered, house-trained, vaccinated. He has separation anxiety in a crate but is excellent loose in a home, never has been destructive with anything here when we are sleeping or gone. This is a small boxerboy at 45 lbs. and is a lot of boxer in a small package!   We would prefer an only dog household due to his previous bouts of charging other dogs trying to challenge and was only with his sister before was adopted. He has shown he doesn't like a couple breeds so far, so would prefer to be the only dog in the home. 

SOCHI is absolutely a nut and kicks up his heels, acting like a 9 mo old pup..If you redirect him outside or give a soft toy (he loves them!) he settles down. He should be around small children because when he gets over excited he could definitely knock someone over accidentally and cause injury. But he does love people and kids and is not purposely aggressive but could be misunderstood due to his amped up flailing in play and unusual very deep voice. 

WBR requirements: Fenced yard  

If you are interested in adopting this silly boy, please write  rescue4boxerdogs@yahoo.com  for an application.

SOCHI took over a year to recover from the loss of his mom, but is ready and waiting for someone that will finally give him the unconditional love he deserves.

animal.description: Elektra is a booty-wiggler and a tail-thumper who loves, loves, loves the love. She trembles with excitement, barely able to contain herself when she thinks you might want to pet the belly. It's all she can do to keep herself from jumping up and smooching you right on the mouth, Beloved Human! Elektra spent her early life outside on a thick chain with humans we suspect have no clue about the love of a good dog. Since we rescued her, she's been making up for lost time, loving on everyone she meets. Elektra does need a little extra help in the manners department, but no one will love you quite like this pretty, happy girl.

animal.description:
Hey Everyone how's it going?  Yeh it's me Barry here just cozying in for a winter's nap here with my sporty toque as I patiently wait for my furever family.  You may have noticed I have been hangin' out here for awhile and I would soooo love to find a special family of my own who understands we big luggy guys so let's get properly introduced.
I am an approximately 8 year old American Bulldog.  I am a friendly, mature, mannerly and mellow fellow seeking the same in a quiet home where I can laze away the day with my favorite things - lots of love, attention, an occasional stroll, a tour in the car, a heart to heart gab and a welcoming lap to lay my head on for plenty of ear scratches.
In the custom of we Americans as you can see I am a handsome, sturdy yet athletic fellow having recently completed an extensive fitness program.  I am loyal and determined at times and look to the same in my family with calm, consistent,  and patient leadership.  My foster pawrent has worked exceedingly hard with all that uuhh hummm former life luggage stuff to bring me where I am today - a well rounded, reliable and wonderful companion.
I must admit though that I am a bit discerning on a few arrangements.  I would do best in a home without small children and I may be somewhat discriminating on the canine companions so ideally I am probably best as a single roomy in that respect.
Alrighty a few of those more practical details:- My adoption fee is $350.   I have been neutered, fully vaccinated, heart worm & tick diseases tested negative & preventatives given.  If you feel you may be the family to welcome me into your heart and home as your new furever friend PLEASE complete the application found at this link  https://form.jotform.com/72823870527260 or email us directly at bbbcrescue@gmail.com  with full contact information to open discussions and learn more about our adoption process.  A volunteer will be happy to help you and we just request your patience as we are volunteers doing our best to handle all the day to day needs of our dogs, our busy rescue and our families.  
PLEASE note that we adopt only within the province of Ontario and preference will be given to potential adopters within our local areas provided they qualify and are the best fit for our dog.
Thanks everyone!

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Joy came to us from Texas and we all know that everything is bigger in Texas and and so is her personality.
- Joy is a happy but exciteable dog.- She is super sweet and loves to cuddle (all the time if you let her).- Joy gets along well with people but due to her energy level must be in a home with children 6 and up - She is house and crate trained.- Joy does not do well in the car. She gets very excited on car rides as other cars go by (she is trying to chase them).
- Joy loves going on walks and knows her basic commands. - Joy can get along with other dogs but will push herself onto other dogs with dominant gestures which can cause problems if uncontrolled. Unless you are an experienced bully owner we therefore recommend that she is the only dog in the family. No dog parks, no cats, no small dogs, no children younger than 6 years.
Joy has a lot of energy and her three legs do not slow her down. There are no restrictions on what home she should be in. You will need to be able to provide daily exercise for her to keep her energy under control. She can go up and down steps without problems. Joy is all muscle and will jump in the car all by herself. You will be amazed!We would love to see Joy go into a home with a fenced in yard (4' minimum height). She loves laying outside in the sun during the day.Joy is in good health otherwise.

animal.description:
This trio is a family unit.  Sterling, the Dad, protected his babies after they were dumped in the country.  He watched over them so well that everyone trying to catch them thought he was their Mama.  Both puppies were very young, and they ran hard to keep up with Sterling as he moved looking for food.  He shared his food with them and kept them warm and safe at night.  They were roaming loose in a certain area for about a week when someone contacted us, afraid they would be hurt or worse.  Someone was able to get the puppies, and we went after them right away.  The next morning, the police department called to let us know that "Mom" was howling and frantically looking for her puppies.  We loaded the puppies up, and drove to where "she" was exhausted after a morning of searching and was resting.  We took the puppies out of the car with leashes, and sat down.  This frightened dog covered the ground between us quickly when the puppies were spotted.  Imagine our surprise when we learned she, was a he.  

These three need to find a home together.  I believe the puppies would be okay separated, but I don't believe Sterling would be.  He loves them, and they love him.  We have made a commitment to do everything in our power to find a home where they can stay together.  The pups are around 2 years old old and Sterling is an adult, probably around four years old. They are never very far away from each other, and we see them like this photo all the time.  (The pup laying down in the front has been adopted). They sleep together, eat together, and need each other.

The adoption fee for this trio is $300, which is $150 less than our normal fee..  They are all spayed/neutered, vaccinated and healthy sweet babies.  Skylar, the mostly white one, is a girl.  Dusty and Sterling are boys.  Please contact Lori at 405-620-2411 if you think you can offer this little family their forever, together.

NOTE:  The puppy closest to the camera has been adopted.  The trio are the three next to each other.
animal.name: Sterling, Dusty & Skylar

animal.description:
Slick is a very big young boy!  He loves to play and talk!  He needs some more manners for his size/age.  He loves to run and play.  Experienced adopter required.  Please DO NOT send an email to us from the PetFinder CONTACT button. It will delay any correspondence getting to us. Email TenderHeartRescue2@gmail.com for adoption information and our adoption schedule. Email is the best form of communication for us and will receive a quicker response than phone calls. 
Our volunteers work full time jobs in addition to rescue, so please be patient.  Thank you!

Our pre-adoption application can be found on our website at www.tenderheartrescue.webs.com on the main page and can be submitted online or  returned via email.  

We do require that you have a pet/vet history which means you must have owned a dog (past and/or current) and your pets must be current on vetting which includes spay/neuter, vaccines and heart worm test/prevention.

Rescue related phone calls will NOT be returned until after 7pm. If you do call, please ensure that you are calling from the number you wish to be contacted at and that your number is not blocked.

We typically do not do OUT OF STATE adoptions, especially pups since all vetting is done locally. 

Our dogs are spayed/neutered, have been given age appropriate vaccines and are microchipped.

Come meet our adoptable pets at PetSmart in Newnan, GA

Store Location: (They do not have specific information on our adoptable pets)
Newnan Store #278
1072 Bullsboro Dr
Newnan, GA 30265

animal.description:
IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN ADOPTING HOOCH, PLEASE GO TO THE MAKE A DIFFERENCE RESCUE FACEBOOK PAGE AND SEND A PRIVATE MESSAGE THAT INCLUDES YOUR PHONE NUMBER AND EMAIL ADDRESS.

Hooch is a dapper 5.5 year old Pit Bull Terrier. Hooch was rescued by a Good Samaritan who asked Make A Difference Rescue to accept him in the rescue. Of course we said yes and Hooch is a very happy boy!! He is very affectionate and loves being with people. He is very eager to please and is treat motivated. Hooch loves peanut butter filled bones. He is dog social, but unfortunately we do not know how Hooch is with cats. Children 12 years old and older. Hooch's forever home is required to have a fenced yard where he can safely run and play. He is neutered, up to date on his vaccinations, on heart worm preventative as well as house and crate trained. Hooch is very excited to meet his forever family . . . is it with you??


All dogs we rescue stay with us until they find their forever homes. We do not do same day adoptions. A home visit is required to ensure our dog is going to a safe environment and our dog gets along with your dog(s) and/or cat(s). We require all our dogs over the age of 1 year attend 1 obedience class (6 week session) outside the home. You must live within 1 hour of Birmingham, MI to adopt one of our dogs. No out of state or outside the U.S. adoptions or fosters. Hooch's adoption fee is $275.

animal.description: This happy little boy is the poster-child for Annie's Orphans' dedication to the foundations that LIFE MATTERS and EVERYONE DESERVES A FAIR CHANCE. This young Carolina Dog mix and his brother were transferred to us as puppies, a mere two-hours before their brief lives were scheduled to come to an end. Little is known about their back-story, but they were picked up as strays with evidence of physical trauma -- presumably from abuse. The outcome of that, for Murdock, was what appears to be trauma-related brain-injury, with resulting developmental delays and visual "miswiring."  Steadily, with the passing of time, we’ve seen him evolving, with clear signs of incremental improvement [ex: increased visual tracking ability and less time "watching airplanes" that don’t exist (not to us, at least!)].  As Murdock has matured, he has developed food-guarding behaviors; so he won’t be adopted to a home with children.  Despite his life-challenges and tough breaks (including treatment for ehrlichiosis), Murdock is one of the most innocent and cheerful beings on earth, with unwavering optimism — which says much about him! We hold hopes that just the right person will show for him; he is best suited for a companion with plenty of patience, dedication to the process, time and love to give…someone who can both accommodate his differences and support his potential.

animal.description:
Roxxy is likely a Jack Russell Terrier Mix. She was born about July 2006. She weighs 12 lbs.
If you are you looking for a running partner or a dog with which to do lure coursing or earth dog competitions, Roxxy may be the dog for you! She needs lots and lots of exercise. Then more exercise and lots and lots of training and guidance (to which she is quite responsive).
Roxxy is very independent with (did I mention this already?) an extremely high activity level. She lacks K9 to K9 social skills. She’s scrappy, yappy and rude. She only manages to stay out of trouble with the most easy going, best socialized or biggest dogs. Dog parks will not be on the radar screen for her anytime in the near or far future. Harnessing her boundless enthusiasm and high play drive into something more then reactive energy will be both the challenge and the reward.
While very dog savvy cats appear to be able to manage her behavior towards them, a kitty-free home would be best.
Roxxy is crate trained.
Training contract required.

Note: Roxxy will not be shown at all pet fairs. Please let us know if you are interested in meeting her so we are sure to bring her on that date.

animal.description:
If you are interested in adopting, please complete an application at bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt.

Gabe is a 8-9 year old lab/boxer mix. He is neutered, up to date on his vaccines, and chipped. He is a happy, healthy boy! 

He is house, crate, and potty trained. Walks well on leash. 

He is very affectionate, sweet, eager to please, smart, and just wants to be loved. He has a medium energy level indoors, and a typical goof/sweet disposition. 

He does well with other female dogs, but can be selective with other males. A slow introduction on leash is recommended with other males. He has been in doggie day care with 30 other dogs, male and female, many breeds and done great. 

He loves people, and would do well with children. 

Gabe would do well in an active home, where he can go on plenty of walks/hikes, maybe even jogging, and have lots of play time with his people. Inside he is pretty much a snuggler and couch potato.  He would do best with kids, other female dogs, or even as an only pet. 

Our adoption fee include alteration, current vaccinations, heartworm testing, microchipping and transport expenses. 

Adoption fee is $200 to help offset travel and medical expenses. 

Applications can be made at bigdogrescueproject.org/adopt

Sweet Dora is a 5.5 year old Terrier and Lab mix. She is very affectionate, loves to go for walks and just hang out with people. Dora dreams of becoming a soccer buddy or fetching a ball with her forever family!!


All dogs we rescue stay with us until they find their forever homes. We do not do same day adoptions. A home visit is required to ensure our dog is going to a safe environment and our dog gets along with your dog(s) and/or cat(s). We require all our dogs over the age of 1 year attend 1 obedience class (6 week session) outside the home. You must live within 1 hour of Birmingham, MI to adopt one of our dogs.  Dora's adoption fee is $275.

animal.description:
One of the first things people ask about Bentley is “What kind of dog is that?” given his unusual looks, followed by “What a dog!” given his incredibly bubbly personality. Such a unique dog must have an equally unique story and Bentley is no exception! Bentley’s story starts with him landing in a municipal shelter where this active and friendly dog had no outlet for his energy. He was then transferred to our partner organization, Save Our Strays, that saw the potential and drive in Bentley and started working towards getting him into a board and train facility that would benefit him. That’s where Adopt-A-Dog and Ernesto at DOGS 360 came in; to train and work with Bentley until we could find him a home. This program had Bentley working with both Ernesto and other dogs daily to help work on his manners and also provide much-needed socialization. The greatest boon is that this program was in a home environment, so Bentley got a foster experience while also becoming the dog we knew he could be.

Due to his stay at DOGS 360, Bentley has made great strides in his socialization skills as well as his manners. We learned that Bentley is a tug master who has plenty of canine friends. He is the ideal companion for a family that likes to be outdoors (he LOVES going for bike runs) and would be by your side on a hike. Bentley’s ideal future family would learn all the training he has learned and continue to give Bentley the structure and consistency he needs to flourish. For that reason, we would love to see Bentley in a home with older kids that could learn his training alongside him. He is a friendly and goofy dog that is waiting to become your next family member, so why not come and meet him today? You can’t say no to a face like that!



Contact the Adoptions team at (914) 273-1674 or adoptions@adoptadog,org for more information!

The first step to adopting one of our dogs is to fill out our online adoptions questionnaire located here: https://forms.gle/5heEH8S6c7zXBneD7

animal.description:
When people talk about dogs.. wishing they could be more like a dog.. Poe is what we refer to.. he's had some rotten luck in life.. but he is such a happy, fully present, utterly content wounded wanderer! Po sustained an injury and now his hind legs move as one limb with two paws!  ITS AMAZING actually how well he moves along.. PLUS.. he's got an incredible attitude! Happy.. Poe is a happy happy sweet humble boy who's only got space for happy!

Poe thoroughly enjoys group plays with other get-along kinda dogs.. a challenging male dog will prove to be a bit threatening to Poe so we make sure to pair him up with wiggly, easy going, confident doggies. Pippy, Penny, Madeline, Leo to name a few of his buddies! As stated above, despite his previous injury, Poe sure does well sprinting around the yard with his buds. Once in a while, he might trip but he always gets right back up and continues play. Now.. Poe's most FAV game ever is FETCH.. he will chase a ball all day long! He even knows how to drop the ball on command (often in trade for a treat!!) so we can give it another throw. He'll often break away from the pack to join up in a nice ball game.  

Guaranteed you'll never meet another dog like Poe in your life. We're not quite sure how Poe became the way that he is but we are sure he doesn't skip a beat! Did we mention he loves to SWIM?! Check out the photos of Poe's doggy paddle skills! A long hike to the reservoir is another fav activity for Poe! 

***While we are very grateful for PetFinder, we have been having chronic problems receiving inquires. Please contact us directly if you are interested in adopting by emailing us at lovedogs.bedfordny@gmail.com and visit fortheloveofdogsrescue.org***

animal.description: **I HAVE SOME SPECIAL NEEDS*** Trust me, it's nothing that can't keep me from loving and playing and snuggling but I want you to know...I was the victim of a shooting and have a piece of the shrapnel sitting on my spine. I am ready to play so of course I like toys, treats, playing with my foster doggies, and especially people. I am the kind of dog who is very flexible, and by flexible I don't mean I can do splits (boy would that be hard) I mean I would be fine chilling at home or cruising town on a leash. Please say YES!! I am up to date on my vaccines, crate trained, and good on a leash......

animal.description:
Montana is a stunning 6yr young female AmStaff.  65lbs.  Montana is great at basic commands like "sit", "down", "roll over", "paw" and "stand up".  She is house broken and crate trained. She can be energetic but also loves her cuddle time..  Montana would LOVE an active family that can hike, do agility, etc.   She would do best in a home with a fenced yard or in an area that is not very congested as it takes her time to warm up to new people--she is shy at first so a crowded apartment building with no private yard would be stressful for her.   Montana does enjoy her walls and is loose leash (positive reinforcement) trained. 
Montana was found as a stray (as a puppy) with her brother Chevy.  They were taken to the town shelter where they were pulled by fur babies after their hold period.  Montana was adopted by a family hoping her presence would keep their son from moving out.  Montana and the son formed an amazing bond--he was the only one who played with her, trained her, walked her, etc.  Because of a job opportunity he had to leave and sadly no one else in the home paid much mind to poor Montana.  She was returned to us at about 2 yrs old.  A very scared and unsure pup who really didn't know much about the world. For lack of foster homes Montana went into boarding.  Then FBRR raised funds to have her stay with a trainer instead of just boarding, figuring that getting some exercise and reinforcement of her commands would help to find her forever home more quickly.   Sadly the trainer got in over her head and collected over 100 dogs.  None of which got the training they needed or reinforcement or even exercise.   Poor Montana was stuck in a tiny crate 24/7.  When FBRR was made aware of the situation we went and got her.  For everything Montana has been through she still has an AMAZING spirit!  She enjoys nothing more than to be with her people.  She greets neighbors she knows on walks and loves to go on "sniff-faris" searching out squirrels!  This girl can jump and climb--she is very agile and would likely LOVE some agility classes!  She is doing well playing with large male dogs that enjoy playing and are submissive.  Montana walks nicely past other dogs on her walks with no reaction.  She sits and waits nicely for her leash to be put on and she has great manners on walks and jogs!  She needs some reminders when squirrels are involved!  No small animals for her! Montana also gives the sweetest gentle kisses, hugs and nudges! Montana has no experience with children and they make her nervous so a home without children is a must.  

Please give this AMAZING girl a chance!!  She has soooooo much love to give!!  FBRR needs a foster home or forever home for her ASAP.  We can provide a trainer to work with her new family as she adjusts and settles in (we can also provide supplies if needed--crate bowls food etc) 
 For more info please contact Kris at kobemnstr@hotmail.com

animal.description:
Jack is a  three year old neutered mix male. He is super sweet, house broken, walks well on a leash and knows some commands.  He is neutered, utd on shots, heartworm negative.  Jack has met the neighborhood children and does well with them however we think he would do well with older children just because he is a bigger boy at 55 pounds and likes to play so we wouldn't want a tiny tot to be knocked down and hurt by mistake.  Jack's owner was a rescuer but sadly he passed away so Jack and Jill were taken into a boarding facility so they would not be taken to a high kill shelter.  Jack and Jill  love each other but if it helps them find a home, Hamburg Mutts will adopt them out separately.  Jack is down in boarding in TN but he can come to Buffalo if we can find him a foster or adopter.  If you are interested in fostering or adopting Jack, please go to hamburgmutts.org click on "adoptable dogs" and you will see our application there.  


*************************************************************************
Due to our adoption approval process and vetting policies, we are unable to adopt outside of the WNY area (within a 60 minute drive of the city of Buffalo – US only)

For the benefit of all involved, and to ensure the best match is made for our rescue dogs and your home-life, an application, home visit, vet reference check and adoption fee are required.   Once approved, a meet will be set up with the dog.  A meet is also required with any dog/cat currently in the home and the rescue dog.   All dogs currently in the home must be utd on vaccines and spayed/neutered.  Our adoptions are not “first come – first serve.”  Our decisions are based on the best situation for each individual dog.

animal.description:
Frankie came into FFR on 6/8/11 for our help to find her a new adoption home. Frankie is a very special dog. She comes from an abusive past and has flourished despite her past treatment. She is very curious yet cautious of new experiences. She does have high prey drive to other dogs and needs to be on leash at all times for control outside of her home. She has learned to play with toys and sleep in her crate. She is very smart and tries to avoid when she knows it's time to do something she doesn't want to do so we are working on her obedience manners. Frankie hasn't had a lot of attention in her short life so she is very reluctant to let you stop petting her. With supervision she ignored the foster home's cat & fine with same size male dog. Frankie needs a very experienced pack leader guardian to train her. Adult home. No kids.
Update: Frankie is doing great at her trainer/boarding home. She went out for a social walk at a park and streets and she was great meeting new people. She ignored other barking dogs but did bark at dogs at a store. She needs a forever very experienced home. Best as the only dog to continue her training. We are paying for her boarding with a trainer/boarding home.
9/30/20 update: Finally Frankie is in an experienced foster home for her golden years. Doing great. 2/1/21 1:12 PM

animal.description:
Ivy is a 6-7 yo pit mix who only weighs 40lbs. She's a very sweet, timid, and docile girl who is a poet at heart and needs the countryside quiet to keep her soul at peace and comfort. The busy city life can scare and overwhelm her. She does well with big and little dogs (proper intros, of course!) and has paid no mind to kitty cats. She requires a home with another dog. She will snuggle up to mellow dogs that just want to hang out. For someone with a patient heart and lots of love to give, Ivy more than repays that kindness once she feels safe and accepted. She's crate trained and housebroken.

This girl is available for adoption through The Perfect Dog rescue - which makes sense, because though quite the introvert, this little navy bean is, indeed, the perfect dog 

Please contact Diana at (510) 333-4420 or theperfectdogrescue@gmail.com or fill out the adoption application:
http://www.theperfectdog.org/TPDadoptapp.doc

animal.description:
Meet Georgia~

Look into those soulful eyes and you can see the concern she had when her last day at the shelter rolled around. A volunteer stepped up to foster and we sprung her bail just in time! While those eyes are still soulful, the smile now lights up her face. What breed is Georgia? Your guess is as good as ours - Shepherd/Collie/Greyhound mix? Whatever it may be, it's a whole lot of happiness!

Georgia is between 1-2 years old and weighs 60lbs. She'll be making her way to her foster home in MD the 2nd week of September. We're just getting to know this cutie and will update more soon.

Anyone applying to adopt Gerogia must be willing to travel to MD to meet her, once the application is approved. 

~~The Last Resort is a foster based rescue. Our dogs are in our foster homes all up and down the east coast. We do not have a facility in which you can visit. We find this a huge benefit because we learn our dogs and are able to educate our adopters on what it’s like to have them live in your home. Part of our process, once pre-approved, is to speak with the foster for the dog you’re interested in. If you’re still interested in adopting from our rescue the first step is to complete our adoption application online at www.thelastresortrescue.com/adoptionapplication.htm

animal.description: Everyone meet Captain Crunch! Captain Crunch is an 8 year old male Chihuahua that was an owner surrender AFTER finding himself in two other high kill shelters (SEAACA & San Bernardino City Animal Shelters). One of our board members saw his post and decided that we needed to rescue this precious boy. Once we got him, it was VERY obvious that something was wrong, very wrong. His front legs seem to collapse and if he tries to walk on any uneven ground, he falls face first. Our vets have determined that he has congenital leg deformities with his front legs. His joints, ligaments and tendons prevent his legs from staying in socket. Sadly, there is no surgery or treatment that can fix him but we do have him on medication to help keep the inflammation down and make him comfortable. If this was not enough for the poor boy, his teeth were a horrible mess and we did get him the dental he so desperately needed. He is also getting bi-weekly Accuscope treatments to help strengthen his ligaments. We are now looking into a harness that will help his front limbs tremendously. The good news is that Captain Crunch is always smiling, is happy as can be and has the best personality. He has been neutered, had an extreme dental, is up to date on his vaccinations and is also microchipped. If interested in adopting Captain Crunch, please go to www.lolr.org and fill out an adoption application. Captain Crunch's adoption fee is sponsored, however, all of our other standard protocols for adoption will be in place.

animal.description:
What did you do last year? Well, I got surrendered to a shelter, taken into foster care, treated for heartworms, went through board and train, overcame my fears, had ACL surgery on both back legs, worked my way through several levels of obedience training, took tons of car rides, went to about 300 photo shoots...and realized that chicken nuggets ROCK.

But what I didn't do in the last year...was get adopted. What gives?!?! What's a smart, sassy and adorable pittie-bulldog mix gotta do to get adopted?

Darla is 3yrs old and a bulldog-staffordshire terrier mix weighing a short 40lbs. Darla has a year of family experience while in foster care and she's ready to take her skills as an excellent road trip buddy, chaser of squirrels and connoisseur of chicken nuggets to a FOREVER family! While in foster care Darla underwent 2 ACL surgeries and lots of training classes to make her the best furry family member she can be. She loves squeaky toys, running errands at Lowe's and lazy Sundays on the couch. Darla would love to be your leading lady with no other pets or small kids in the home. Please share Darla so she can ride off into the sunset with her forever human!

IMPORTANT: This animal is NOT at Irving Animal Shelter. This dog has been rescued by PAWS for Irving Animals and is currently in foster care. To set up an appointment for us to bring the dog to meet you, please follow the instructions below.

Dogs in our foster care program are:

spayed/neutered
microchipped
up to date on all vaccinations
negative for heartworms and on regular heartworm preventative OR recently treated for heartworms and on regular heartworm preventative (It can take up to 6 months for a dog to test negative for heartworm after treatments. We will provide you all the medical documentation regarding the pet's treatment.)
in loving foster care homes where they have received training and socialization to help them fit into your home more quickly.

There are a few steps to set up the adoption.

Complete the
Adoption Application
online. The online application is a web-based form that should be accessible on Mac, PC, tablet or other mobile device. If you'd like us to send you a PDF via email, we can do that too! If you are meeting us at an event, you can complete the application at the event itself. We require the application in advance so we can get to know a little more about you, and for better safety of our fosters and the dogs.
Schedule a home visit. After the adoption application is received, a volunteer from PAWS for Irving Animals work with you to find the best time to meet the pet. Depending on your schedule and the schedule of the pet's foster parents, this might be at a scheduled adoption event (Adoption Events), an area park, or your home. If that initial visit goes well, a volunteer will visit your home with the pet you are interested in adopting. We will ensure that the pet you are interested in has the opportunity to meet all the members of your immediate family, including other pets, to ensure that this adoption is a good fit. We can even do a trial adoption for a period of up to 3 days if you would like. (Note: If you choose to do a trial adoption, we will hold a check for the full price of the adoption fee until you make your final decision. If you choose not to adopt, we will return the check to you when we pick up the dog.)
Pay the adoption fee. The adoption fee is $200 for dogs under 12 months and $150 for dogs over 12 months of age. The adoption fee covers many elements: full vetting (spay, vaccinations, etc), registration of microchip to you, etc. You have 3 options for payment:

Via check. This can be either given to foster/volunteer at adoption hand-off or mailed as a check made out to "PAWS for Irving Animals" with "Adoption - DOG NAME" in the memo line. The check can be given to PAWS representative at time of adoption.
Online at

https://pawsforirvinganimalsllc.cloverdonations.com/adoption/
. Be sure to select the correct amount - $200 for dogs under 12 months and $150 for dogs over 12 months.

You can pay via PayPal as a "Friends & Family" transfer to PAWSforIrvingAnimalsLLC@Gmail.com

animal.description:
All this clever, affectionate, and eccentric pooch is looking for a home to call his own!

Gus came to the shelter when his owner abandoned him, and nobody really knows why. Was it his Resting Grouch Face (RGF)? His allergy to exercise? His firm abhorrence of tortilla chips or his obsession with french fries?

We’ve come to the conclusion that Gus was unwanted because of his distinct un-dogginess. He flat out circumvents the norms of doggie society. Not to say that he doesn’t do some dog things – he likes Kongs, is crate-trained, and knows so many tricks, including Sit, Down, Stay, Spin, Touch, and Gimme a Kiss! He’s just got some preferences that are a bit different.

Dogs usually enjoy: lots of physical activity, walks, trips to the dog park, etc.
Gus enjoys: A consistent schedule, which includes cuddle time, nap time, feeding time, and visits to the backyard to (very briefly) chase a toy or two.

Dogs usually like: fresh air.
Gus likes: air conditioning.

Dogs usually want: to chase cats.
Gus wants: to give cats the right of way.

Dogs usually prefer: to have plenty of canine and human friends.
Gus prefers: alone time with you (and our cats?).

Dogs usually need: Heaps of expensive toys.
Gus needs: A comfy couch and a backyard.

Dogs usually accompany you: on field trips.
Gus would accompany you: on a Netflix date.

Gus might be closer to a housecat than a housedog; he’s certainly not what most folks expect. What we know for sure is that Gus is a great companion for an easy-going person with lots of love to give.

animal.description:
Kabuki is joyful and spunky and will be a loyal and loving family member; always there by your side, through good times and bad. This girl loves to smile!

Lovable Kabuki’s story is sad and all too familiar ... she used to have a home and a human she loved. Although Kabuki had been a member of the man’s family for over 3 years, he met a new girl and when her dogs were not getting along with Kabuki. He was handed an ultimatum and he chose the girlfriend and her dogs over Kabuki. 

We are on a mission to find Kabuki a home that will be there through thick and thin, provide her lots of love and devoted to being her family when she reaches her senior years; a home she has never known and always deserved. Check out Kabuki the TV star at http://m.fox19.com/clip/14290836/save-the-animals-foundation 

Kabuki is most likely a greyhound or whippet mix …we’re never sure. Kabuki loves to take long walks and is fabulous on leash while walking at a steady pace; she doesn’t pull or lollygag she just is happy to *be* when she is walking :). Honestly she is over the moon happy with the time she spends walking with the volunteers taking in all the smells and the sights. Kabuki is very playful and loves to play with her toys and chase tennis balls. We know Kabuki would love a big fenced yard:)

Kabuki is great with children and is used to being around kids 5 years or older. Although Kabuki has done well with smaller, calmer dogs; after being attacked and hurt by dogs from her last home she does have fear of other dogs and will be happiest being the only dog-child.  

Kabuki will need a home that will respect her wishes to be the only dog and that home will be rewarded with a loyal, joyful and loving family member through good times and bad.  This girl will make you smile!

Kabuki needs: A home that understands that Kabuki wants to be the only dog, she won’t want to go to dog parks or doggie day care, but she will walk and run by your side like no other dog you’ve known.  She will also need a somewhat active home with a fenced yard to play in. 
Kabuki would love: Positive based training to bond and build confidence

Kabuki’s estimated birth date is December 2012. 

Visit our website www.staf.org for information on our adoption process.

* All of our animals are spayed/neutered and current on shots.
* We do not do same-day adoptions; we ask that you return for a follow-up visit before taking an animal home.
* You must be 21 years or older to adopt a dog from STAF
* We require a physical fence for homes with children under the age of 11. We also may require a physical fence for specific dogs on a case-by-case basis, depending on each dog's behavior and exercise needs.
* Invisible fences - Due in part to increasing coyote activity/incidents in the area and the difficulty of predicting how a dog will respond to invisible fence training, we cannot adopt to homes with invisible fences.
* We do request vet and personal references.
* We are able to consider applicants within 75 miles of Cincinnati.

animal.description:
Available in the Midwest and New England regions - Meet SALLY!

Hi, my name is Sally and the name Sally means Princess. I am looking for an adopter where I am the Princess of the home.  

Sally is a big goober who loves her toys, loves people, loves playtime and loves most dogs. She even loves to play with the water hose! On her dislike list are cats and some dogs. Sally needs to be the dominant dog and because of this, would do best in a home with no dogs or a submissive dog and older children.  

Now on to all the great qualities about Sally and the list is long. Let’s start with she is beautiful. Sally is very much a typical young lab. We believe Sally is 3 years old. Sally loves people and wants to meet all your 2 legged friends. She has a lot of lab energy and would definitely benefit from obedience training. Sally loves her food, what lab doesn’t, so treat training should go really well. Sally already knows how to sit. She loves being outside and would enjoy taking long walks, runs or hikes with her adopter. Sally loves all those squeaking toys. The more toys the better.  Sally needs an active family who will include her in their life. Couch potatoes need not apply.

Are you looking for an active dog to match your active life style? Look no further than Sally.  

Sally is current on vaccinations and kept on monthly preventives. She will be microchipped before adoption. Sally keeps her crate clean, but continued housetraining will be needed.  


If you are interested in adopting, please go to www.luckylabrescue.com and complete and adoption application.

animal.description:
Contact Us: www.petfinder.com/shelters/tlcr.html#contact

Full sponsorship is $130, partial sponsorships welcome! Use the blue button to sponsor via PayPal (button won't show on Petfinder, so PayPal to teresaslegacy.sue@gmail.com ). Checks can be mailed to TLC Rescue, PO Box 112, Clearfield, KY 40313. Please put "Sponsoring" & the animal's name on the memo line of the check.
At this time we do consider Jack a sanctuary dog. Jack does not do well with new people. Jack does not walk well on a lead. He has pulled me down to the ground on a lead. Jack can only be adopted to someone that can meet special conditions. Jack must have a secure fenced yard. He will not climb a fence but if he ever got away, he would not be easy to catch. For travel in a car to the vet, he must be crated. Jack can only have a grain free diet. His skin is still a problem but if he gets any grains, his hair falls out.

Jack will need for his possible adoptive home to be an adult only home. It was recently discovered that he is very nervous around children & will hide and poop when they are present. He will also need a home with a securely fenced yard.

Initial bio when Jack was first brought in: Jack is very low key. He is good with all dogs and good with cats. He is quiet. He lets my kitty knead in his belly all the time and it is not uncommon to see them sleeping together. He is squeezable. He is sweet. He loves to play with me and walk with me and stand on his rock outside. He is great about getting baths. He wipes his feet after he goes potty. He sleeps all night in his crate. Jack loves to collect all of his toys and store them in his dog bed. Too cute! He is housebroken and never marks. He came to us from an abusive/neglectful situation over a year ago, almost completely bald from demodex mange. Most of his hair has grown back in now except for a few spots that are so heavily scarred that it's unlikely the hair will ever regrow there. He seems to have lived a pretty traumatic life before coming to rescue, so he will need a very patient and special adopter. He is still afraid of men. We can only guess at what this sweet dog endured before we got him. He weighs about 55 lb now. His mom was a purebred beagle. Estimated date of birth 4/1/12.
TLC Rescue is proud to be part of For All Paws Sake. Come join us!

Foster homes needed in the Rowan/Bath County KY areas.
Dog Fostering Application
http://form.jotform.us/form/41593303849157

We are rescue friendly and can work with rescues in northeastern states. We transport on a regular basis and thoroughly screen rescues before sending dogs to them. Reputable rescues, please visit our home page for a rescue application.

TLC Rescue website: http://tlcr.petfinder.com

We can also work with adopters in northeastern states. Please contact us to inquire.

Sponsors welcome and appreciated! Full sponsorship is $130. Partial sponsorships welcome. Sponsors can donate via PayPal by clicking the button below or mail a check to: TLC Rescue, PO Box 112, Clearfield, KY 40313. TLC Rescue is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization. Donations are deductible to the extent allowed by law.

Who wants fun, energetic, and adorable?! Then you want Fiona! She is interested in meeting and playing with dogs, but comes off as a tomboy and can get a little overzealous. She is crate trained, house broken, vaccinated, spayed, and knows basic commands. Fiona is strong and athletic, so an experienced, firm handler who will continue to work and train her would help to make her the best she can be. In return, they will have the most sweet, loving, happy, wiggly butt girl out there! Although she does well with some of the dogs in the house she would be best as the only dog and no cats. 

She is the perfect mix. She loves to run and play, and is also the first to snuggle up in your lap for cuddles and belly rubs! If you need some alone time, Fiona is happy with a favorite toy and a peanut butter stuffed bone makes her one happy girl, as well. Her adoption fee is $325 and applications can be found on FOWA's website if you want to make Fiona a part of your life!

Love Fiona, but just can't adopt another dog? Feel free to make her happy in her foster home by purchasing something off her wish list. She will be forever grateful for the extra treats and toys! https://www.amazon.com/hz/wishlist/ls/3OVA1CAVLK48P?ref_=wl_share

animal.description: Piper is a female 6 y/o coonhound mix who came to us in 2017 from a nearby community where residents had been feeding her for several months but were unable to approach her. When residents realized she was pregnant, they arranged for her to be tranquilized and brought to our shelter. After 2 to 3 weeks she gave birth to 3 beautiful puppies, each of which have since found good homes. Piper has become more trusting of humans during her stay at our shelter but will need a quiet stable home environment where she will be able to continue her progress. A home within the City of Aurora would be ideal as she has become familiar with the area on her walks and would be more likely to stay in the area if she accidentally got away from her new home/owner.  Piper loves the outdoors and enjoys the company of other dogs. She does not have vision in her left eye but did have lid surgery on that that eye to relieve irritation from an inturned lid. (Stitches had not been removed at the time of the photo)
