animal.description:
Name:  Bishop
Age: 9-10 years old
Disability: Deaf
Breed/Weight:  Lemon Hound, 60 pounds

Bishop Update July 2020 - Bishop is a sweet, quirky ,independent and stubborn guy and is a work in progress. He is not a couch potato, is quite active and loves to be able to see and be outside. He loves sleeping in the sun and watching the world go by from the security of my second story front deck. Inside, if anything is blocking his view he will remove it such as shades, blinds and curtains. His nose drives his brain, if he catches a scent, specially a rabbit he goes bonkers and should the rabbit run under the fence, he is lightening fast and will try his hardest to wiggle under after the bunny. As he is deaf he can’t hear if he is called so he will not respond to a recall and will be long gone in a heartbeat. To keep him safe, he is always leashed when we go outside. He loves his long walks everyday however he is a strong guy and at times can pull very hard on his leash so needs a strong handler. Would love to take him on car rides and trips but he gets very car sick even with anti nausea meds.

Bishop has a fairly active bladder which means multiple trips outside at dawn, during the day and evening hours are a must. He lets you know he needs to go outside by tipping things over, plants, small tables, fans etc., if it is on the floor, nothing is off limits , even the in floor air registers, he pulls them out of the floor. He repeats this quirky behavior when he decides it is his meal time. He can not be crated, if closed in a room, will destroy the door to get out and still can not go all day without an accident

He has learned hand signals and knows sit, wait and down. He loves people and long walks but is extremely picky about other dogs and can quite bossy I am told. I do not have a cat but understand he was fine with them? While he is normally fairly quiet, he has his moments of loud barking, not great if you have close neighbors


Bishop Update October 22, 2019:

Bishop continues to amaze me. He is a love, full of energy who lives to explore new sights and smells...especially the smells as his nose works overtime. He would be a great walking or hiking companion provided he was always on a leash. He is always thrilled greet anyone he meets along the way with a tail that doesn’t stop wagging. 

 We had to abandon the vibrating collar as it really frightened him even set on the lowest setting and are now exploring others ways of communicating. As long as treats are part of this process Bishop is always happy to try

 His Aunt Jane gave him two doggy puzzles and he ?? ? ? the challenge ( and of course all the treats he uncovers)



UPDATE OCTOBER 2019:

Bishop has been amazing in short time he has been here. Has he been a perfect angel, no, but in just two weeks he has learned the signs for come, sit, wait and down.  He sits and waits to go out and to come inside and he sits and waits for his breakfast and dinner. His leash manners vastly improved once he became comfortable with his new walking areas. Is he 100% no, but then who is, he is still a work in progress and with each day we practice, he improves a bit more and is proud of himself, you can see by the smile on his face.  

With any dog, if you want them to do something you must first get their attention usually by calling, clapping etc. but Bishop is deaf so you have to get his attention another way.  To help with this challenge, he just got a present, a vibrating collar. Over the next few weeks we will be working on training with him to understand that the jiggling of his collar means look to me for a command sign. This will be a learning experience for both of us, there will be lots of treats involved, chicken for him, hot fudge sundaes for me, He is so smart bet he does much better than me. 

 Bishop is thrilled to have visitors come to the house,  male or female, young or old, he loves them all.  He is respectful, does not jump but follows them everywhere in the house. He loves his walks, running in the yard and chilling on the deck. 

 I know he would love to go hiking or jogging, something this foster would love to do with him but can’t ....Could you? 





UPDATE SEPTEMBER 2019:

Last Friday Bishop’s life change here at PWD and very experienced  and compassionate foster person came to visit with some of our pups.  She asked if she could help Bishop (one of our long timers here at PWD).    This is her first experience with a hearing impaired dog and a hound!      In his first days they have accomplished a lot together!   Here is her first update:   

 
'He had a better night last night.   He is in the doggy suite now for while in preparation to a longer stay tomorrow when I go to work. Have only heard him bark once or twice.  

He is a sweet boy and it is funny, we are working on sitting before we go thru a doorway, and while he is getting the hang of it before we leave the house, going back in is another story. He is smart and knows what I want but he will actually turn his head away from me like a stubborn child how doesn’t want to do something. I have lots of time so I just wait til he decides to sit, however briefly, he gets a piece of kibble then we go in but it is so funny to see him actually turn his head as if to say, nope not doing it.  I normally wouldn’t be doing this this soon but he is so smart, that I think he needs and can do these simple challenges. He gets a treat and a thumbs up sign each time he does something good. He gets a high value treat, a tiny piece of chicken, each time he potties outside as inside still is an issue."

 More updates to come from his foster home!

Bishop is a handsome  lemon  hound, who is deaf.  He  was surrendered to one of our Virginia shelters we partner with.  He is  about 60 lbs., fun, active, goofy pup, that will put a smile on your face.  He loves attention, and will curl up and lay on just about anything.  A sweet gentle soul good with people, cats and great with kids.  However, Bishop has some possession issues  with other dogs and so we do feel he does needs to be an only dog.   Bishop would do great in a secure  area or leash walking. 

  

If you are interested in meeting him, please complete our Adoption Application

animal.description:
Say Hello to Max!!

This hunky boy is 3 years old and weighs in at 60lbs 
Max has to be the only dog. No kids either, no exceptions. 
He has to stay in the Denver metro area. He would do best with a single male that has land. Max is a loner, he will let you know when he wants attention, but besides that he prefers to just hang out.
Max is being fostered with our trainer and he will need continued training after his adoption.

Could you be Max’s perfect match?

Max can only be adopted in the Denver metro area. His continued training is a condition for adoption. His adoption includes the following training:  3 in home sessions (the first being when he is brought to his forever home). 2 six week classes (basic obedience & intermediate obedience) and unlimited play groups for 3 month.

To apply to adopt Max visit http://www.moemoesrescue.com/

animal.description:
Little  Louie  is  our  'special needs'  dog!     Born  and  rescued one  year  ago  after  being  rejected  by his  mother and  left in the brutal sun .  We  took  Louie  home  and  nursed  him  through  his  first months.  Today  Louie  is  one  year  and  has  made  great  strides  but  still  needs  a home  that  care  care  and  accommodate his  needs.    Louie  is a  dancer  and  we  think  his  dad  may  have  been  part hyena   because  that  boy  can  jump!!!  Louie  is  environment  and tactile  sensitive  but  is  learning  how  to  accept  cuddles !  
There  is  no  complete  diagnosis on Louie  but the  vet  feels  there  is  a neurological impairment  which  effects  his  sight (depth perception) , balance and  perception  of  his  immediate  space.  Louies  forever  home  must  be  safe  for  his activity  and  lack  of self-protectiveness.  Louie  sees  the vet  on  a yearly  basis  ...  everything  seems  a go  health-wise.   He  appears  to be  seizure free  and is no longer on medication .  Louie loves  other  dogs  but  because  of  his  worldly  deficits   we  suggest  he  not be in a home  with  a larger  dog  unless  very, very mellow.  Louie  is  paper  trained  but  sometimes  misses  the  target  because  of his  sight.  He  uses  the  bathroom  outside on a regular basis.  He  is create trained  and  sleeps  in a  crate at night.  
Safety  first  for Little  Louie.....  to date  his  biggest  accomplishment is  conquering the stairs.  He  now  uses  stairs......  to  some  of  us  it's  just a  stair  but  to Little  Louie  it  is  Mt. Everest!!!!  Louie  is  patiently  awaiting  the right  home  that can  serve and  protect  him.  His  adoption fee is $250 which includes  neuter,  current shots  and microchip.  Home  visit is  required
animal.name: Little Louie

animal.description:
Hi.  My name is Sebastian, but my friends call me Bash.  I am an approximately 12 year old male, maltese mix, weighing 
in at 9 pounds. People tell me I can be quite funny and sweet.  

Due to my former living situation, I didn't really learn about being housebroken, so I struggle a great deal 
with that concept.  After trying really hard, my foster mom needs to keep me in diapers to prevent accidents 
in the house, but I am really good at "poo" outside, so I consider that a plus!!

I tend to bark at most things I see on my walks, be it other dogs or people.  Actually, I bark 
at those things inside too, but I can settle down after I get to investigate for a while.

I sometimes get a bit grumpy if you want me to do something I don't want to do and you try to hurry me 
along.  I may start to growl and warn you that I want to do it my way.  If you can back off and coax me a little 
with a treat, I snap out of it and usually do just what you want me to do.  However, I probably wouldn't be 
good in a house with children as they may not understand this process.

I get along with my foster brother, but I have to say he is a pretty laid back guy.  He lets me get my way and that's 
how I like it.  My foster cousin isn't so laid back and thinks she should get her way, so we don't do well together.

I like to be with my person, but please don't put me on your lap and expect me to stay there.  Just not my thing.  
But don't go too far as I want you close by and don't really like to be left alone.

I know I have a few challenges, but if you are up to it, I'd love to meet you!!


I love to walk around the neighborhood unless I see another dog.  I just don’t like to see or be around other dogs; regardless of size, so I need to be the only dog in the family.

I know that if I find my forever family we can work around these issues.  I am so sweet and will never leave your side.  I will snuggle with you and be your best buddy!  I need someone who has the time and patience to work with me so I can be the best I can be!  I don't like to be alone, so I will do best in a home where people aren't away all day.

Are you my special person?
animal.name: Sebastian

animal.description: You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Meet beautiful Pansie! She is a Pit Bull mix who was born in 2014 and weighs about 40 pounds. She was rescued off the streets of Texas with a horrific case of mange. This poor baby was a sight for sore eyes, she hardly had any hair left and her skin was raw and infected. We made sure she got immediate medical care and Pansie is doing awesome now! Her fur has almost grown back completely but it may take awhile longer to get her coat back to 100% because of how severe her condition originally was. She is spayed, up to date on vaccines, and is great with people of all ages and does well with other dogs with slow intros. Her foster mom says that she loves her people very much and is so sweet! She would do well in a home with slow intro to other dogs or could live as an only dog as she loves affection from humans. Pansie is house trained, crate trained, loves toys to chew on, enjoys walks and car rides, and is wonderful with kids! Pansie is long overdue for her happy ever after and we are rooting for this sweetheart big time! She deserves so much more than the life of neglect that she had to suffer through for so long. If you would like to make Pansie the newest member of your family and love of your life, please fill out an adoption application here: http://www.rescuedogsrocknyc.org/general-application

animal.description:
Momma was found and rescued along with her 8 puppies (underneath a house) and Lucas (who is likely the daddy of the puppies) right before hurricane Harvey hit. The puppies were about a week old when we finally got them out and Momma seemed very grateful for a safe place and consistent food and water for her and her babies. She's an EXCELLENT momma!! Even with limited food for herself, she kept her babies fat and healthy. She's young, about 2 years old, we think.
She has come a long way in a short time. She has come out of her shell and loves greeting people when they come home and is very fond of the children in the house. She loves to get love and attention. She's also discovered that she is a big fan of air conditioning :D
She was very tolerant of other dogs around her babies, though occasionally she would turn into momma bear and run everyone out for some peace and quiet. Most of her babies have found their forever homes and now she's looking for hers. She's got quite the personality and can certainly light up your day.
She is spayed. microchipped, and all current vaccines.
Ask about this brave and sweet girl today and how to meet her and make her part of your forever family.

animal.description:
Jackson is my shelter name and, as much as I like that name, I would not mind getting a new name to go with a new home.
      I am estimated to be about 4-5 years of age and I am a shepherd mix.   I have been neutered and am up to date on my shots.
     I know commands like “sit” and “lay down”, and I will shake your hand once I get to know you.  I walk well on a leash and really love squeaky toys.
      My downfall is that I can and will jump fences up to 6 foot high and escape from a yard.  A high secure fence will be a must for me.
     The other thing to know about me is that I suffered from kidney failure in the summer of 2017.  But I have recovered from it with the help of medication and a diet of grain-free food at the shelter has kept me healthy.  Ideally, I should be on special kidney food but it is very expensive.
     The staff describes me as very smart, loving, sweet natured, and obedient.  That is what you can expect from the shepherd breed.
      I came here for over a year and am ready for a home to call my very own. We would prefer to adopt families with children age 10+ adopt Jackson.

animal.description: Thaddeus is a sweet lug of a boy. He previously lived with 2 Dachshunds and 2 cats. Since being with his foster however it has become clear that this lug would prefer to be an only dog, at least at first. He is house trained, kennel trained, knows basic obedience, he's an amazing dog. He came to us because he has horrible stranger danger. He needs a calm home without a lot of people coming and going. He needs a secure 6' fence with a good sized yard. He is a bit "round" and he needs to continue his exercise to get to a healthy weight. He loves the water and squeaky toys, frankly he just loves all toys. This is a really great dog who was set up by his past owners to fail, and thats what happened. We are still working with him and his behavior issues and will continue. While we don't know that he's currently "adoptable" I think for the perfect home we would work with adopters to make it work but we need to make sure it's a fantastic environment for him. He is looking for responsible loving owners who will love him for the big goober that he is.

animal.special_needs_notes:
He is VERY overweight and will need exercise. We believe he is territorial for a couple reasons but specifically because he's bored out of his mind. 

He has bit 2 people. He bit the mail lady once and he recently bit the neighbor when he stuck his arm over the 4' fence. We will be assessing him but he currently lives with 2 older Dachshunds and thus isn't really able to play and be the dog he wants to be. Once we get him acquainted with his fosters Saint Bernard we expect to see quite a change in this big lugs demeanor. He's very much a puppy still at 2 years old and thus not overly coordinated and mouthy. For these reasons we recommend a home without small children.

animal.description:
My name is Diva and I am a special blind girl. My other senses are keen so don't think you are pulling a fast one over on me! I am spayed ...so we got that out of the way early. I am housetrained and crate trained...so that should give me extra points. I am good with children and if they try and pull my ears I won't be a happy girl. Actually children and me are great together, I am not good with dogs and cats because I don't like those kinds of surprises. I was a surrender due to landlord issues and I would've paid the rent on time but I couldn't find the checkbook. I was frightened beyond belief and confused having been in the shelter. Through all of this I was still a sweetheart to everybody. I love meeting new people and they feel the same way. I had been living with a family for seven years including children. I do really well in my foster and when I get used to the lay of the land I am great...and I don't own a GPS. I am 9 yrs old and I weigh 55 lbs....and I guess I look pretty good even though I can't see for myself in the mirror. I am a special girl and if anybody would find it in their heart to adopt me I would be the happiest girl in the world. I would add something very special in your life that you would remember forever. Thanks for checking in on me and caring. My application is at oneloveanimalrescue.orgTo be considered as this pet's adopter, please go to www.oneloveanimalrescue.org/adopt.html to complete your application.

animal.description:
Available in the Midwest and New England - Meet CHARMIN

Oh my gosh, look at that face!  Those eyes... They just look right into your soul, don't they?! 
Hi, my name is Charmin! I have both strength and softness for all your four-legged companion needs. I am 2 to 3 years old. I am funny as heck and energetic to boot.  People friendly, good with dogs and older respectful kids who won't squeeze me, please. Get it...don't squeeze the Charmin'. LOL. Can't you just look at my face and see how sweet and loveable I am. Continued obedience and learning of house manners is a must. I've only had a few accidents, so I am almost there. It'd be like getting a puppy but in the latter stages. Less suffering if you ask me. LOL. Seriously, I'll have you in stitches like Earl & Mooch from the Mutts comic strip. I'm a total goof. I'd love to go running with you. Or other adventures if you are the outdoorsy energetic type. 

Disclaimer: When I was at the shelter, they tested me for food aggression with one of those stupid plastic hands and I failed. BUT, there has been no issue in my foster home. I mean, what the heck is that hand thing anyway?! Just know it's mild and correctable if you see it at all. I have heard that a cat is a puzzle to which there is no solution. Not sure if I've met one of those or not. If you have one of those in your family, I can be tested to see how things go to that end. Say the word... P.S. Has anyone seen Mr. Whipple?

Charmin will be spayed, microchipped, and has been kept on heartworm and flea and tick preventative. 

If you would like to give Charmin a forever home please complete our online application and list Charmin in the notes section.

animal.description:
Hello to you! I am glad you are reading my profile. I’m looking for a place to call my forever home so read about me and let my foster family know if you think you might be just right for me.

Here’s my stats:
Possible Breed:  Lhasa Apso
Gender:  I’m a girl
Colors:  Classic white
Age:  The vet says around 13 years old
Weight:  About 22 pounds

Ideal Home:  I would do best as your only dog. I have a strong personality and though I tolerate the other dogs at my foster home, I would do best as the only queen of the castle!

Now for more good stuff!-
Her foster mom says, “Raven loves to do ‘zoomies’ in the yard and will run full blast and bounce like a deer. It is the cutest thing. She also dances on her back legs when it’s dinner time and uses her front paws like hands to reach out for her dinner.”

Raven takes turns being playful and being laid back. She loves to lay next to her person and gets very comfy on the sofa. If you are busy though, she will entertain herself and be happy. Raven gets along with the other dogs in her foster home but she clearly prefers that they leave her alone. As many Lhasa Apso do, she wants to be the boss of the group. She can get very grouchy if other dogs get into her space. She has bitten when she was afraid. 

Raven loves to play with toys and will lay down and chew on them. She can get possessive of her toys and food. Raven ignores the cats in her foster home and was comfortable with visiting teenage grandchildren. She should not go to a home with young children since she can bite when frightened. Raven walks well on the leash but prefers just to run around the fenced in back yard with her foster. She rides well in the car and does okay in a crate, though she prefers not to stay in the crate. 

She has the beginnings of cataracts but can see and is not on any medication.  So we are looking for a very special adopter that is experienced with strong dogs and is willing to work around the fears she has developed from her past, to give her an amazing home.

For more information, email my foster family at  luvdogs411@yahoo.com. Start the process of adopting me or one of the other pups by filling out the application found at www.shihtzu-rescue.com. 
PS. I've had ALL my vetting, and oh boy, it was a lot. Here's what I had done:
Distemper/Parvo shots – TWICE. One shot doesn't cut it.
Bordetella shots - ALSO TWICE. 
Spay/Neuter-of course.
A fecal exam so I don't have any bad worms. Treatment if I do.
A heartworm test. Treatment if I am positive for heart worms
BLOODWORK to make sure my liver and kidneys are working well, because you know, we doggies often have issues in the liver and kidneys.
A DENTAL exam AND cleaning if I needed it- yep, all my toofies are checked out.
See, that's a LOT. Ask your vet - that's a LOT.

 But if you just can't wait to see if I might be your new family member, email them now at luvdogs411@yahoo.com..

Start the process of adopting me or one of the other pups by filling out the application found at www.shihtzu-rescue.com.

BLOODWORK to make sure my liver and kidneys are working well, because you know, we doggies often have issues in the liver and kidneys.
A DENTAL exam AND cleaning if I needed it- yep, all my toofies are checked out.
See, that's a LOT. Ask your vet - that's a LOT.

animal.description:
You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Personality:
Miss Reagan appreciates a more quiet, one on one environment. She is quite a snuggler and will take in all the loving and attention you want to dole out. Don't be fooled by that though because she can be an escape artist and will not go to a home with a chain link fence. It's best she have a 6 foot privacy fence or no fence at all with leash walks. She will do great as the only dog or maybe with a buddy but that buddy will not be a cat or any other small breed or prey. She is a confirmed cat killer. Spunky Girl when she wants to be but is great inside and settles down beautifully.

None of our foster dogs are tested with cats because we have no way of testing them with cats. Siberians are notorious for their high prey drive and typically kill cats, rabbits, chickens, birds, squirrels, opossums, etc., so we don't have much success adopting them out to homes with cats. Most of our foster dogs are with us for killing cats, chickens and goats to begin with so our assumption is they are not good with cats and other small things that move.

Siberians are typically good with children of all ages and the only reason we would not list them as not good with kids is because they may be too energetic and bouncy and knock over a toddler.

Southern Siberian Rescue is a volunteer based 501(c)3 organization based out of Raleigh, NC, so we do not have a physical facility with operating hours that you can visit to meet our dogs. All of our foster dogs are in our personal homes. You need to fill out our adoption application (http://www.southernsiberian.com/info/adoption) and get approved to adopt and then we will set a time for you to meet our foster dogs. As a volunteer based group, we all have jobs, family, personal dogs and other commitments but we try to acknowledge and process applications as quickly as we can. That being said, we try to keep our available foster dogs as current as we can also but it is time consuming to get pics and information on new dogs so not all of our dogs are listed at all times. Please fill out our application and then we can discuss dogs that will work for you and your situation. We average 40-45 Siberians in our program so we are certain we have one that will work for you. Please know that we are not obligated to answer inquiries on dogs as we will focus on approved applicants. Again, there is ample time to discuss all of our foster dogs AFTER we have an approved application on file. We do adopt out of state as long as we can get a home check done. We ask that you, your family and existing pets make the trip to NC to meet and adopt our foster dogs.

SSR can not and will not hold dogs for anyone. If we do, that means another Siberian will die in a shelter because a shelter dogs time is very limited, as is our foster space. We do our best to process applications in the order received and first application gets first interest in our foster dog(s). We understand that there will be scheduling conflicts with home checks and meet and greets but we will try to accommodate for that if a potential adopter has interest in a particular foster dog in our program.

All Southern Siberian Rescue foster dogs are microchipped, up to date on shots, spay/neutered, on monthly heartworm preventative and flea and tick preventative. For additional information on Southern Siberian Rescue and Siberian Huskies, please visit www.SouthernSiberian.com.

To fill out an application, please visit

http://www.southernsiberian.com/info/adoption

animal.description:
This is sweet Coco and she's a happy girl who loves to give kisses. She's a Pitbull/Labrador mix with a beautiful mocha colored coat. She weighs 62 pounds, and has a short, stocky build. She has the most adorable floppy ears that are so soft to the touch! She dreams of a calm, relaxed life with good, loving people. She needs a home without small children because their energy makes her uneasy. She's good company for calm dogs, medium to large size. She's more of a companion for other dogs than a playmate.

Coco is a softie when it comes to her "babies". She likes to carry around a stuffed animal with her. She really loves all toys and plays well alone. She enjoys peaceful naps on the hammock, leisurely walks and just hanging around the house with her friends.

Take a look into Coco's gorgeous eyes and consider making room in your heart and home for her. She is waiting for you, and we would love to make that connection. The first step is to email placement@duckteam6.org if you are interested in making her a member of your family. Coco is spayed, microchipped and fully vaccinated. She is also potty trained, leash and crate trained. She's ready to have a family of her own and will make an amazing companion. 1/31/21 3:58 PM

animal.description:
Bruno is a special boy who will need a special owner to meet his special needs. He is a 6-year old paraplegic pitbull mix who has partial back legs. Bruno gets around well using a ‘drag bag’ and has his own set of wheels and is unaware of his disability. He is convinced he is the same as any other dog and acts like any other dog…although you will most likely find he is the happiest dog you have ever met. He gets along well with dogs and wants to play and has lived with cats. He may knock over small children as he is exuberant and does not go through life at a low speed when he is moving about. He does require time and devotion to care for as he is incontinent and has ‘sensitive’ skin. He is well behaved and patient during diaper changing time.

Bruno holds a special place in the hearts of all the people he has touched. We all want what is best for him and we want to make sure he goes to a home who can provide for all of his special needs. Castaway has invested a lot of time and resources into getting Bruno to the point where he can find his forever home. We'd love to find a family to keep us in the loop of how he is doing.

If you are interested in adopting, please go to our website at www.castawaypetrescue.org and fill out an adoption application. An adoption counselor will contact you. Please note that adoption counselors will only know of your interest if you submit an application. They do not see emails sent to the administration email account. The adoption counselor can answer your questions when they call after receiving your application. Please remember we are an all volunteer organization.

Minimum Adoption Donation is $250 (includes deworming, microchip with free registration, age appropriate vaccinations, spay and 30 days of health insurance). Any donation above the minimum is appreciated

Foster Home Location: Libertyville, IL

Our organization uses 24PetWatch microchips, which include free registration into the 24PetWatch pet recovery service. For more information visit www.24petwatch.com or call
1-866-597-2424.

animal.description:
THIS IS A COURTESY LISTING - PLEASE CONTACT Ingrid (310) 480 6030  pcdrapps@yahoo.com                                                                                             
  Handsome Donut went to hell and back: His mother Katie was found on the streets by a homeless family, scared and pregnant. The family took Katie in and she gave birth to several puppies. Some of them died and some were given away. Donut and his sister Buttercup as well as his mother Katie, stayed with the homeless family. We were able to rescue Katie, (WHO IS STILL LOOKING FOR A HOME) and Buttercup (at 16 weeks, who has been adopted) from the family but they refused to give us Donut, as they didn't want him to get neutered.
FAST FORWARD: 10 months later, the homeless family decided to dump Donut at a kill shelter. Now, he was full-grown (about 100 lbs.) The children of the homeless family used to play with him and when the parents left Donut to be killed in the shelter, the kids were heartbroken. Fortunately, our rescue was able save Donut, the VERY DAY HE WAS GOING TO BE EUTHANIZED! He was absolutely TERRIFIED in the shelter. Donut didn't trust anybody at first. He has now been with us for a while and LOVES all the staff. He is a total goofball and loves to play with toys and even tried out our doggie pool! Donut loves to go for walks, he's great! He is a silly guy and would love nothing more than his own family with a house and a yard for him to roll in the grass. He gives great kisses and this goof-ball will make you laugh!
Ingrid
(310) 480 6030
pcdrapps@yahoo.com
If you'd like to meet this cutie, please fill out our adoption application: http://www.pcdogrescue.org/online_application.html

animal.breeds_label: Australian Cattle Dog / Blue Heeler & Chow Chow Mix
animal.description:
This is Ripcord aka Ripley. Likely a victim of abuse, Ripley came to the Del Norte shelter a shut-down and very, very frightened pup—it took several weeks before staff and volunteers could get  him out of the kennel  for walks and interaction. With a lot of patience and positive reinforcement in the way of hot dogs, this incredibly handsome boy slowly began to trust humans and has since learned how to receive affection (he wasn't sure about being touched before and now he loves gentle pets), how to play and how to just be a dog. 

Shelter staff discovered Ripley is a stellar retriever and can play ball all day! He also takes treats very gently, knows how to sit, walks well on a leash, and doesn't seem reactive to other dogs. Because of his rough past and need for slow, patient introductions, Ripley would do best in an adult home with low traffic. He may fare well with another dog sibling if the match is right, though he's likely going to need that extra love and attention that comes with being an only fur-child.  

Dogs like Ripley have a very hard time in chaotic shelter environments and need an understanding soul mate to gently remind them that most humans are good and that the world can be full of pleasure and fun. If you've got an extra-big heart, a patient and kind personality and the desire to mend the spirit of a very deserving pup, please come meet our boy. 


Come check out Ripcord and our other dogs available for adoption at 2650 Washington Blvd, Crescent City, CA 95531. Please call us at (707) 464-7235 for additional information.  More photos of this dog may be available on the Dogs of Del Norte County Facebook page.

Do You Have Room In Your Heart For Aimee?? ?

She had originally come to the shelter as a stray covered in chemical burns and had scars on her feet where she had been bound.

Aimee still has so much love to give despite what she had been through!! 
Her horrific past is behind her and it's now her turn to have her very own Forever Family.
She lost her long term foster and bouncing around had caused her to regress., Aimee is ready for her turn at Forever.

She will need a dedicated person who will continue with her training and give her the exercise that she needs. She is very food motivated and will go crazy for a treat. Aimee is affectionate and very sweet. She does take time to warm up to a new person but once she does, she will be your best buddy!

Aimee will do best in an adult only home. She should be good with Male dogs who are calm and well balanced. Meet and Greet is a must!

Located- Saugerties, NY

- High energy
- Super Affectionate
- Adult only home / Calm energy 
- Should be good with male dogs who are calm and well balanced

animal.description:
Brizzo was surrendered to a Humane Society because his elderly human owners were not able to handle him. He loves playing and romping with other dogs. loves to go on walks, walks well on a leash, and enjoys throwing and carrying his big sticks. He also does "zoomies" when he is excited!  One cute thing Brizzo also does,  is he will grab your sleeve and tug you gently to the door. Lastly, he smiles with his teeth and it is adorable!!  Photo attached! 

Brizzo is a very happy, calm boy, loves giving the Pyr paw, is extremely smart, and as with all Pyrs, can be a bit stubborn but he is very treat motivated. 

This handsome boy  prefers women, but a male/female couple with big dog experience would probably work for him. He is resource protective, so a home with older teenage children is preferred.Brizzo was protective of his prior sick, elderly, female owner from the husband.

Brizzo can be protective of his food or toys, and that is a work in progress with his foster mom. Pyrs will take over a household as the alpha if a clear alpha in human form is not present. So, he will need someone willing to work with him using positive reinforcement to show him it is not necessary for him to be in charge and to work with him on resource guarding.

He is house trained, not destructive when you are gone, and gets along well with cats. Brizzo has been waiting for the "pyrect" woman since August of 2019. 
He is dog selective, but does enjoy playing with some other dogs. 

We will only consider applicants with previous large breed experience for Brizzo. He will be placed as an inside pet with outside privileges to a secure visibly fenced yard, minimum of 5' high, and directly accessible from the home. Pyrs do not do well with wireless fencing. They will take the shock for the freedom and become a "Disapyr!"

So, come on, ladies, give this beautiful boy a home! 

Applicants must be 25 years old, own your own home, have secure fencing and children over age 18 years old.   Your resident pets must be up to date on vaccines, sterilized, you must have a good history of vet care for them, and you must have used heart worm preventative year round for your dogs. 

We will require obedience training for Brizzo, to help you create a special bond with you and your new friend, and so you have a well behaved canine.  Great Pyrenees are willing to learn, but are not as eager to comply with commands as much as other breeds.  They are bred to be independent thinkers. 

If you are interested in giving Brizzo a foster or a  forever home, please go to our website, www.igpr.org and complete the appropriate application there. 

Adoption fee is $350

Ranger is an 8yr old neutered, 60#, male Shepherd mix. Friendly, happy, nice companion. Good with all people and dogs. No cats! He will need a fenced in yard. Ranger has been adopted 2 other times and dug out of a fence and escaped. He has to be watched and exercised daily. Not cat friendly. Good with all dogs who like to run, play ball, but not really wrestle. 

Contact us at nopawzleftbehind@gmail.com to set-up a meet and greet or inquire about an application. Adult dog adoption is $125 which includes DHPPL, Bordatella, Rabies vaccinations, Spay/Neuter, HW negative and on prevention, and microchip. All our dogs are up to date on vaccinations, heart worm negative and on prevention. We ask that other dogs in the home be up to date on shots and spayed/neutered.

animal.description:
Hi meet Freckles, 

Freckles is a 6-yr old Pointer mix that is full of joy and a zest for life. He weighs around 75 lbs, and is all brains and athleticism, ready to be a hard-working partner. He excels at learning quickly and will capture your heart. Freckles would be best as an only dog, he loves his space. He needs a family that will enjoy keeping him busy with walks, training, play and mental engagement. He would greatly enjoy a fenced yard so he can play safely as much as he wants, zipping around with his toys or just being silly.

Freckles came to us a few years ago after IPD found him locked in a hot car. They reached out to TLF for help. He has been hanging around getting all the lovins while waiting for his perfect family. 

We hold an event every weekend at our facility on SATURDAY 11-5pm.   Please visit our social media platforms for the specifics for each weekend as it changes from week to week. Please find our application at lovejoyfoundation.org when you come to an event please bring that filled out in hand with you. You can find our application at Lovejoyfoundation.orgYou MUST submit an APPLICATION via email in hopes to get an appointment, our application is found on our website lovejoyfoundation.org. If you do not get a phone call by Friday then we did not have anything available for you or the pet of interest was adopted before we got you application. We are a Southern California based rescue and do nothing adopt further than an hour from our headquarters in Inglewood, Ca. we do not adopt out more than a 30 minute radius. We appreciate you being understanding and Patient as we attempt to go back to a new normal.

animal.description:
You know those sweet commercials where a senior dog is rescued and finds a home that is full of love and soft beds? Those commercials that give you the feels and make you all teary-eyed? Do find yourself wishing you could be a hero like the people in those films? 

Well look no further, because I am a senior pupper looking for just such a hero. My name is Hershey and I’m a 12 year-old lab mix. I weigh about 65 lbs, am house trained and do not need a crate (I don't enjoy those things anyway).  I love belly rubs, car rides and chasing squeaky tennis balls. I’m good with cats and kids. I’m fine with other submissive or non-reactive dogs, though I’m not especially playful. I prefer to lounge and nap until meal time. My hearing is not what it used to be, but I don’t let that stop me from enjoying the good life. I also love walks and am not too bad on a leash.  I need a fenced yard in my new home because I cannot hear very well.  I would also like for my best friends to be home most of the time.  I want to spend as much time as possible with the ones I love.  I’m hopeful there is someone special out there that needs a napping partner and would love to give me the home I have dreamed of my entire life. 

My adoption fee is sponsored and includes spay/neuter, vaccinations, wellness exam, heartworm test, and microchip! If you're interested in meeting/adopting, please visit rescueonespringfield.com/adoption-application/ and fill out the form! We do adopt out of state with vet references and video home check. *Adopter is responsible for coming to get the dog and returning the dog if the adoption does not work out* 

Don't forget to LIKE us on Facebook!-www.facebook.com/rescueonespringfield

*Remember, dogs are pack animals. Because of this, Rescue One does not adopt to outdoor-only homes. Pets are family and are not disposable.  Please make sure that you are 100% committed to a pet before considering adding one to your home.

animal.description: Ziva Poor Ziva. We've had her almost 3 year now. This beautiful girl was first introduced to Angie after she had puppies and her former owners asked Angie for help with the pups. Originally, they were going to keep Ziva, but then decided it would be better to abandon her down by the Trinity. Of course, Angie couldn't let that happen, so Ziva joined Angie's Friends family. Ziva is sweet and loves people and kids. Ziva fosters with several other dogs and loves to play, but needs a slow introduction. She gets along with males and females. She's also a little protective of her toys. Like others of our larger dogs, she does need to learn some leash manners and how to channel her energy. She needs to learn she is not the leader and she will be calmer. Angie'sFriends will provide free training to her adopter. Est DOB: 6/2014 Vaccinated Spayed Crate trained Needs training Heartworm positive Loves people and kids Good with other dogs Absolutely NO CATS Ziva, Staffordshire Bull Terrier Mix has been shared from Shelter Exchange - http://www.shelterexchange.org.

animal.description:
Sophie is a strikingly beautiful 6 year old Staffordshire mix girl. Her beauty is only exceeded by her exuberance and zest for life. She has energy to spare and is very inquisitive. She loves people and is very affectionate, wanting to be petted and loved on. While Sophie enjoys people immensely, she does not care for other canines. She has had several male friends who were her size or larger, who could put her in her place if need be, but other smaller dogs are not candidates for friends. Sophie needs a strong leader who can show her how to be a good girl. She would make a wonderful companion for the right person who does not have other dogs, has a big fenced in back yard and wants a devoted friend and pal. The ones who need a friend the most, make the best friends. Sophie has led a lonely life and now it's time for her to have a home of her own and a person she can place her trust in and to whom she can give all her love..

animal.description:
This is the story of Mack. Mack was born on 9/12/13 as part of a litter of 6. His Mom was a Vizsla/Hound mix and we have no idea who Dad was. He was the largest pup of the litter at birth. As the litter grew and was nursing on Mom, we quickly learned that she was giardia positive (an intestinal parasite). It was an unfortunate circumstance since we were certain she was passing it on to the pups. Since they were so young when they started showing signs of suffering from this parasite, there wasn't much we could do other than wait for them to get to an age when we could treat it. One by one, they fell ill and then re-cooperated once treatment started. Mack on the other hand, did not seem to bounce back like the others. In fact, he fell ill with this parasite more than once in his puppyhood. We treated him each time and suffered with him during his periods of dehydration, not eating, and just feeling yucky. More than once, we had to force feed him for more than a week. He had no energy. We were giving him fluids three times a day just to keep him alive. There was a point where we did not think he would make it for certain. But we weren't giving up on him. I think he knew that, and this caused him to hang in there with us no matter how bad he felt. At 10wks, he weighed only 4.8lbs when his siblings were in the 10-12lb range. Because the parasite took every bit of nutrition we were force feeding him, he was way behind in growth & development. When he finally turned the corner and started eating on his own, he was unstoppable. He would eat every 2 hrs and simply couldn't get enough. We were elated! At 15wks, he was only about 2/3rds the size of his siblings, but he'd eat like a horse and we'd pump him up with vitamins every day. As you can see from his pictures, he is certainly 1 happy pup to be alive! UPDATE: We have now found it necessary to list Mack as a "Special Needs" adopt. After an oral exam, the vet determined that since he was sick for so long during puppyhood, he will need a yearly dental examination. The enamel on his teeth is not as strong as it should be and is chipping off. We've been told that there is nothing to do about it at this time other than give him soaked kibble as meals. He also cannot have any hard treats or toys as that will only promote the chipping of the enamel. He seems very happy and spoiled about this and is healthy as can be at about 55lbs now as an adult :)

Our adoption fee is $325 and all of our pets come with full vet records. All animals are up to date on vaccinations & dewormed. Unless otherwise indicated, puppies are NOT spayed or neutered since our vet recommends waiting until 6mos of age to do so. Please keep in mind we are a Rescue Group and most of our pups come to us with little or no background info regarding breed, eventual size, age or prior health issues. We rely on the expertise of our veterinarians and make estimates based on past experience. Also, when you're adopting from a Rescue, you should ask questions! You should always get shot/medication records and the rescue should have had the dog for a bit of time to check for disease. Take the time to educate yourself before adopting. A reputable rescue will have nothing to hide and will answer ALL your questions!!! Please visit our Web Site to see all of the pets we have for adoption. Our site contains information about our adoption process and fees, our application, and answers to frequently asked questions. Please read it carefully before contacting us. If you are interested in adopting THIS wonderful pet, we strongly encourage you to complete our adoption application now. Once we receive and approve your application, we will notify you of approval. The first application to be received and approved will get 1st choice - be sure that your references are available and willing to speak with us. Thank You Visit us at one of our next adoption days. Details are on our site under the "How to Adopt" tab. Hope to see you there!

animal.description:
Meet MJ! He is a 9yr old beagle/terrier mix. He was found as a stray in KY and ended up in a kill shelter...until we rescued him. He seems to get along with every other dog we have (incl puppies of all ages). He walks well on a leash once he gets over the excitement of being out with you. At only about 40 lbs, he is the perfect sized companion dog. MJ is very smart too and learned to sit for a treat & give his paw within 5mins. His aim is to please :) We find that he doesn't like to be without people in general but that's not to say that he likes all people and is definately picky about who he trusts. The ideal home would have someone around rather than leaving him for the workday and would have some dog training knowledge about how to handle a fear aggressive dog. We can no longer bring him to adoption events since many in the general public do not know how to read a dog's body language (he does give signs when he's uncomfortable). We would recommend a low-traffic household for sure because of the potential fear aggressive bite and someone with experience in dealing with this behavior.

Our adoption fee is $325 and all of our pets come with full vet records. All animals are up to date on vaccinations & dewormed. Unless otherwise indicated, puppies are NOT spayed or neutered since our vet recommends waiting until 6mos of age to do so. animal.description: My name is Roxanne (Rox for short) :) While I live with other dogs, I've felt I have an important job to do. My mission is to protect the home - everyone & everything in it. I'm now about 8yrs old, spayed & up to date on all vaccinations and have been this way since S&L rescued me from a kill shelter in WV years ago. I take my job of guarding the home very seriously, and I do have a bite history because of this fact. I'm not a cuddly dog, that's just not in my nature since I'm so busy working. While my fosterhome appreciates my dedication and service, they've said that I won't be going anywhere unless it's with someone who has a positive reinforcement training background that has dealt with my 'guard dog mentality' in the past. If that's you, please email S&L at endingthesadness@gmail.com saying you're interested in meeting me.

animal.description:
Meet Allie! Our vet estimates her to be 8yrs old and she has been spayed. Allie weighs about 50lbs. We wanted the vet to check her right eye since it presents somewhat smaller than the left eye. The vet agreed that it was most likely trauma from goodness knows how long ago. Upon testing, she does have limited sight in that eye but nothing that really effects her. She has gone through and recovered from much needed FHO surgery since she had some old trauma to her right rear leg as well as treatment for Lyme.

She absolutely adores attention from people so we think she didn't have much in her past :( She walks fine on a leash and is housetrained. Occasionally you'll see her with a toy but it's not a standard thing for her. The foster she is with is certain that right now, she is the most grateful dog in the house - her sighs of contentment while getting a belly rub for no reason says it all. While she currently lives with other dogs in fostercare, it took us months for her to accept and trust them. But with slow & steady crate rotations, introductions & limited interactions, she has become part of the pack. Check out our site for an application to make Allie a part of your family and FaceBook for adoption event details. (www.endingthesadness.org)

Our adoption fee is $325 and all of our pets come with full vet records. All animals are up to date on vaccinations & dewormed. animal.description:
Lila is a 4 yr old female that comes to PugHearts after being found wandering all alone.

She appears to have some problems with her back legs and is being monitored by the vet. Lila is, happily, heartworm negative. 

From Lila's foster: Meet Lila - our gorgeous Lila!! She is a very happy, healthy 4yr old that loves to play and cuddle and run - everywhere she goes!! 

Lila is a special needs pug that has some neurological issues with her back legs. We are not sure if this is due to an injury or birth - be please do not let this deter you from adopting her!! She does not let this slow her down one bit!! The biggest issue is elimations, as she is not always aware of pooping. Lila does squat to urinate, but then hops about 3ft while going. If she is leashed and you hold her, she will finish then move on. She will also stand up when asked! 

This sweet girl is a treasure and we are hoping that someone will give her a chance at a family - she deserves her own family and loves with her whole heart!!

animal.description:
My name is Darcy.

I was picked up as a stray by Rancho Cucamongo shelter and pulled by PATCH Rescue March 2017.

I am a female Dalmatian / Beagle mix, born approximately February 2012 and weigh approximately 25 pounds but stand pretty tall, so a medium sized dog. I am selective about the dogs that I like and pretty much just vocal, so if you have another fur kid, meet & greet is necessary! I do pretty well on a leash, crate trained, pretty well potty trained and a loving snuggle bug. I love attention and to be a lap dog. I could be the PREFECT companion. Small children make me nervous, but older respectful ones are okay with me. I have a high prey drive and protective of my space and things, i.e. toys, crate and take small children as a threat. I do not attend events because I am Cujo in a crate and they are too stressful for me. I am a total love and sweetheart for the right person.

Adoption Includes: I am spayed, up to date on core vaccines (5 in 1 in, bordetella & 3 year rabies ex. 03/21), dewormed, microchipped and any health issues we were aware of addressed.

If Interested PLEASE contact PATCH Rescue Inc. patchrescue@gmail.com or (760) 706-0728

Adopt a Pet Listings =

https://www.adoptapet.com/adoption_rescue/93645-patch-rescue-inc-victorville-california

PetFinder Listings =

https://www.petfinder.com/member/us/ca/victorville/patch-rescue-inc-ca2487/

Adoption process is verbal interview to determine if we think your family is the right situation for the fur kid you are interested in, application (can be downloaded here: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/0B9ZDmKaRLnYfbDZLbDN5Y3hYeWM?usp=sharing), once application is reviewed and approved home check. Then we say you are becoming part of the PATCH family adopting one of our fur kids, so we expect follow up on our family member throughout their life!

Please keep in mind we are 100% volunteer run We do not have a facility, completely foster based, so we all have our real jobs, it could take 24 to 48 hours to receive a response.

Thank you for considering adoption to save two lives!

1/31/21 12:13 AM

animal.description:
Judy Blue Eyes was kept in a kennel for 7 years before finding herself at the local county shelter. She was very stressed at the shelter so we were happy to bring her into KAWS and into a home environment. Judy just wants to be with her people 100%. She craves human contact and cannot get enough petting and hugs. She does well with children and is fine with other dogs. She does not care for the feline friends. 
Judy's special home would be able to walk her through learning about life as a loved pet and not as a caged creature. She worries when her person leaves the house, but she is getting better at knowing that they will return to her. 
Judy deserves a patient extra loving family that will just be with her and shower her with kisses and hugs. After 7 years, she deserves it!

animal.description:
Carly and Cooper are brother and sister who have been together their entire life.   We are looking for a home where they can be adopted together as they are very bonded.     They love being on a farm and LOVE to go swimming.   Very sweet and goofy natured dogs.    They've lived on a farm and are great off leash, although they do tend to be hunters and will kill small animals.   Cooper will chase deer as well, so care needs to be taken when off leash.  Not trustworthy to be left loose unattended but are wonderful on our pack walks on the property.    They are home bodies and prefer to be at home rather than out in public or at the dog park.     They would also do best as the only dogs in the home.    They've been around cats and are fine if supervised, but having prey drive, would not leave them loose in the house with cats and no one home.   

Crate and house trained.  Good on leash, both know a few commands.    
Fenced yard required if in town. 

The hounds have been with us since they were puppies and would really love to find a place of their own...   Would do best with older kids, over 10.     $400 adoption fee is for both of them together.     Both are altered and microchipped.    VERY sweet dogs!

animal.description:
Another update:  Just look at this boy.  He's goofy, loves to go for walks and is your best bud after he knows you.  He can get a little over the top, but that's where he needs a strong (not necessarily in strength but helpful) person.  He has been at the shelter for over three years.  ARL doesn't want to set him up to fail so multiple visits with Jeter is a must.  If you think you are his person please call the shelter to have a meet and greet.  He probably would be better as an only dog.
Update:  Jeter was recently (July 2020) featured on Dodo.  Please check out video.
 Jeter was turned over to ARL because he was just too much for them as a puppy.  ARL can't impress on potential adopters enough to research a breed before adopting.  Jeter is now two years old.  He really needs a "dog" person who is willing to work with him and take control so he can show his true personality.  He is such a happy boy.   He loves his toys and he enjoys going on runs.  He graduated from the Sheriff's Dept. PAWS program where he learned basic obedience training.  He just needs the right person willing to continue his training and give him a chance to show a family what he can truly be.    My adoption fee is $125-150 which includes my spay/neuter, age appropriate vaccinations,  heartworm disease test,  microchip/registration fee and collar .  ADOPT ME TODAY and find a friend for life!   And remember that adopting a pet is a life long commitment.

animal.description:
Little Ringo has had a tough time of it. He was rescued from a terrible hoarding situation and placed into a shelter. Unfortunately the shelter was forced to close down and all dogs there needed somewhere to go. That is how Ringo made his way to HUA. He is a shy guy and we don't blame him one bit. He has never had a reason to trust humans. Caregivers love him and are helping to build his confidence. He does enjoy a rest in a lap and we know there is so much more to this cute fellow. What he needs is his own home where has a nice routine and people who will be patient with him as he blossoms into the fun kid we know he wants to be.

For more information go to www.hua.org.

animal.description:
Goofy has been with us for 2 years and is still looking for his perfect person.  He is happy in his foster home and loves greeting the many new doggie friends who come and go, but still holds out hope of finally finding his own forever home.   He is very fearful and distrustful of strangers but once he bonds he is a loyal funny little guy who craves attention.  He’s about 6 years old, about 15lbs and maybe mixed with papillon or some kind of terrier.   He has a surprisingly soft silky coat and is gets along well with other dogs.  Goofy will need a calm adult home without a lot of human visitors to help him feel more comfortable. Email njwoof@cs.com if you are interested.

We do not have a shelter- all our pets are in foster homes and can be seen by appointment only during the week, or at our weekly pet adoptions every Sunday at the Animal Clinic of Morris Plains from 12:30 to 3PM at 3009 Route 10 East next to 5 Star Car Wash (formerly Boulder Car Wash) in Morris Plains (Denville on GPS).  To help us better match a pet to your household, we request you fill out an application on our homepage www.secondchance.petfinder.com and copy and paste it into an email, or print it and bring it to our adoption day when you come.   Local inquiries only please- we do not do long distance adoptions.
Can't adopt but still want to help this dog?  Click on the "Sponsor Me" button at the top of this page to donate toward his/her care!  All donations are tax-deductible and go directly toward the care of our rescue dogs.  Thank you for your support!

animal.description:
Stop! Bama time! I dance to the beat of my own drum but I would really love to have a life long dance partner. My name is Alabama, but all the cool kids call me Bama. I am a 62lb., 4 year old, male, chow/hound/awesome sauce mix.  I am looking for an extremely dog savvy person or couple to call me theirs!  Like all amazing things, I'm not for the faint of heart.  I'm the sweetest, most lovable boy ever, but I've got a lot of fear.  The first year of my life wasn't all sunshine and roses and I've worked very hard to learn not everyone will hurt me.  I adore my people, but I need them to be super strong alphas.  I am very vocal when I'm scared or excited, but when I'm at home just chillin' with my people, I'm total a love bug.  I also promise to always let you know when the mail arrives.  I am house trained, crate trained, know basic commands, and walk well on a leash.  I've never met a treat I didn't love.  I am a very VERY smart boy.  I need structure and routine in order to thrive.  I would do best in a home with a 6ft privacy fenced yard (no apartments for me).  I do not want to live with any children or cats.  I get along with dogs after a few proper introductions, but I would be happiest as your one and only.  I need a strong, confident, loving, calm home without a lot of commotion.  They say the eyes are windows into the soul and anyone can tell after checking out my puppy-dog dreamboat eyes that I'm a darling underneath a tough guy exterior.  I do enjoy taking relaxing walks through the park and romping around the backyard playing with my friend. I am a strong, full-of-life guy who needs someone full of dog training skills, patience, understanding, and love. I want to feel safe and just relax in my forever home, but for that to happen, my forever best friend needs to be a true pack leader.  I cannot wait to find my amazing forever person!  I'm already smiling just thinking about you!

My adoption fee is sponsored and includes my spay/neuter, vaccinations, wellness exam, heartworm test, and microchip! If you're interested in meeting/adopting me, please visit rescueonespringfield.com/adoption-application/ and fill out the form! We do adopt out of state with vet references and video home check. *Adopter is responsible for coming to get the dog and returning the dog if the adoption does not work out*

animal.description:
DOB: December 2016
Weight: 60lbs

This sweet boy bonds with select people at first, basically like a guard dog. He gets scared of new people and needs proper introductions. We do not recommend him in a home with small kids because he is more on the nippy side with toy and doesn't like grabbing at the ears, face, or tail. He is one that takes some patience and understanding of the kind of dog he is. He is super cuddly and hands down the best dog ever until it comes to first impressions. He wants to get to know you before he thinks you're a friend. He is not recommended in a home with cats or other dogs- you won't want another fur baby with this big ol baby in your life anyways. He loves water, to walk, he is pretty well mannered on a leash. He will stay by your side and even protect you if need be. He has a couch potato side as well and he can be a window peeker (he loves to watch outdoors). He is pretty house trained, but the first few nights he's with you it's natural for a potty accident to occur.  Please call us for more information on him and to schedule an appointment to meet him!

animal.description:
Sam is a sweet but timid dog. With a little patience he would be a great calm addition to the family.  Everything scares Sam until he's sure it's not going to hurt him. Sam does great with other dogs after he gets to know them. He's a little snappy if they are in his face the first week he's trying to adjust to his new environment. Sam is very happy and playful with other dogs after he knows they are not gonna hurt him and he's a little more comfortable in his new home. Sam would do best in a Quiet Home without children/teens.  Even though Sam is a Shy/skittish boy, he warms up slowly. Sam will never be a lap baby but will lay beside you on couch/bed and will let you pet him once he's comfortable and settled.  
Sam has even been known on ocassion to play a quick game of chase and paw at the peoples hand and although they are a few rare moments it shows he at times can feel very comfortable and play with people. Sam is house and crate trained. Walks pretty good on a leash. He absolutely adores his foster dad. Sam is around 3 years old and 30 lbs. 
He's a terrier mix and is utd, hw negative (tested below detectable levels) and neutered!

All dogs have a $175 adoption fee which includes vet check, age appropriate shots (atleast 2 sets for puppies), dewormer, heartworm test (if over 6 months), rabies (if atleast 16 weeks) and spay/neuter! Puppies will be altered before adoption. All rescues and shelters practice pediatric spay and neuter. This is essential in our rescue efforts and it is a policy that we will stick by. All dogs over 8 weeks and 2 pounds will be altered before adoption. There are no exceptions to this rule on all healthy and adoptable dogs. 

Puppies/Dogs that are not available for adoption due to vetting not being complete can be reserved with an approved application and a non refundable $50 deposit. This deposit is applied to your adoption fee and the remaining $125 is due at pick up.

Wags and Whiskers is an all-volunteer rescue. We also have full-time jobs and Families. We will try to answer all questions and applications in a timely manner. Please be patient and bear with us . Do not contact Parkway Animal Hospital as they are a vet clinic and can not answer questions on behalf of Wags and Whiskers. All questions and comments must go directly through the rescue. Thank you for your understanding.

ADOPTION APPLICATION

This is a courtesy list for an individual or group seeking a new home for Faith. Faith is not part of the PAWS program.
If you are interested in Faith, please complete the online application which can be found at kcpaws.petfinder.com and the application will be forwarded to the group or individual responsible for this family pet.
Faith is a beautiful sweet Aussie mix girl around 6 years in age. Faith is quite shy at first and does take a bit of time to warm up to someone new, but once she does she's very sweet and loves to have her belly rubbed.
We consider Faith to be special needs because she does not walk on a leash. We are unsure what has transpired in her past but any tugging at her neck or collar or even the presence of a leash coming her way terrifies her.
Needless to say a fenced yard will be MANDATORY for Faith.
Faith really is no trouble at all, she is low key and will lounge with you all day on her cushion or the couch. She is not destructive and appears to be housebroken (once she learns the new routine).
Faith does get along fine with other dogs like most Aussies can be a bit bossy at times. She would do best in a home with older children 10 and up.

animal.description:
Meet Gertie

This 3 year old girl had a rough start in life. A very kind man found her in a ditch on the side of the road in pretty bad shape and we were contacted for help. She had puncture wounds all over her body and she was very skinny. She had to have some oral surgery and bone grafts, but with a little TLC she recovered wonderfully. She was timid and shy, but she put her trust in us and her doctors. Now Gertie is happy and healthy and waiting for her furever home! All she wants is for someone to sit and cuddle with her. Honestly, she thinks she is a lap dog. She is very sweet and extremely  passive with humans. 

However, we believe that Gertie may have had to fight other dogs for her survival.  We don’t mean necessarily as a “fighting”dog, but in a situation where she lacked proper care and was not fed properly, etc.   You can probably imagine what  type of living environment we are referring to.  Because of this, she does have  fear aggression towards other dogs. For that reason, we will only place her in a home as the “only” pet. 

For more information about adopting Gertie, please visit our website, dareanimalrescue.com to fill out a foster or adoption application. Click on the tab, Foster/Adoption Process and then How to Adopt. Please be sure to read about the adoption process  prior to submitting your application.

animal.description:
IN SEARCH OF A SPECIAL SOMEONE FOR A SPECIAL DOG!

Snugs is a Special boy in need of a Special Someone to give him a Special Forever home. Snugs is 82 lbs. of funny, talkative 6-year-old adoreableness but this goofy, loveabull boy has some challenges.
   
Snugs has separation anxiety and he needs his people to be around a good bit. He loves his crate and feels secure there but panics when left alone outside of his crate. His foster mom leaves Snugs crated when she is gone and he is perfectly happy. But this means that his foster and forever people need to be homebodies so he is not required to spend long hours being crated.

Snugs also has hip dysplasia. It is mild to moderate now and AFLAR has him on all kinds of support supplements to slow down the process but it is a degenerative disease and will need to be managed over his life time. He loves his walks and does lots of zoomies in the yard but foster mom is careful to not over excecise him or he will get sore.

Snugs lives with another dog and is dog tolerant. He does not like to share his bones or toys with other dogs and so his foster mom has everyone play separately. He also gets upset at the neighbor dog at the fence and can transfer that excitement to his foster sister so they have separate yard time too. He would be perfectly happy not living with another dog as his people are the most important things in the world to him. He would be OK with another dog in the home if carefully managed like his foster mom does.

Snugs does not like meeting stranger dogs in the street on leash. Particularly little dogs. Little dogs scare him. Snugs acts like he can’t believe they are real and he just wants to stand there and stare at them. He is really just a big baby! Snugs has had a good bit of training in this area and is doing as well as he can. But his Special Forever person would need to continue his training. He packs up quickly with other big dogs though and enjoys pack walks.

Snugs is actually an independent chill little man who likes a few pats and then goes off for a nap or to hang in his yard and watch the birds. He does like his evening couch cuddles though and is blissful when invited up for a cuddle. He is a couch hog though and lies with his big head in foster mom’s lap but takes up the rest of the couch.

Snugs is not wild about the vet or meeting new people. He is good with new friends after a few minutes when he knows you are nice and not going to overwhelm him because he is so cute. Then he will then love you forever…. friends for life! The vet scares him though. He is muzzle trained for vet visits and has done fine with good vets who handle him with confidence and care.

Snugs is a Special dog. Yes he has challenges but what makes him really special is the love and loyalty he gives his people. He always has something funny to say, yes foster mom understands him, and an opinion about everything. He brings many smiles and giggles wherever he goes and is a wonderful happy companion grateful to share your life.

CONTACT: (805) 445-3535
info@allforloveanimalrescue.org

animal.description:
Kohl is a red, 5-6 year old, 30 pound boy. He was described by the shelter he came from as a lab/basset, though we think he's a dachshund mix. He is long and has little legs. He was in a foster home after living in a mall parking lot and was named after the Kohl's store. At first he was almost feral, but four months in his foster did wonders.
His super foster home was moving; thus his transfer to B&B. He is still shy, but he seems to have a good disposition. He has been doing well with his playgroup- dogs from 10 to 30 pounds plus one gentle Labrador. He has been getting braver with people he knows, and he is obedient about going in and out of his kennel for exercise time. He should warm up with love and attention. It may help to have a dog in the home to show him how to behave.
Please find our applications and valuable information under 'Adopt a dog'* on our website: *www.beaglesandbuddies.com* and email your application to beaglesandbuddies@gmail.com. Let us know your preference of appointment day/time and which dogs you are interested in and we will do our best to accommodate and email you the closest appointment available. Please allow us up to a week to get back to you. Most appointments will be Friday-Sunday, 10 am - 2 pm, for an hour.
*Note bring any other dog/s and the entire family to your meet and greet at B&B.* A complimentary training manual is included with each adoption, authored by terristeuben.com. Check out her website - she is fabulous!
B&B is glad to be open during the pandemic. We know the value and comfort of a loving pet companion and are doing our best to help the dogs and folks who need them. We update our website daily and are always rescuing, vetting, rehabilitating, socializing.
* We are accepting applications for volunteers to spend time with our dogs, hang out, sing/read to the shy ones, walk/toss ball with those who go to the playgrounds; cleaning, office work, gardening, and building/repair projects! *

Are you my furrever family?

For further info on the adoption process, please visit our home page and check out the "Adopt a Dog" section, which has thorough instructions. All our dogs are spayed/neutered, microchipped, and

fully vaccinated before adoption; they have been wormed, bathed, socialized, walked daily and much loved; each adoptee leaves with a leash, collar, and all medical records.

Our prices are higher than the shelters' because we nurse the dogs through their illnesses and get them needed surgeries and dentals. We also spend time socializing. Furthermore, unlike shelters, rescues do not get financial aid from the government and must rely on donations, grants, and adoption fees. Our fees for adults start at $150 and go up to $750. The higher end is for our most in demand dogs, such as young beagles and other purebred dogs. The lower end is for dogs who have been here a while. For puppies, we may go beyond this and charge $1000. The good news is that, because rescues fall under the "charity" category, the fees for our dogs are officially donations and are therefore tax deductible. You can think of it as donating to a worthy cause and getting a dog in return!

Sponsor Me

Beagles & Buddies must find ways to raise money so we can continue saving dogs. Your tax-deductible donation keeps our rescue kennel operating!

Hours

Friday: 10 am to 3 pm

Saturday: 10 am to 3 pm

Sunday: 10 am to 3 pm

Monday: CLOSED

Tuesday: CLOSED

Wednesday: CLOSED

Thursday: CLOSED



Weekday appointments may be available. We are a small staff and do our best to accommodate your needs. **Note that during COVID, we are not holding open houses on any day. Please email us for an appointment and include your application (found on our website, beaglesandbuddies.com, under "Forms"). Most appointments will be Friday through Sunday, though other days may also be available. We usually schedule one appointment per hour. Allow 1-2 hours for your appointment. Please look at our website and make a list of one or more dogs that you would like to see.

Contacting Us

If you have a question about adopting, giving up a dog, boarding, or volunteering, please visit the appropriate tabs on our
home page.

For more specific questions, call 626-444-9664 (please leave a voicemail if no answer) or email at beaglesandbuddies@gmail.com. Note that
Emailing
is always preferred!

Thanks!

Please note: If you are viewing this profile anywhere other than Beagles & Buddies own website, you are not receiving full info. Visit info on pet here.

animal.description:
Here at Adopt-A-Dog, Fry serves the role of class goofball very well. Effusive in both his love for his friends and in every experience he has, Fry is one of a kind. He takes to new experiences, such as learning how to play soccer or football, or going for a ride in the Adopt-A-Dog van, with an enthusiasm that cannot be matched. He truly is a unique dog and has most of his human friends saying "Oh, Fry!" or "That's Fry for you" whenever he does something just a bit more awkward than his counterparts.

A big guy, Fry came to our shelter when his original family could not handle his size. At the time, he had not reached a year old so he still had both growing and learning to do. We began working with Fry on basic obedience and his manners when it came to both people and other dogs. The Fry we have today has come a long way from the Fry we first met, and we know he is ready to show off for his very own family. When making new friends, Fry typically needs a bit more time to get comfortable and get to know someone. Once he has spent some time with you, and has been feed a copious amount of treats, Fry will be your best bud. 

 All this big guy needs in a home is a willingness to get slobbered on followed by tons of comfortable places to sleep and stretch out. We know that this not-so-small Fry is ready for his new family.


Contact the Adoptions team at (914) 273-1674 or adoptions@adoptadog,org for more information!

The first step to adopting one of our dogs is to fill out our online adoptions questionnaire located here: https://forms.gle/5heEH8S6c7zXBneD7

animal.description:
Tumble is a 7 yr old female better known as Tummy or Tum Tum.

She is heartworm negative and already spayed. 

From Tumble's foster: Tumble is a special needs foster, not due to health issues (as she is VERY HEALTHY), but due to fear and trust issues. 

Tumble comes to PugHearts scared of everything. She does not trust men at all and will bark and bark to let them know to go away. 

She will trust women and is the sweetest, gentlest, loving girl once you earn her trust. 

I love and adore Tumble. Tumble and my husband....not so much. 

Tumble is looking for a patient lady that is willing to go slowly and allow Tumble to trust you completely. 

She is housebroken, heartworm negative, kennels on command and wags her whole body when she is happy to see you. 

Tumble is learning to trust my husband through food. She is a typical pug and food is her motivator. 

I know there is a perfect home out there for her....it is just going to take time and patience to find it......just like it will take time and patience for Tumble to trust a forever family.
animal.name: Tumble
