animal.description:
EST DOB: 12/2016
Weight: 75lbs.

Oliver is black and white with Hazel eyes and a curious black nose. He loves to chew his nylabones or antlers and can keep himself occupied with those for hours at a time. He doesn't have a lot of patience for other dogs, and would probably be best as an only pet.

Oliver can run like the wind but doesn’t have super high energy. In other words, Oliver can run or play off his energy and then is just as happy to chill out and snuggle. 

Oliver is very well mannered, house-trained and has good recall. He is very sensitive to correction and a simple “ah, ah” is all he needs to stop him in his tracks. He is eager to learn and a pleaser. The only time Oliver gets distracted is when his nose gets a scent of something like a deer. Then watch out! He has leapt over a 4 foot fence in pursuit.

Oliver gets anxious when left alone for long periods of time. His human should be gentle and kind and experienced in positive reinforcement techniques. 

A note from Oliver: 

Hey guys!!! My name is Oliver.  I'm basically just a big, lovable, adorable goofball.

Everyone sees how handsome I am, and how big I look, and how mellow I can be sometimes, and they think I'm all grown up. But really I'm just a kid inside! 

I like to play with toys and humans! I love to hike! I ride awesome in a car!

I not real crazy about crates, but I'm comfortable in a large kennel space or maybe a gated room. Sometimes I get a little nervous about being left all by myself.

I'm looking for someone special to love me for who I am..

If you think you could be my family, please email ABetterLifeAR@gmail.com.

I'll be watching for you!!!

~Oliver~

p.s. I'm from Morganton, NC and would like to stay close to my friends


We try to limit our travel time for home visits to a two-hour driving range (about 75 miles) from Morganton, NC.

Please visit http://www.abetterlifeanimalrescue.com/adopt-a-pet.html for an adoption application.
Adoption fee $100.00

Out of state adoption available. 

Ms Lucy does not like other dogs so we are looking for a one dog , indoor home , preferably with fenced in yard and a home without small children.  Lucy has had her DNA tested and the results are in the pictures below. Whoever adopts will receive her dna results. Please note she does have some pit bull terrier in her so you will need to live in a town without a pit bull ordinance.  She is super cute!

Lucy is a sweetheart.  She is about 5-6 years old and apx. 52 lbs.  She is very curious as you can see in the pictures but also very eager to please. She is smart and knows how to sit on command and is very eager to learn new things .  She is a active dog. She would need to be a single dog home as she tends to be a bit territorial.  But she is a very loving dog otherwise and can walk on a leash (does pull some)   We always take the fur babies back into our care if for any reason it does not work out.

NOTE FOR LUCY IF YOU LIVE OUT OF STATE TRANSPORTATION TO YOUR LOCATION MAY BE AVAILABLE WITH AN APPROVED HOME STUDY/APPLICATION.  PLEASE INQUIRE IF INTERESTED IN FINDING OUT MORE.

animal.description:
Handsome Dylan was returned to us in July 2017. He is one of malamute Asha’s puppies born nine years ago.  He is a well mannered boy, housebroken and crate trained, and does well with most dogs that respect him. Dylan has many trust issues and has blossomed under Erin and Dan's care, and has decided being with them is the best place for him to stay. 

Sanctuary Sweethearts at IAMRA are dogs that for various reasons – usually old age or extreme medical needs, or both - are deemed unadoptable.  So IAMRA will provide them with their forever homes.  We locate the appropriate “furever foster” home for them, and provide for ALL of their needs, from special food, meds, supplements, and vet visits, to toys and chews and treats and anything else they need to make their twilight as perfect as can be. This of course can be quite expensive.  A bag of prescription or special food alone can be nearly $100. And all of our Sanctuary sweeties need extra vet visits – and almost always extra treatments and meds for what ails them.  Most if not all are on special supplements, for joint care, liver or kidney support – whatever each individual dog needs.  Anyone who has had an old dog, knows how expenses can climb in their twilight years. We’ve made a promise to take care of these special senior souls – most have had not so great lives until coming to us. So it is important that they not only know love and kindness, but also know physical comfort in their old age. Please consider helping to sponsor one of our Sanctuary Sweethearts, or make a one time donation to help with their care. Many thanks to all who help these sweet old souls!
animal.name: Sanctuary Sweetheart: Dylan

GINA'S ADOPTION FEE IS $150

The shelter software system requires that we choose a predominant breed or breed mix for our dogs. Visual breed identification in dogs is unreliable so for most of our dogs we are only guessing at the dog's predominant breed or breed mix. We strongly encourage you to select your new pet by looking at each dog's individual personality and pet qualities rather than relying on a breed label that is only our best guess.

Our adoption fees vary from $150 and up. All of our dogs are up to date on vaccines, heart worm preventives, and flea/tick medication, and will be spayed/neutered prior to adoption. Portions of your adoption fee also help care for the sick and injured animals that we take in. Thank you for supporting us and considering a rescue dog!

Meet Rose! Rose is a 8 year old Hound mix. Rose is a really sweet girl! Rose needs a home that is dedicated to working with her. She craves love and attention, as she really aims to please and wants to work for you! She would need slow introductions with other dogs, as she is an alpha female, and not recommended for a home with cats or other small animals. She would take very well to training and it is highly recommended. Because of her hound nose, she would not be allowed liberty until full trained, and she loves to run and might wander off a track! It would be best if inappropriate addition, if Rose had a tall fenced yard.

ROSE'S ADOPTION FEE IS $160The shelter software system requires that we choose a predominant breed or breed mix for our dogs. animal.description:
MEET FREDDIE!! This handsome man is about 9-10 years old. He appears to be a purebred black lab. He is a very gentle, calm, and mellow boy who is looking for a forever home to spend his golden years. Freddie gets along great with other dogs and appears to leave cats alone, though he has not been around many cats up to this point. He walks well on a leash and knows some basic commands. Freddie loves car rides and going for walks, and he’s never met a stranger! Freddie really doesn’t like to be alone, so he needs to go to a home where someone can be home a lot of the time. He would be perfect for an older couple looking for a mellow companion. 

**Freddie does have a medical condition that makes him a special needs boy. He is prone to getting perianal fistulas, which require long-term medication to control. At this time, Freddie receives medication once every other day. He continues to do very well as long as he gets his medication regularly and has not had any issues recently! For more information on perianal fistulas, here are some helpful links: https://www.merckvetmanual.com/digestive-system/diseases-of-the-rectum-and-anus/perianal-fistula
https://www.acvs.org/small-animal/perianal-fistulas 
 
If you would be interested in meeting/adopting Freddie, please visit labradorfriends.com/how-to-adopt to fill out an adoption application, or email labfriendinfo@gmail.com if you are already approved!

animal.description:
***RESOURCE GUARDING EXPERIENCE REQUIRED***

HEY there! My name is Margo. I have been in rescue since I was just a few months old.  I've learned so much since beginning my journey.  

I LOVE people and really love to play with dogs.  I am still learning that not all dogs love me as much as I love them.  I am also learning to read their cues better and not be too strong in my play.  If you have a ball of any kind, you will instantly be my best friend. Toys are another favorite thing of mine - especially kong type balls. No cats, bunnies or hamsters for me as I have a high prey-drive.

Part of my training is learning to share my toys and not guard my food.  I am still working on this and my adopter will need to continue my training to help me be the best dog I can be.  

My perfect family will take me on a lot of adventures.  I would do best with an active family that'll continue to work with me on my training and give me a lot of exercise. I don't require an adopter with a fenced in yard, but I sure would love one to run around in. 

Margo would not do well in an apartment/condo/townhouse. She needs space to run!

To determine if you'd be the right fit for Margo, please email: Paul@4pitssakerescue.com

Please fill out an application on: www.4pitssakerescue.com to adopt me.

home_environment_attributes.other_animals: No small animals for Margo - she has a very high prey drive.

animal.description:
Friends to the Forlorn
Adopt-a-BullBreed: Pit Bull Terrier/American Bulldog Gender: Male Estimated Date of Birth: September 4, 2012 Size: 50lbs Location: Dallas, GA
RESCUING GWEEB
On September 9th, 2012, we were notified of a bad situation. A man in Tucker, GA really needed our help as he rents a room in a house and had 16 Pit Bull/American Bulldog mixes. This included a new born litter that was just days old. All 16 of these dogs were living outside and none of them were fixed, vaccinated, or de-wormed. This man was overwhelmed and he was unable provide for the dogs so he gladly signed over 14 dogs and we vetted the 2 he wanted to keep. Gweeb was one of the pups from the litter that was only a few days old. Gweeb's mother was a fantastic mom, but his litter surely would have died living outside in those conditions with her being so malnourished.
ABOUT GWEEB
The best word to describe The Gweeb is awkward. He was the runt of a litter of 7 puppies and is awkward in everything that he does. Gweeb lives in foster care with multiple other dogs and is fantastic with them as he is generally submissive. He is a real goofball and is sure to clown around and keep you laughing with his awkward antics. He is very emotionally attached, attentive, and loves to be with people. This guy is a serious cuddle-bug! He will chase a tennis ball through the yard, but hasn't quite learned how to fetch yet. Sometimes his top lip will get stuck and his bottom canine tooth will peek out in the silliest ways. Gweeb is housebroken and crate trained. He would love a family that he can love hard, one that he can entertain, and one that enjoys a good laugh.
Photo Album of Gweeb: https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.523012947756876.1073741849.162554320469409&type=1&l=a6dc542985
More VIDEOS of Gweebie: http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLYDnJXruR1h3EyXeE1eQfeZ_sLZ7hx8r0
Our adoption fee is $300. All dogs are current on vaccinations, spayed or neutered, micro-chipped, on heartworm prevention, and are fed top of the line grain-free food.www.savingpitbulls.org 1/30/21 3:35 PM

animal.description:
Friends to the Forlorn
Adopt-a-BullBreed: Boxer/Pit Bull Terrier Gender: Female Estimated Date of Birth: April 17, 2010 Size: 65lbs Location: Dallas, GA
RESCUING TONYA
Tonya was taken into animal control as a stray on 3/31/2013. After spending 16 days in AC, her time was up and she was on that day's euthanasia list at Fulton County. We pulled Tonya with only 2 hours to spare on April 16, 2013 and she has been living with us ever since.
At the shelter, Tonya had an injury to her rear right paw and a horrible case of kennel cough/upper respiratory infection. Animal Control gave her medicine to kill the maggots that had filled her nasty wound on her right rear paw. She has been spayed, vaccinated, microchipped, dewormed, and she tested negative for heartworms. Tonyas foot has also completely healed and she is a happy, healthy girl.
ABOUT TONYA
Tonya obviously knew what it is like to live in a house as she immediately jumped up on the couch and made herself at home. She is one sweet girl. She jumped right up into the car, enjoyed her bath, hoarded some bones, ate her dinner, and went into her crate on her own to go to sleep.
Not only does Tonya have the best pittie smile in town, she has the silliest, most amazing ears. This girl is packed full of personality and she loves toys. She is crate trained, housebroken, loves people, loves to play, and is good with kids. Tonya would love an active family. She would be a great hiking companion and would love a family to teach her new tricks as she is very smart. She is very confident and is all about making her people happy. Tonya would do best as an only dog and she it not suited for a home with cats. Tonya is a strong, active lady and she will require a secure, 6' privacy fenced yard where she can play with her family and maybe chase a squirrel or two or a person who is strong and willing to work on her leash manners. She is such an incredible lady and is sure to put a smile on your face!
Photo Album of Tonya: http://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.510779675646870.1073741838.162554320469409&type=1&l=6c417d0a67
MORE VIDEO of Tonya: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLYDnJXruR1h2coMpCnT6JTTmibLxTjmWP
Tonya has her own FACEBOOK PAGE: https://www.facebook.com/FindAHomeForTonya
Our adoption fee is $300. All dogs are current on vaccinations, spayed or neutered, micro-chipped, on heartworm prevention, and are fed top of the line grain-free food.www.savingpitbulls.org

animal.description:
Friends to the Forlorn
Adopt-a-BullBreed: Pit Bull Gender: Female Estimated Date of Birth: July 16, 2008 Size: 96 lbs Location: Dallas, GA
RESCUING GINGER
Ginger's owner died on Mother's Day. She was alone in her backyard with family members attempting to care for her. No one could get near Ginger as she was exhibiting extremely aggressive behaviors. Jason was called to help and was able to wrestle Ginger into his van to transport her to our vet. Once at the vet, her demeanor changed completely she was sweet, giving the staff kisses and allowed them to bathe her and even cut her nails.
Ginger had already been spayed. Her leg was broken long ago and has healed funny, but our biggest concern was the mass on her rear end. We took her to GVS for evaluation. They did an ultra-sound that determined it is non-cancerous and the vet thought he could remove the lipoma. He wanted this mass removed ASAP as there is a concern that it would hinder the functionality of her urethra. The mass was removed on July 26, 2013 (it was probably the size of a cantaloupe!), and she has recovered wonderfully. As if Ginger couldn't catch a break, she was also heartworm positive. She has since been treated and is heartworm-free.
ABOUT GINGER
Ginger is a very large, low-energy gal. She is house-broken and crate-trained. She is cautious around new people and will keep her distance, but given a little space, she will warm up quickly. Once she is comfortable, she will give you sweet little kisses. She has a few doggie friends in her foster home and is crate-trained and housebroken. She does not require daily exercise and is more than happy to nap the day away at your side. This house-hippo is a very easy girl to care for and she has a lot of sweet love to give!
Photo Album of Ginger: https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.553269571397880.1073741865.162554320469409&type=1&l=487f816a7e
MORE VIDEO of Ginger: http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLYDnJXruR1h03Ny1M-dlrPQ_P4CObqE0A

animal.description: I pulled Billy and his two brothers from a high-kill shelter in AL. They were dumped in a rural area of Mobile, and brought into the shelter, skinny and very frightened. They have been inoculated, neutered, and given flea & tick and heartworm prevention. After their vetting, they were brought to an excellent kennel, where the owner not only took phenomenal care of them, he also made sure they got lots of fresh air, exercise, and socialization. He told me that these puppies are super-sweet, and with patience and some training, they will all make awesome pets! Billy (yellow lab), Bob (red lab), and Tango (black lab) are coming up today, Sun, 7/9, from AL, to become Yankee-pups. I can't wait to meet my babies!! If you are interested in any of these puppies, please call Sindee. 914-299-3700.

animal.description:
Eddie was rescued from Animal Control. He is your typical Jack Russel with lots of energy and assertive tendencies.
Est 10 years old
The standard adoption fee is $150, but it may vary depending on the situation and the animal. This includes vetting such as shots, spaying or neutering, microchipping, deworming, and heartworm testing if the animal is over six months of age.
Please note**** We are a volunteer organization. Adoption events are held every Saturday 10-2 at our facility located st 2049 Badin Rd. Most of our animals are in foster homes. Please contact the foster if you would like to meet one of our rescues.
You may complete an application for approval to start the adoption process at www.stanlycountyhumanesociety.org, under the 'Adoption' tab.
Thanks for considering adopting a rescue pet!
Follow us on FaceBook!Adoption fees for pets with Stanly County Humane Society are to cover the following:
*Spay/Neuter
*Heartworm/Feline Testing
*All standard vaccinations
*Rabies Vaccination
*Microchip

animal.description:
Meet Mich 
Courtesy Post 

Foster Home Needed.
If you are interested in fostering please fill out a application here: http://www.thepitstoprescue.com/foster.html 
Singles alert!!?? Looking for LOVEE!!?? MITCH is young, athletic, and quite a thoughtful guy. He likes long walks in whatever setting you prefer, long distance jumping, dog boxing, and fine dining. His favorite meal is anything he can swipe counterside, with a side of dog food. So he is definitely “high end”. He prefers muddy gravel roads, but long walks on beaches or concrete will do. He works out daily and would love a buddy to do so with. He’s also extremely social, so any kind of 4 legged dog friends are welcomed! He’s not really a cat guy and prefers to stick with his own kind. He absolutely agrees to pose with whatever selfie you’re thinking of that day, and will also work for treats. Let us know if you’re interested in kicking your single gig for this hunk! We definitely have the hook up!! Do you LOVE to laugh? Do you love the outdoors? Do you like tricks (not your ordinary tricks!) Do you need a little “happy” to rub off onto you???MICH is your guy! I have NEVER seen a dog make such a fool of himself, have no shame, love every other dog and person, and just love life SO much.....and also be homeless. Mich has been homeless for OVER a YEAR now. Mich was surrendered to the shelter in July 2016 at 5 mo old. With hours left before euthanasia, the litter was rescued. His other 3 siblings got adopted right away, and he was left behind. He's looking for a family who would enjoy an outside, sometimes inside pet...have children who love to play fetch.and have no kitties! He can be an inside dog because he loves to snuggle and watch tv or sleep in the bed, but he is an outdoor dog at heart. This boy runs and runs and runs circles around the yard with his rope, ball, bone, stick, anything he can find in his mouth! He’s a ham!! He needs a wide open space or woods to run, where he can explore! He's hard to keep fenced in, so if you have open room for him to run, that's what he needs the most! He loves to go explore but always comes back home :) He responds very well to commands such as sit, down, wait, and ok. He loves to go on car rides and outings! He’s wonderful on the leash and welcomes strangers with a wag! His favorite place in the world is the dog park! He’s super trainable and hasn’t attended formal classes, but training classes will be included in his adoption! He’s fairly small, around 35lb, and won’t get any bigger. He is up to date on shots, neutered, and microchipped. If your family is looking for an addition or you’re looking to be loved unconditionally, amused daily, and willing to give a baby a second chance at a good start in life, Mitch is who you are looking for!!! Mich is looking for an adopter OR FOSTER!! His current foster can no longer keep him, as she has too many pets to give him the attention he deserves. He is kenneled too much and needs OUT!! 

If you are interested in fostering or adopting, please go to www.thepitstoprescue.com 

To adopt Mich, fill out our application here! https://form.jotform.com/42655372023147 To foster Mich, fill out our application here! https://form.jotform.com/42655245603150
